name: expansive
trans: a.(指人)健谈的，开朗的；可扩大的，可伸展的
广阔的：great expanse；健谈的，外向的：open, talkative, effusive

sentences.english: expansive beaches
sentences.chinese: 广阔的海滩

sentences.english: She flung her arms out in an expansive gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她尽情地张开双臂。

detailed_translations.english: very large in area, or using a lot of space

sentences.english: soldiers learning camouflage technique
sentences.chinese: 在学习伪装技术的士兵

sentences.english: the camouflage netting over the tanks
sentences.chinese: 坦克上的伪装网

detailed_translations.english: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else

name: flirt
trans: 调情：behave amorously；无规则地快速运动：make irregular movements

sentences.english: Dad's flirting with all the ladies, or they're all flirting with him, as usual.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在和所有的女士打情骂俏，或者说她们都在和他调情，跟平常一样。

detailed_translations.english: to behave towards someone in a way that shows that you are sexually attracted to them, although you do not really want a relationship with them
someone who flirts with people

name: nudge
trans: 用肘推以引起注意：push elbow；说服某人做某事：persuade

sentences.english: She slipped her arm under his and gave him a nudge.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速地把胳膊放在他的胳膊下面，给了他轻轻一推。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动；用肘轻推；没完没了抱怨的人
detailed_translations.english: Nudge is also a noun

detailed_translations.chinese: 推进；用肘轻推；向…不停地唠叨
detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone a short distance by gently pushing

name: onset
trans: 攻击，进攻：attack, assault；起始，开始：begins

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻
detailed_translations.english: the beginning of something, especially something bad

name: appeal
trans: 申请：application; 起诉：charge, crime, accuse

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

sentences.english: It remained very difficult to procure food, fuel, and other daily necessities.
sentences.chinese: 当时仍然很难获得食品、燃料和其他日用必需品。

detailed_translations.english: to obtain something, especially something that is difficult to get

name: articulate
trans: 清晰地表达：clearly, distinctly; 表达清晰的：able, express, clearly

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

sentences.english: a prodigal lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: spending money, wasting time etc in a careless way
someone who spends money carelessly and wastes their time – used humorously

sentences.english: his physical prowess
sentences.chinese: 他优异的体能

sentences.english: military prowess
sentences.chinese: 精良的军事技能

detailed_translations.english: great skill at doing something

name: oblivious
trans: 不知道的，不知情的：lacking awareness, not informed

sentences.english: She lay motionless where she was, oblivious to pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一动不动地躺在原地，感觉不到疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: If you are oblivious to something or oblivious of it, you are not aware of it

name: liken
trans: 显示相似，把…比作：show as similar

sentences.english: She likens marriage to slavery.
sentences.chinese: 她把婚姻比作奴役。

detailed_translations.english: If you liken one thing or person to another thing or person, you say that they are similar

sentences.english: the country’s economic plight
sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.english: he plighted his word to attempt it

detailed_translations.english: a very bad situation that someone is in
to give or pledge (one's word)

sentences.english: The walls had been blackened and scorched by fire.
sentences.chinese: 这些墙被大火熏黑了。

detailed_translations.english: if you scorch something, or if it scorches, its surface burns slightly and changes colour
a mark made on something where its surface has been burnt

name: edifice
trans: n.宏伟的建筑(如宫殿、教堂)
大厦；大建筑物：massive structure；基础，基本结构：basic form

sentences.english: Their head office was an imposing edifice.
sentences.chinese: 他们的总部大楼是一幢宏伟建筑。

detailed_translations.english: a building, especially a large one

name: terminology
trans: 专业术语：special terms or expressions

sentences.english: computer terminology
sentences.chinese: 计算机术语

detailed_translations.english: the technical words or expressions that are used in a particular subject

sentences.english: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

sentences.english: The pair were reconciled after Jackson made a public apology.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊公开道歉之后，这两个人又言归于好了。

detailed_translations.english: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

sentences.english: families who hoarded food during the strike
sentences.chinese: 罢工期间囤积食品的家庭

detailed_translations.english: to collect and save large amounts of food, money etc, especially when it is not necessary to do so
a collection of things that someone hides somewhere, especially so they can use them later

sentences.english: children’s temper tantrums
sentences.chinese: 小孩子的脾气发作

detailed_translations.english: a sudden short period when someone, especially a child, behaves very angrily and unreasonably

name: reel
trans: 感到眩晕：from being twirled around；蹒跚地走路：swaying from side to side

sentences.english: Andy reeled away from the bar and knocked over his stool.
sentences.chinese: 安迪踉跄着离开吧台，把凳子都撞倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 摇摇晃晃地移动，蹒跚；眩晕，发昏
detailed_translations.english: to walk in an unsteady way and almost fall over, as if you are drunk
a round object onto which film, wire, a special string for fishing etc can be wound
to wind (cotton, thread, etc) onto a reel

name: menace
trans: 威胁，使处于危险：intention to harm

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

sentences.english: There was menace in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他的语气里带着威胁。

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有危险性的人(或物)；威胁，威吓
detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is dangerous
to threaten

name: outlandish
trans: 古怪的，奇异的：out of the ordinary, bizarre

sentences.english: outlandish clothes
sentences.chinese: 奇装异服

sentences.english: Her story seemed so outlandish.
sentences.chinese: 她的故事太不寻常了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的；奇异的；异国风格的；偏僻的
detailed_translations.english: strange and unusual

sentences.english: She made her debut in a 1937 production of "Hamlet."
sentences.chinese: 她在1937年《哈姆雷特》的演出中首次登台。

detailed_translations.english: the first public appearance of an entertainer, sports player etc or of something new and important

name: diffuse
trans: v.散布，(光等)漫射；a.漫射的，散漫的
啰嗦的：verbose；不集中的，扩散的：not concentrated；扩展，散开：extend, scatter

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

name: repertoire
trans: （技术、设备或原料等的）详单：complete list

sentences.english: the behavioural repertoire of infants
sentences.chinese: 婴幼儿的行为能力

detailed_translations.english: all the plays, pieces of music etc that a performer or group knows and can perform

name: shrewd
trans: 精明的，机敏的：cleverness or judgment；刺骨的，强烈的：discomfort

sentences.english: Malcolm is a shrewd businessman.
sentences.chinese: 马尔科姆是个精明的商人。

sentences.english: She was shrewd enough to guess who was responsible.
sentences.chinese: 她很精明，一猜就知道是谁干的。

sentences.english: Capra looked at her with shrewd eyes.
sentences.chinese: 卡普拉眼神犀利地看着她。

detailed_translations.english: good at judging what people or situations are really like

name: quash
trans: 镇压，阻止：put a stop to

sentences.english: The High Court later quashed his conviction for murder.
sentences.chinese: 高等法院后来撤销了他犯有谋杀罪的判决。

sentences.english: The decision was quashed by the House of Lords.
sentences.chinese: 这个决议被上议院推翻了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销；镇压；宣布无效；捣碎
detailed_translations.english: to officially say that a legal judgment or decision is no longer acceptable or correct

sentences.english: Being one myself, I know that they are not just some figment, but the truth of the matter is, gaming is male dominated, the same way knitting is dominated by females.
sentences.chinese: 因为我本人就是一个游戏迷，所以知道这样的女孩绝非虚构。 然而事情的真相是，视频游戏是男人的地盘，就好像编织衣物大多由女人从事一样。

detailed_translations.english: something that you imagine is real, but does not exist

name: curtail
trans: 缩短，削减：less in extent or duration

sentences.english: The new law will curtail police powers.
sentences.chinese: 这条新法规将削弱警方的权力。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce or limit something

sentences.english: King Alfonso XIII abdicated in favour of his eldest son.
sentences.chinese: 国王阿方索十三世把王位让给了长子。

sentences.english: The king was forced to abdicate the throne .
sentences.chinese: 国王被迫退位。

detailed_translations.english: to give up the position of being king or queen

name: fantasy
trans: 幻想：imaginative fiction；产生幻想：form a mental picture

sentences.english: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象， 幻想； 想象的产物
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

sentences.english: a class of boisterous five-year-olds
sentences.chinese: 一班活泼爱动的五岁孩子

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child, who is boisterous makes a lot of noise and has a lot of energy

name: boycott
trans: 联合抵制，拒绝参与：concerted refusal

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

name: ephemeral
trans: a.朝生暮死的；生命短暂的

sentences.english: Fashion is by nature ephemeral.
sentences.chinese: 从本质上说，时尚不过是一时的潮流。

detailed_translations.english: existing or popular for only a short time

name: pluck
trans: n.在困难面前足智多谋的勇气，胆量；精力；v.拔毛；弹拉
敢于面对困难的勇气：courage；弹奏（弦乐）：strings pulling releasing

sentences.english: It takes a lot of pluck to stand up to a bully.
sentences.chinese: 不向恃强凌弱者屈服需要很大勇气。

detailed_translations.english: courage and determination
to pull something quickly in order to remove it

name: counterfeit
trans: 仿制的，假冒的：imitation；仿制：fraudulent replica；伪装成：false appearance

sentences.english: They admitted counterfeiting documents.
sentences.chinese: 他们承认伪造了文件。

sentences.english: Levi Strauss says counterfeits of the company's jeans are flooding Europe.
sentences.chinese: 利瓦伊·斯特劳斯说该公司牛仔裤的仿冒品充斥着欧洲市场。

detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly in order to deceive people
Counterfeit is also a noun
made to look exactly like something else, in order to deceive people

sentences.english: The elephant population is dwindling.
sentences.chinese: 大象的数量在减少。

sentences.english: His money had dwindled away.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

sentences.english: She badgered me for weeks until I finally gave in.
sentences.chinese: 她缠了我好几个星期，直到我最终答应了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 獾；獾皮；（大写）獾州人（美国威斯康星州人的别称）；<动><澳>毛鼻袋熊
detailed_translations.english: an animal that has black and white fur, lives in holes in the ground, and is active at night
to try to persuade someone by asking them something several times

sentences.english: The medical system is facing collapse because of an exodus of doctors.
sentences.chinese: 由于医生大批离去，该医疗体系正面临崩溃。

detailed_translations.english: If there is an exodus of people from a place, a lot of people leave that place at the same time

name: nip
trans: 少量：small amount；小口吃喝：in small amounts

sentences.english: Try to nip this kind of bad behaviour in the bud.
sentences.chinese: 要尽早制止这种不良行为。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from becoming a problem by stopping it as soon as it starts
the act or result of biting something lightly or pressing something between two fingers, edges, or surfaces

name: simulate
trans: 假装，模仿：take on the appearance；模拟：create a representation

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

sentences.english: a symbol of Arab courage, to be venerated for generations
sentences.chinese: 受到世代尊崇的阿拉伯人勇气的象征

detailed_translations.english: to honour or respect someone or something because they are old, holy, or connected with the past

name: posture
trans: n.姿势，体态；态度；v.故作姿态
姿势，姿态：way of holding the body；故作姿态，装模作样：pretended attitude

sentences.english: her upright posture
sentences.chinese: 她笔挺的姿势

detailed_translations.english: the way you position your body when sitting or standing

name: negotiate
trans: 商量，谈判：by mutual agreement；谋划：plan out

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: He’s my son, in the figurative sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 打个比方，他就像是我的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的
detailed_translations.english: a figurative word or phrase is used in a different way from its usual meaning, to give you a particular idea or picture in your mind

name: unkempt
trans: 凌乱的，无序的：lacking in order

sentences.english: His hair was unkempt and filthy.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发没梳洗，十分脏腻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 蓬乱的，不整洁的；（言语等）粗野的
detailed_translations.english: unkempt hair or plants have not been cut and kept neat

sentences.english: He scrutinized the document.
sentences.chinese: 他细阅了这份文件。

sentences.english: She scrutinized his face.
sentences.chinese: 她细细端详他的脸。

detailed_translations.english: to examine someone or something very carefully

name: contagious
trans: 传染的：communicate；（情绪等）唤起共鸣的：exciting a similar feeling

sentences.english: her contagious enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 她那富有感染力的热情

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, attitude, or action is contagious, other people are quickly affected by it and begin to have it or do it

name: succumb
trans: 屈服：yield to superior strength；死亡：death

sentences.english: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于只抽一支烟的诱惑。

detailed_translations.english: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

name: plateau
trans: 高原：raised above；稳定时期，平台期：stable level

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

name: enamel
trans: 涂亮漆；使具有光滑或亮泽的表面：give a glossy surface；用亮丽的表面装饰：adorn

sentences.english: ...a white enamel saucepan.
sentences.chinese: …一个白色搪瓷煮锅。

detailed_translations.english: a hard shiny substance that is put onto metal, clay etc for decoration or protection

name: gloss
trans: 简短解释：brief explanation, obscure；（欺骗性的）光鲜外表：attractive appearance；敷衍潦草做事（甚至忽略）：too lightly；开脱（罪名）：less bad

sentences.english: This gel will add gloss to even the dullest hair.
sentences.chinese: 用了这种发胶，即使最干枯的头发也会增添光泽。

detailed_translations.english: a bright shine on a surface

name: extrapolate
trans: （通过逻辑）判断：form an opinion through reasoning

sentences.english: Extrapolating from his latest findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking.
sentences.chinese: 从他最近的发现推断，他估计大约80%的这类死亡可能归因于吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to use facts about the present or about one thing or group to make a guess about the future or about other things or groups

name: reactionary
trans: 反对改革的，极保守的：opposition to progress

sentences.english: reactionary attitudes
sentences.chinese: 反动的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 保守的，反动的；反动主义的；反对改革的
detailed_translations.english: very strongly opposed to any social or political change - used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 反动分子；反动派；保守派
detailed_translations.english: someone who strongly opposes any social or political change - used to show disapproval

name: philanthropic
trans: 博爱的，为他人着想的：welfare of others

sentences.english: Some of the best services for the seniors are sponsored by philanthropic organizations.
sentences.chinese: 一些一流老人服务机构是由慈善组织资助的。

detailed_translations.english: a philanthropic person or institution gives money and help to people who are poor or in trouble

name: blueprint
trans: 蓝图，详细计划：architects’ plans; 事先计划：work out, in advance

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

name: rapt
trans: a.专心致志的，全神贯注的
狂喜的，狂热的：pleasurable emotion；全神贯注的：deeply absorbed

sentences.english: They listened with rapt attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们全神贯注地听着。

sentences.english: the rapt expression on his face
sentences.chinese: 他脸上专注的表情

detailed_translations.english: so interested in something that you do not notice anything else

name: comprehend
trans: 理解，了解：grasp；包括，包含：contain or hold within

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

sentences.english: She will never forsake her vegetarian principles.
sentences.chinese: 她绝不会放弃自己的素食主义原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing, using, or having something that you enjoy

name: atrocious
trans: 极坏的，极其残忍的：extremely wicked; 让人极为不满的：extremely unsatisfactory

sentences.english: The judge said he had committed atrocious crimes against women.
sentences.chinese: 该法官称他对妇女犯下了残暴的罪行。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone's behaviour or their actions as atrocious, you mean that it is unacceptable because it is extremely violent or cruel

sentences.english: A massive arms-smuggling plan has been foiled by the CIA.
sentences.chinese: 一项大规模的军火走私计划已被中央情报局挫败。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衬托；阻止，挡开；挫败；贴箔于
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad that someone is planning to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 箔，金属薄片；衬托，烘托；叶形片
detailed_translations.english: metal sheets that are as thin as paper, used for wrapping food

detailed_translations.chinese: 面向文件的翻译语言（file-Oriented interpretive language）

name: wax
trans: 月亮渐满：increase in phase of the moon；用蜡涂、处理或上光：coat；增大，增强：increase

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc
to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

sentences.english: She pulled the garment on and zipped it up.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上衣服并拉好拉链。

sentences.english: She works in the garment district of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 她在曼哈顿的服装加工区工作。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing

sentences.english: Measures need to be taken to mitigate the environmental effects of burning more coal.
sentences.chinese: 需要采取措施来减轻燃煤增加对环境造成的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to make a situation or the effects of something less unpleasant, harmful, or serious

name: mosque
trans: n.清真寺(伊斯兰教的寺庙)

sentences.english: Would you go to church or the synagogue or the mosque?
sentences.chinese: 你会去教堂，犹太教会，或者清真寺吗？

sentences.english: If there is to be a new city church, they argue, then why not a mosque?
sentences.chinese: 他们置疑说，如果要修建一个新的城市教堂为什么不能是座清真寺呢？

sentences.english: Tell the congregation of a church or mosque that existence is too vulgar an attribute to fasten onto their God, and they will brand you an atheist.
sentences.chinese: 告诉教堂或清真寺的会众们，存在，是强加在他们的上帝身上的一种过于庸俗的属性，他们将会指责你为无神论者。

detailed_translations.english: a building in which Muslims worship

name: delegate
trans: 代理人，代表：representative for another；移交（权力，任务等）：possession or safekeeping of another

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

sentences.english: People need time to grieve after the death of a loved one.
sentences.chinese: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。

sentences.english: She grieved the loss of her only son.
sentences.chinese: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died
if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy

sentences.english: the Bering Strait
sentences.chinese: 白令海峡

detailed_translations.english: a narrow passage of water between two areas of land, usually connecting two seas

name: bargain
trans: n.交易; 物美价廉的东西；v.讨价还价

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger
to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

name: humble
trans: 谦逊的：meekness, modesty；顺从的，谦卑的：humility or unseemly submissiveness

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

sentences.english: The leaders have been ousted from power by nationalists.
sentences.chinese: 那些领导人已被民族主义者赶下了台。

sentences.english: The Republicans may oust him in November.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人可能在11月罢免他。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is ousted from a position of power, job, or place, they are forced to leave it

name: craven
trans: 非常懦弱的，因胆小而遭人鄙视的：lacking courage

sentences.english: He had a craven fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 他非常害怕乘飞机。

detailed_translations.english: completely lacking courage

sentences.english: a nebulous ghostly figure
sentences.chinese: 幽灵般朦胧的身影

detailed_translations.chinese: 朦胧的；星云的，星云状的
detailed_translations.english: a shape that is nebulous is unclear and has no definite edges

sentences.english: The tidal wave inundated vast areas of cropland.
sentences.chinese: 海啸淹没了大片农田。

detailed_translations.english: to cover an area with a large amount of water

sentences.english: paper with a yellowish tint
sentences.chinese: 泛黄的纸张

detailed_translations.english: a small amount of a particular colour
to slightly change the colour of something, especially hair

name: construct
trans: 建造，建立：form；创造，相出：create imagination

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

sentences.english: She spent her life pandering to the wants of her children.
sentences.chinese: 她一生都在设法满足子女的需要。

sentences.english: The gallery closed down for want of funding.
sentences.chinese: 那家画廊由于缺乏资金关闭了。

detailed_translations.english: something that you need or want

sentences.english: He was fired for shirking.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷懒被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing something you should do, because you are lazy

sentences.english: The UN deplored the invasion as a ‘violation of international law’.
sentences.chinese: 联合国谴责这次入侵 “违反了国际法” 。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谴责；悲悼；哀叹；对…深感遗憾
detailed_translations.english: to disapprove of something very strongly and criticize it severely, especially publicly

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

sentences.english: There was Helena eavesdropping outside the door.
sentences.chinese: 海伦娜当时在门外偷听。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately listen secretly to other people’s conversations

sentences.english: He was aware of every nuance in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 他听得出她声音中的每一个细微变化。

sentences.english: subtle nuances of meaning
sentences.chinese: 含义的细微差别

detailed_translations.english: a very slight, hardly noticeable difference in manner, colour, meaning etc

name: trivial
trans: 琐碎的，无足轻重的：little importance

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: abuse
trans: 辱骂，抨击：condemn or vilify; 不正当的或不合理使用的：wrong or improper use; 过分过量使用的：use excessively

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: brash
trans: 愚勇的，鲁莽的：foolishly adventurous; 缺乏判断力的，不明智的：poor judgment

sentences.english: brash journalists
sentences.chinese: 嚣张的新闻记者

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼的，傲慢的；仓促的，性急的
detailed_translations.english: behaving too confidently and speaking too loudly – used to show disapproval

name: fatigue
trans: 疲惫：weariness or exhaustion；（让人厌倦的）苦差事：causes weariness

sentences.english: She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 她希望睡一觉之后会消除疲劳。

sentences.english: I have got over my weakness and fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 我已从虚弱和疲劳中恢复过来了。

sentences.english: Everyone has analogy fatigue at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，人人都有类比疲劳。

detailed_translations.english: very great tiredness

name: extraneous
trans: 无关的：no relevance；非主要因素的：not essential

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

name: trespass
trans: 非法入侵；违反；冒犯：enter unlawfully offense

sentences.english: He will be prosecuted for trespass.
sentences.chinese: 他将因擅闯私地而被起诉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罪过；非法侵入；过失；擅自进入
detailed_translations.english: the offence of going onto someone’s land without their permission

sentences.english: A happy ending is only possible because the hero has first vanquished the dragons.
sentences.chinese: 只有主人公先把那些恶龙制服，快乐的结局才有可能。

detailed_translations.english: to defeat someone or something completely

name: severe
trans: 严厉的，要求严格的：exacting standards；难以承受的，艰难的：difficult to endure

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: diehard
trans: 顽固的，保守的／顽固的人，保守的人：determined, devoted/opposes change, refuses new ideas

sentences.english: John is a diehard conservative and is completely against abortion.
sentences.chinese: 约翰是个顽固的保守主义者，坚决反对堕胎。

detailed_translations.english: someone who opposes change and refuses to accept new ideas

name: dart
trans: 突然移动，猛冲，狂奔：suddenly；公开侮辱：intended to hurt another’s feelings

sentences.english: a poisoned dart
sentences.chinese: 毒镖

sentences.english: She darted a sly sideways glance at Bramwell.
sentences.chinese: 她狡猾地斜瞟了布莱威尔一眼。

detailed_translations.english: a small pointed object that is thrown or shot as a weapon, or one that is thrown in the game of darts
If you dart a look at someone or something, or if your eyes dart to them, you look at them very quickly
to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction

name: fawn
trans: n.未满周岁的小鹿；v.巴结，奉承
阿谀奉承：seek favor by flattery

sentences.english: The fawn ran to the top of the ridge.
sentences.chinese: 那只小鹿跑上山脊。

detailed_translations.english: to seek attention and admiration (from) by cringing and flattering
a young  deer
having a pale yellow-brown colour

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: gash
trans: 深长的伤口或切口：deep cut；砍伤，切开：make gash

sentences.english: Blood poured from a deep gash in her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 鲜血从她额头上一道很深的伤口汩汩地流出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 很深的裂缝；砍得很深的伤口
detailed_translations.english: a large deep cut or hole in something, for example in a person’s skin

detailed_translations.chinese: 划开；砍入很深；（使）负深伤

name: adhere
trans: 依附，粘着：stick; 服从，遵守：according to the commands; 坚定地支持：steadfast support

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

sentences.english: The computer and the human mind have different but complementary abilities.
sentences.chinese: 电脑与人脑各不相同，却又互为补充。

detailed_translations.english: complementary things go well together, although they are usually different

sentences.english: The driver was an amiable young man.
sentences.chinese: 司机是位友善的年轻人。

sentences.english: She was in an amiable mood.
sentences.chinese: 她心情很好。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to like

detailed_translations.chinese: (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

name: relentless
trans: 残酷的，无情的：no abatement or severity；固执的，不肯妥协的：yielding in one’s purpose

sentences.english: her relentless determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 她要成功的坚定决心

sentences.english: a regime that was relentless in its persecution of dissidents
sentences.chinese: 无情迫害持不同政见者的政权

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；残酷的；不间断的
detailed_translations.english: strict, cruel, or determined, without ever stopping

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

name: taciturn
trans: 沉默寡言的，话少的：disinclined to talk

sentences.english: He is a taciturn man who dislikes parties.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个不喜欢聚会、天性沉默寡言的人。

sentences.english: But these men were a taciturn lot , picking their words carefully.
sentences.chinese: 但是这些人都是沉默寡言的人， 说起话来字斟句酌，非常谨慎。

sentences.english: We took a floatplane to the trail head. Our taciturn guide pointed out that it was this robust aircraft that had helped to open up the wilderness in the Fifties.
sentences.chinese: 我们乘坐一架水上飞机来到小道的顶端，沉默寡言的导游指着飞机说，五十年代人们正是在这种飞机的得力帮助下开拓荒野。

detailed_translations.english: speaking very little, so that you seem unfriendly

name: exponent
trans: 倡导者，支持者：advocates；实践者，典型代表：full realization

sentences.english: The fatigue life increases with decreasing modulus of surface layer in a power function with a negative exponent.
sentences.chinese: 沥青面层的疲劳寿命随着面层材料模量的降低以负指数的幂函数形式增加；

sentences.english: In addition, this paper also suggests that the reason for high burning rate-pressure exponent is deflagration of some components in propellant.
sentences.chinese: 此外，本文还提出，火药中某些组分的爆燃是导致一些火药燃速压力指数较高的原因。

sentences.english: Examining the influence of the sports factors on the step exponent of colleges students with the experiment method, questionnaire survey method and Mathematical Statistics method.
sentences.chinese: 采用实验法、问卷调查法和数理统计法，观察运动因素对大学生台阶指数的影响。

detailed_translations.english: a sign written above and to the right of a number or letter to show how many times that quantity is to be multiplied by itself

name: exceptional
trans: 例外的，特别的，非凡的：uncommon, extraordinary

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

sentences.english: People expect others to be honest, which is why conmen find it so easy to hoodwink people.
sentences.chinese: 人们期待他人是诚实的，所以骗子很容易行骗得逞。

detailed_translations.english: to trick someone in a clever way so that you can get an advantage for yourself

name: germinate
trans: 发芽：begin to grow；出现：come into being

sentences.english: Some seed varieties germinate fast, so check every day or so.
sentences.chinese: 有一些品种的种子发芽快，所以差不多每天都要察看一下。

detailed_translations.english: if a seed germinates, or if it is germinated, it begins to grow

name: chase
trans: 镂雕（金属）以装饰：decorate; 驱赶：force out

sentences.english: The dogs saw him running and chased him.
sentences.chinese: 那些狗看到他在跑就追他。

sentences.english: kids chasing around the house
sentences.chinese: 在屋里追逐嬉戏的孩子们

detailed_translations.chinese: 追逐， 追赶， 追求
detailed_translations.english: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them

name: convert
trans: v.使改变(信仰等)；n.改变信仰的人
被改变宗教信仰的人：converted；使改变信仰：bring over from brief；改变，转化：alter

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

sentences.english: intrepid explorers
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的探险家

detailed_translations.english: willing to do dangerous things or go to dangerous places – often used humorously

name: rudimentary
trans: 初始的，未发展的：earliest development；最根本的，基础的：first principles

sentences.english: Gradually, I acquired a rudimentary knowledge of music.
sentences.chinese: 我逐渐掌握了基本的音乐知识。

sentences.english: my rudimentary German
sentences.chinese: 我粗浅的德语

detailed_translations.chinese: 基本的；初步的；退化的；残遗的；未发展的
detailed_translations.english: a rudimentary knowledge or understanding of a subject is very simple and basic

name: rail
trans: n.栏杆；铁轨；v.咒骂，猛烈指责
猛骂，猛烈抨击：revile or scold

sentences.english: the American rail system
sentences.chinese: 美国铁路系统

sentences.english: a high-speed rail network
sentences.chinese: 一个高速铁路网络

sentences.english: Passengers want a better rail service .
sentences.chinese: 乘客希望有更好的铁路服务。

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel and its rail links with London
sentences.chinese: 英吉利海峡隧道及其与伦敦之间的铁路连接

sentences.english: I need to buy a rail ticket .
sentences.chinese: 我要买一张火车票。

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票价

detailed_translations.english: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

detailed_translations.chinese: 栏杆，横杆；铁轨，轨道；铁路
detailed_translations.english: the railway system

sentences.english: He is increasingly active in harrying the government in late-night debates.
sentences.chinese: 他愈来愈积极地在午夜辩论节目中不断攻击政府。

detailed_translations.english: to keep asking someone for something in a way that is upsetting or annoying

detailed_translations.chinese: (Harry)人名；(英)哈里，哈丽(女名)(教名Henry、Harriet的昵称)

name: signal
trans: （在重要性、成就方面）非同寻常的：standing above；给出信号：direct or notify

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

detailed_translations.chinese: 诘问；激烈质问；以麻梳梳理

name: flourish
trans: v.昌盛，兴旺；活跃而有影响

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

sentences.english: The officials said that they had been offered bribes before an important game.
sentences.chinese: 这几名官员说，有人在一场重要比赛之前向他们行贿。

sentences.english: The only way we could get into the country was by bribing the border officials.
sentences.chinese: 我们要进入这个国家，唯一的办法是贿赂边境官员。

detailed_translations.english: money or a gift that you illegally give someone to persuade them to do something for you
to illegally give someone, especially a public official, money or a gift in order to persuade them to do something for you

name: swagger
trans: 大摇大摆地走，趾高气昂地走：arrogant, pompous；自夸，吹嘘：boast

sentences.english: He swaggered over towards me.
sentences.chinese: 他趾高气扬地向我走来。

sentences.english: He walked with something of a swagger.
sentences.chinese: 他有点大摇大摆地走着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吓唬；趾高气扬地行走或行事
detailed_translations.english: to walk proudly, swinging your shoulders in a way that shows you are very confident – used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 大摇大摆；吹牛；威吓；下摆散开状的女式短大衣
detailed_translations.english: Swagger is also a noun

sentences.english: a bomb hoax
sentences.chinese: 虚假炸弹恐吓

sentences.english: (= telephone calls giving false information ) to the police
sentences.chinese: 恶作剧报警电话

detailed_translations.english: a false warning about something dangerous

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

name: tangible
trans: 可感知的：capable perceived；确凿的，真实的：real or concrete

sentences.english: The silence of the countryside was almost tangible .
sentences.chinese: 乡村的寂静几乎能感觉得到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有形的；切实的；可触摸的
detailed_translations.english: if something is tangible, you can touch or feel it

name: genteel
trans: a.上流社会的；装作彬彬有礼的
有教养的，不粗俗的：free from vulgarity

sentences.english: She broke into a genteel run.
sentences.chinese: 她优雅地跑了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有教养的，文雅的；上流社会的
detailed_translations.english: polite, gentle, or graceful

sentences.english: The housing market continues to languish.
sentences.chinese: 住宅市场继续疲软。

sentences.english: The shares are languishing at just 46p after yesterday’s fall.
sentences.chinese: 股价经历了昨天的下跌后，就停滞在46便士上了。

sentences.english: West Ham United are currently languishing at the bottom of the league.
sentences.chinese: 西汉姆联队目前在联赛中一直排名垫底。

detailed_translations.english: ifsomething languishes, it fails to improve and develop or become successful

sentences.english: He sketched her with quick, deft strokes.
sentences.chinese: 他给她画素描，下笔又快又熟练。

sentences.english: deft footwork
sentences.chinese: 敏捷的步法

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的
detailed_translations.english: a deft movement is skilful, and often quick

name: improvise
trans: 即兴而作：perform with little or no preparation

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: trickle
trans: 一滴一滴地流，缓缓地流：fall in drops

sentences.english: A tear trickled down the old man's cheek.
sentences.chinese: 一滴泪水顺着老人的面颊流了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滴；细细地流；慢慢地移动
detailed_translations.english: if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream
a thin slow flow of liquid

sentences.english: Do you think you can cajole some money out of your father?
sentences.chinese: 你认为你能从你父亲那里骗到一些钱吗?。

sentences.english: If a person often have lies flow and mouth, thus to cajole others, over time, he would lose the trust of the people.
sentences.chinese: 一个人如果经常有谎言流与口中，从而去哄骗他人，久而久之，他便会失去人们的信任。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them

name: orient
trans: a.上升的；v.确定方向；使熟悉情况
使确定方向，使熟悉或适应：determine position, make familiar

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东
detailed_translations.english: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

sentences.english: Fierce opposition thwarted the government’s plans.
sentences.chinese: 激烈的反对阻碍了政府计划的实施。

sentences.english: thwarted ambition
sentences.chinese: 未酬的壮志

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone from doing what they are trying to do

name: flatter
trans: 拍马屁，奉承，讨好：praise excessively；自我感觉良好：think highly of；使显得更漂亮：show advantageously

sentences.english: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
sentences.chinese: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太，称赞她的烹调手艺。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

name: pregnant
trans: 重要的，意味深长的：full of meaning；怀孕的：containing offspring

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: fanatic
trans: 狂热者：unreasoning enthusiasm；狂热的；盲信的：intense uncritical devotion

sentences.english: fanatics who represent a real danger to democracy
sentences.chinese: 对民主构成很大威胁的狂热分子

sentences.english: a religious fanatic
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热入迷者；盲信者；盲信
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political or religious ideas and is often dangerous
Fanatic means the same as

name: affirm
trans: 声称...为真，肯定...属实：valid or confirmed

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: principal
trans: 主要的，重要的：highest importance, rank

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

sentences.english: the lenient sentences handed down by some judges
sentences.chinese: 一些法官作出的宽大判决

sentences.english: School examiners say that marking has become more lenient in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 学校的阅卷人称近年来评分标准放宽了。

detailed_translations.english: not strict in the way you punish someone or in the standard you expect

sentences.english: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

sentences.english: the derivatives market
sentences.chinese: 金融衍生品市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 衍生物，派生物；导数
detailed_translations.english: something that has developed or been produced from something else

sentences.english: His mountain bike had 18 gears.
sentences.chinese: 他的山地自行车有18挡。

sentences.english: Andy drove cautiously along in third gear.
sentences.chinese: 安迪挂着三挡小心地行驶。

sentences.english: Does this thing have a reverse gear?
sentences.chinese: 这玩意儿有倒挡吗？

sentences.english: Any cyclist can climb a difficult hill; you just change gear.
sentences.chinese: 谁都能骑上难爬的山坡，只要换挡就行了。

sentences.english: Don’t turn off the engine while you’re still in gear.
sentences.chinese: 还挂着挡的时候不要关发动机。

sentences.english: It’s a good habit to take the car out of gear while you’re at a stoplight.
sentences.chinese: 等红灯时换空挡的习惯很好。

sentences.english: Colleges are not always geared to the needs of mature students.
sentences.chinese: 大学并不总是去适应成年学生的需要。

sentences.english: My training was geared toward winning gold.
sentences.chinese: 我的训练是为赢得金牌去规划的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 齿轮，传动装置，排挡；用具，设备；衣服
detailed_translations.english: the machinery in a vehicle such as a car, truck, or bicycle that you use to go comfortably at different speeds
If someone or something is geared to or toward a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose

sentences.english: His compliments disconcerted her a little.
sentences.chinese: 他的恭维让她有点儿尴尬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使仓皇失措；使困惑；破坏
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel slightly confused, embarrassed, or worried

name: farce
trans: （带有嘲讽元素的）滑稽戏：broadly satirical comedy；闹剧：ridiculous

sentences.english: She admitted that the interview had been a complete farce from start to finish.
sentences.chinese: 她承认，采访从头到尾完全是一场闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: an event or a situation that is very badly organized or does not happen properly, in a way that is silly and unreasonable

sentences.english: He is not doing this to annoy you.
sentences.chinese: 他做这件事并非是要惹你烦恼。

sentences.english: I am convinced that some people complain just to annoy me, for something to do, or they simply enjoy complaining.
sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

sentences.english: The company is pruning staff in order to reduce costs.
sentences.chinese: 公司正在裁员以减少开支。

sentences.english: The original version of the text has been pruned quite a bit.
sentences.chinese: 原稿被大幅删节。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller by removing parts that you do not need or want
a dried  plum  , often cooked before it is eaten

name: pore
trans: 仔细浏览，仔细研究：read or study attentively

sentences.english: The size of your pores is determined by the amount of oil they produce.
sentences.chinese: 毛孔的大小取决于毛孔分泌油脂的多少。

sentences.english: We spent hours poring over travel brochures.
sentences.chinese: 我们花了几个小时仔细研究旅游宣传册。

detailed_translations.english: one of the small holes in your skin that liquid, especially  sweat  , can pass through, or a similar hole in the surface of a plant
If you pore over or through information, you look at it and study it very carefully

sentences.english: a CD collection covering the band from its inception in 1994
sentences.chinese: 一套包括该乐队自1994年成立以来所有曲目在内的激光唱片

detailed_translations.english: the start of an organization or institution

name: extinguish
trans: 熄灭：put out；终止：bring to a complete end

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: nominal
trans: 不重要的：unimportant；名义上的：something in name

sentences.english: the nominal head of the rebellion
sentences.chinese: 这次叛乱名义上的领导人

sentences.english: Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是名义上皈依了基督教。

detailed_translations.chinese: 名义上的， 有名无实的； 很少的， 象征性的； 名词性的
detailed_translations.english: officially described as being something, when this is not really true

name: simpleton
trans: （缺乏常识的）笨蛋：lacking in common sense

sentences.english: Is he, you know, like some kind of weird simpleton?
sentences.chinese: 那个谁，你知道吗，像古怪的傻子似的是谁？

sentences.english: He looked at me as if I were a simpleton.
sentences.chinese: 他看着我的样子就好像我是个傻子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a very low level of intelligence

name: jolt
trans: 突然移动：move sudden；惊吓：unpleasant surprise

sentences.english: We jolted along rough wet roads through an endless banana plantation.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿崎岖潮湿的公路颠簸着驶过无边无际的香蕉种植园。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way

detailed_translations.chinese: 颠簸；摇晃；震惊；严重挫折
detailed_translations.english: a sudden shock

sentences.english: a hypnotic trance
sentences.chinese: 催眠后的恍惚状态

detailed_translations.chinese: 催眠的，催眠术的；易于催眠的
detailed_translations.english: relating to  hypnosis
a drug that helps you to sleep

sentences.english: spurious sympathy
sentences.chinese: 假同情

detailed_translations.english: insincere

name: flit
trans: 快速或突然地经过：pass quickly

sentences.english: Birds flitted about in the trees above them.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿在他们头顶的树枝间飞来飞去。

sentences.english: She seemed to spend her life flitting from one country to another.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎一生都在各国间辗转。

sentences.english: His eyes flitted to his watch.
sentences.chinese: 他瞥了一眼手表。

detailed_translations.english: to move lightly or quickly and not stay in one place for very long

name: delve
trans: 探究，钻研：detailed search for information

sentences.english: Tormented by her ignorance, Jenny delves into her mother's past.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮为自己不了解真相而痛苦，她开始深入调查母亲的过去。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find more information about someone or something

sentences.english: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会、政治和经济三方面。

detailed_translations.english: to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc

name: corroborate
trans: 用证据或权威证实：support with evidence；为…提供证据，支持：provide evidence

sentences.english: We now have new evidence to corroborate the defendant’s story.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在有新的证据来证实被告人的说法。

sentences.english: Experiments elsewhere corroborate these results.
sentences.chinese: 其他地方的试验也证实了这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: to provide information that supports or helps to prove someone else’s statement, idea etc

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

sentences.english: Podulski had been assiduous in learning his adopted language.
sentences.chinese: 珀杜斯基曾经勤奋地学习他所选的外语。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is assiduous works hard or does things very thoroughly

name: transcend
trans: 超越，超过极限：beyond the limits

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

name: compunction
trans: 焦虑，内疚，良心不安：anxiety, guilt

sentences.english: They used their tanks against the leftists without compunction .
sentences.chinese: 他们肆无忌惮地使用坦克来对付左派人士。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you should not do something because it is bad or wrong

name: obstinate
trans: 固执的：in spite of persuasion；难以减轻或治愈的：mot easily subdued

sentences.english: He was the most obstinate man I’ve ever met.
sentences.chinese: 他是我遇到过的最固执的人。

sentences.english: Don’t be so obstinate!
sentences.chinese: 别这么固执！

sentences.english: an obstinate refusal to obey
sentences.chinese: 固执地拒绝服从

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的；倔强的；难以控制的
detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your ideas, behaviour, opinions etc, even when other people think you are being unreasonable

name: abridge
trans: 缩短，缩小：shorten；在不改变本意的条件下删减词语，缩写：shorten

sentences.english: The time is limited, so he abridge his composition.
sentences.chinese: 时间有限，他缩短了他的作文。

sentences.english: She decided to abridge her stay in campus since she wants to hunt for a job immediately.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到她想要马上找工作，他决定缩短在校园里逗留的时间。

name: contempt
trans: 蔑视，鄙视：unworthy of one's concern or respect

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

name: abandon
trans: 放纵:constraint；放纵：unrestrainedly；放弃：withdraw；停止做某事：put an end to

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: despicable
trans: 令人鄙视的：loathing and disgust；不荣耀的，不得体的：not honor

sentences.english: It’s despicable the way he treats those kids.
sentences.chinese: 他那样对待那些孩子，真卑鄙。

sentences.english: a despicable act of terrorism
sentences.chinese: 卑劣的恐怖主义行径

sentences.english: a despicable crime
sentences.chinese: 卑鄙的罪行

detailed_translations.english: extremely bad, immoral, or cruel

name: fussy
trans: 谨慎的：involving great care；过分雕琢的：excessively decorated；挑剔的：hard to please

sentences.english: A lot of small children are fussy eaters (= they dislike many types of food ) .
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子挑食。

sentences.english: ‘Do you want to go out or just rent a movie?’ ‘I’m not fussy’ (= I don’t mind ) .
sentences.chinese: “你想出去还是租影碟来看？”“随便。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱挑剔的，难取悦的；易烦恼的
detailed_translations.english: very concerned about small, usually unimportant details, and difficult to please

name: balk
trans: n.大方木料；v.妨碍；(因困难等)不愿前进或从事某事
阻碍：check, obstacle; 不愿接受，拒绝：unwillingness

sentences.english: Even biology undergraduates may balk at animal experiments.
sentences.chinese: 即使是生物专业的大学生都可能会反对动物实验。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone or something from getting or achieving what they want

name: overwhelm
trans: 淹没：cover；（感情上、精神上）使无所适从，使难以忍受：subject to mental stress

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

name: salvage
trans: n./v.(从灾难中)抢救，海上救助

sentences.english: a massive salvage operation
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抢救行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金
detailed_translations.english: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost

sentences.english: I'll need a five-hundred-dollar retainer.
sentences.chinese: 我将需要一笔500美元的预付聘金。

detailed_translations.chinese: 保持器；家臣；保持者；[机] 护圈；预付费用
detailed_translations.english: a reduced amount of rent that you pay for a room, flat etc when you are not there, so that it will still be available when you return

name: smug
trans: 自大的，自鸣得意的：opinion of oneself；整洁的，有序的：good order

sentences.english: Thomas and his wife looked at each other in smug satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯和他妻子互相看着对方，面带着自鸣得意的满足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自鸣得意的；自以为是的；整洁的
detailed_translations.english: showing too much satisfaction with your own cleverness or success – used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 书呆子；自命不凡的家伙

name: confront
trans: 直接对抗，直面：face to face

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

name: concrete
trans: 实体的，实在的：matter；事实性的，明确的：in fact

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: adulterate
trans: 掺杂，加入低等成分：impure, addition

sentences.english: The food had been adulterated to increase its weight.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物被掺了假以增加其重量。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink less pure by adding another substance of lower quality to it

sentences.english: Test your brakes after driving through water.
sentences.chinese: 车子涉水之后要检验一下刹车。

sentences.english: I managed to put the brakes on just in time.
sentences.chinese: 我最终及时刹了车。

sentences.english: Moira slammed on the brakes (=  used them suddenly and with a lot of force  ) .
sentences.chinese: 莫伊拉猛踩刹车。

sentences.english: the screech of brakes
sentences.chinese: 刹车的刺耳噪音

sentences.english: He braked sharply to avoid the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他突然急刹车，想避开那条狗。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle go more slowly or stop
to make a vehicle or bicycle go more slowly or stop by using its brake

name: assail
trans: 抨击，严厉批评：criticize harshly；攻击，猛攻：violent action against

sentences.english: Protesters assailed the proposed fare increase.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者们抨击了提价的提议。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone or something violently

name: hike
trans: （使）上涨：rise up to a higher place or position

sentences.english: He wants to hike round the world.
sentences.chinese: 他打算徒步旅行环游世界一周。

sentences.english: You can organize a picnic in the park, a group hike or bike ride, or meet up with friends for one of those free local events.
sentences.chinese: 你可以组织在公园野餐一群徒步旅行或者骑自行车或者和朋友会面为其中的一个免费本地事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a long walk in the mountains or countryside
a long walk in the mountains or countryside
to increase a price, tax etc by a large amount

sentences.english: ...sheltering from a sudden downpour of rain.
sentences.chinese: …躲避一场突如其来的瓢泼大雨。

detailed_translations.english: a lot of rain that falls in a short time

sentences.english: Doubt and certitude are subjective reactions to the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑与确信都是对于证据的主观反映。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being or feeling certain about something

sentences.english: The chairman was elected by common consent (= with most people agreeing ) .
sentences.chinese: 主席是大家一致推选出来的。

sentences.english: divorce by mutual consent
sentences.chinese: 双方均同意的离婚

sentences.english: Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚事。

detailed_translations.english: agreement about something
to give your permission for something or agree to do something

name: haunt
trans: v.常去；鬼魂出没；(事情)萦绕心头；n.常去的地方
常去拜访：frequent；不断地想起，萦绕心头：obsess

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

name: equable
trans: a.稳定的，不变的；(脾气)温和的

sentences.english: a young man with a naturally equable temperament
sentences.chinese: 生性温和的年轻人

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的， 不变的； 温和的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is equable remains calm and happy and does not often get annoyed
a short sentence that expresses an idea in a clever or amusing way

name: daft
trans: 神经错乱的：abnormal, sick state of mind；不明智的：lack of good sense or judgment

sentences.english: a daft idea
sentences.chinese: 傻主意

sentences.english: Me, jealous? Don’t be daft (= that is a silly idea ) .
sentences.chinese: 我嫉妒？别犯傻了。

sentences.english: She’s as daft as a brush (= extremely silly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她傻得要命。

detailed_translations.english: silly

name: detour
trans: 偏离正常标准：away from standard；改变方向或者路线，绕道：change direction

sentences.english: When I go to the neighborhood, see in the road, so I made a detour, from another trail walk home.
sentences.chinese: 当我走到居委会时，看到前面在修路，于是我绕道而行，从另外一条小路走回家。

sentences.english: But what if you could take a detour through a lobby that exhibits art, or down a lane that borders a green space?
sentences.chinese: 但是，你愿不愿意绕道穿过一个陈列着艺术品的大厅，或者行走在一条毗邻绿色空间的小巷子？

sentences.english: A meeting in a London bus with jewel thief Lady Christina takes a turn for the worst for the Doctor when the bus takes a detour to a desert-like planet, where the deadly Swarm awaits.
sentences.chinese: 一个在伦敦公共汽车上的一个会议在一个珠宝窃贼夫人克莉丝汀采取了转为医生的最坏的时候，公共汽车需要绕道沙漠般的行星，那里的致命的群等待。

detailed_translations.english: to make a detour
a way of going from one place to another that is longer than the usual way

name: surmount
trans: 战胜，获得胜利：achieve a victory

sentences.english: He has had to surmount immense physical disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 他不得不克服严重的身体残疾。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a problem or difficulty

name: revenge
trans: 报复，复仇：retaliating；为...复仇：retaliating in kind

sentences.english: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully.
sentences.chinese: 攻击者被称是在报复一名14岁男孩，称他是学校一霸。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to punish someone who has harmed or offended you
to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

sentences.english: He has even cut himself shaving. There is a speck of blood by his ear.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至在刮脸时划伤了自己。他耳边有一点血迹。

detailed_translations.english: A speck is a very small stain, mark, or shape

name: compose
trans: 使镇定：calm; 组成，构成：form, constitute

sentences.english: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.chinese: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.english: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水由氢和氧组成。

detailed_translations.english: to write a piece of music

sentences.english: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
sentences.chinese: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。

sentences.english: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone by chance and talk to them
to see someone by chance and talk to them

name: stiff
trans: 僵硬的，无法弯曲的：lacking suppleness；（在社交场合）缺乏优雅的，不自在的：lacking social grace；过分的，过高的：beyond limit；艰苦的，费力的：requiring effort

sentences.english: I never felt stiff after training until I was in my thirties.
sentences.chinese: 三十岁之前，我训练后从不会感到身体发僵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 呆板的；坚硬的；严厉的；拘谨的
detailed_translations.english: a stiff punishment is great or severe

detailed_translations.chinese: 死尸；令人讨厌者；流通票据；劳动者
detailed_translations.english: the body of a dead person

name: beset
trans: 使苦恼，骚扰：cause persistent suffering；攻击，袭击：set upon

sentences.english: the injuries which have beset the team all season
sentences.chinese: 困扰球队整个赛季的伤病问题

detailed_translations.english: to make someone experience serious problems or dangers

sentences.english: He has a close affinity with the landscape and people he knew when he was growing up.
sentences.chinese: 他对他成长过程中所熟悉的景色和人们有一种很强的亲切感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 密切关系；吸引力；姻亲关系；类同
detailed_translations.english: a close relationship between two things because of qualities or features that they share

name: swerve
trans: 突然改变方向：turn aside abruptly

sentences.english: Drivers coming in the opposite direction swerved to avoid the bodies.
sentences.chinese: 从反方向过来的司机们突然转向以避开这些尸体。

sentences.english: He swung the car to the left and that swerve saved Malone's life.
sentences.chinese: 他把车猛转向左边，那一转救了马隆的命。

detailed_translations.english: to make a sudden sideways movement while moving forwards, usually in order to avoid hitting something
Swerve is also a noun

sentences.english: festering sores
sentences.chinese: 溃烂的疮

detailed_translations.english: if a wound festers, it becomes infected

sentences.english: I could be cynical and say he probably did it hoping to make a killing -- pardon the pun -- but for the sake of the higher argument I'll play along.
sentences.chinese: 我也许可以玩世不恭的说他这么做是希望开发出一个在市场上“必杀”的游戏——请原谅我的双关语——但为了更高层的论题，我权且同意他的话。

detailed_translations.english: to make a pun
an amusing use of a word or phrase that has two meanings, or of words that have the same sound but different meanings

name: daunt
trans: 使胆怯，吓到：to lessen the courage

sentences.english: He felt utterly daunted by the prospect of moving to another country.
sentences.chinese: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: Don’t be daunted by all the technology.
sentences.chinese: 不要被所有这些技术给吓住。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid or less confident about something

name: ambiguous
trans: 有多种理解方式的，不确定的：more than one, doubt, uncertain

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

sentences.english: ‘This is boring,’ Kathleen grumbled.
sentences.chinese: “这真无聊。”凯瑟琳抱怨道。

sentences.english: My only grumble is that there isn't a non-smoking section.
sentences.chinese: 我惟一的抱怨是这儿没有无烟区。

sentences.english: They grumble about how hard they have to work.
sentences.chinese: 他们抱怨自己工作得很辛苦。

sentences.english: Taft grumbled that the law so favoured the criminal that trials seemed like a game of chance.
sentences.chinese: 塔夫脱抱怨法律如此有利于罪犯，使得审判看来像是一场运气的游戏。

detailed_translations.english: to keep complaining in an unhappy way
Grumble is also a noun
If someone grumbles, they complain about something in a bad-tempered way

name: latent
trans: 潜在的，不活跃的：potential, not evident

sentences.english: latent aggression
sentences.chinese: 潜在的侵略

detailed_translations.english: something that is latent is present but hidden, and may develop or become more noticeable in the future

name: impromptu
trans: 即席的表演:done extemporaneously；即席的，即兴的：without previous preparation

sentences.english: When do we make impromptu speeches?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候要做即席演讲？

sentences.english: When Marco was asked to give an impromptu speech on“Addictions,”he divided the topic /into/ several parts. Notice how he used the pattern of related subtopics in the outline that follows.
sentences.chinese: 举个例子，马可要做一个关于“嗜好”的即席演讲，他将这个主题分成了几部分，注意下面他在大纲中是如何运用有关联副主题模式的。

detailed_translations.english: done or said without any preparation or planning

sentences.english: ...an inveterate gambler.
sentences.chinese: ...一个恶心成瘾的赌徒。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as, for example, an inveterate liar or smoker, you mean that they have lied or smoked for a long time and are not likely to stop doing it

name: benign
trans: 好心的，仁慈的：kindness, gentleness; 无害的：not causing

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

name: coma
trans: 昏迷，深度无知觉：profound unconsciousness; 迟钝，冷漠：sluggishness

sentences.english: The sick man went into a coma.
sentences.chinese: 病人进入了昏迷状态。

sentences.english: In the absence of treatment, disease progression results in seizures, stupour and coma.
sentences.chinese: 在不治疗的情况下，病情的发展可导致癫痫发作和昏迷。

sentences.english: He has not ventured outside his tiny house for years because his wife is in a coma, and he does not want her to wake up and find him gone.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他都没有走出自己的小房子出去冒险，因为他的妻子一直昏迷着，他不希望妻子醒来的时候发现自己已经离开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （因严重疾病或重伤引起的）昏迷

name: depose
trans: 宣誓作证：testify；废黜，罢免：remove from a throne；摆放：arrange

sentences.english: Mr. Ben Bella was deposed in a coup in 1965.
sentences.chinese: 本·贝拉先生在1965年的一次政变中被罢免了。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a leader or ruler from a position of power

name: concur
trans: 同意：agreement；同一时间发生、存在：same time；团结合作：joint

sentences.english: And so, a lot of people see this as a sort of … or create a scenario, an Orwellian scenario, a Big Brother type scenario but I don't concur.
sentences.chinese: 所以，大多数人会把这个现象视为一种……或者说创作一幕剧情，一幕奥威尔式或是“老大哥”式的剧情，但是我并不同意这样的看法。

detailed_translations.english: to agree with someone or have the same opinion as them

name: sensation
trans: 感觉，知觉：sense；轰动事件：intense interest

sentences.english: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

sentences.english: The sex scenes in the film caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

name: syllabus
trans: 提纲，摘要；课文、演讲或研究课题的概要或提纲：summary

sentences.english: The course syllabus consisted mainly of novels by African-American authors, male and female.
sentences.chinese: 该课程的教学大纲主要包括了非裔美国男女作家的小说。

detailed_translations.english: a plan that states exactly what students at a school or college should learn in a particular subject

name: cunning
trans: a.善于骗人的；灵巧的；n.欺诈行为
狡猾的：artful deceptiveness；（手工）灵巧的：skillful；欺诈，欺骗：practice of misleading

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: threadbare
trans: 陈腐的：hackneyed；贫穷的：lacking possessions；破烂的：worn or torn

sentences.english: a threadbare old sofa
sentences.chinese: 一张破旧的沙发

detailed_translations.chinese: 磨破的；衣衫褴褛的；乏味的；俗套的
detailed_translations.english: clothes,  carpets  etc that are threadbare are very thin and in bad condition because they have been used a lot

name: unwitting
trans: 不知道的，未觉察的：unware；偶然的，并非有意的：by chance, not intended

sentences.english: We were unwitting collaborators in his plan.
sentences.chinese: 我们无意中成为他的计划的协作者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不知情的；不知不觉的，无意的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their actions as unwitting, you mean that the person does something or is involved in something without realizing it

detailed_translations.chinese: 使精神错乱；使丧失智能（unwit的ing形式）

name: virtuous
trans: 品德高尚的，正直的：showing moral excellence

sentences.english: a virtuous man
sentences.chinese: 品行端正的男子

sentences.english: Sue considered herself very virtuous because she neither drank nor smoked.
sentences.chinese: 休认为自己品行非常端正，因为她既不喝酒也不抽烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 善良的；有道德的；贞洁的；正直的；有效力的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a very honest and moral way

name: gregarious
trans: 爱社交的：enjoy the company；群居的：group with others

sentences.english: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.
sentences.chinese: 她就是这样一个爱社交而且外向的人。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and preferring to be with other people

sentences.english: Bill sat in sullen silence and refused to eat his lunch.
sentences.chinese: 比尔一声不响，闷闷不乐地坐着，不肯吃午饭。

sentences.english: a look of sullen resentment
sentences.chinese: 愤懑的眼神

detailed_translations.chinese: 愠怒的，不高兴的；（天气）阴沉的；沉闷的
detailed_translations.english: angry and silent, especially because you feel life has been unfair to you

sentences.english: Humans are fallible.
sentences.chinese: 人孰无过。

sentences.english: These surveys are often a rather fallible guide to public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 这些调查往往会对舆论产生误导。

detailed_translations.english: able to make mistakes or be wrong

name: dictate
trans: 指令，命令：command；（仗着地位，权力）下令：request

sentences.english: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
sentences.chinese: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

sentences.english: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

sentences.english: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
sentences.chinese: 赶时髦的青少年

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave
an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

sentences.english: The rest of us adjourned to a nearby pub for some refreshments.
sentences.chinese: 我们其他人转移阵地，去了附近酒吧吃点心。

detailed_translations.english: to finish an activity and go somewhere – often used humorously

sentences.english: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.english: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.english: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.chinese: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time

sentences.english: a proficient typist
sentences.chinese: 熟练的打字员

detailed_translations.english: able to do something well or skilfully

sentences.english: The patients suffered hallucinations caused by the drug.
sentences.chinese: 病人受药物影响产生了幻觉。

detailed_translations.english: something which you imagine you can see or hear, but which is not really there, or the experience of this

name: sanguine
trans: 乐观的，确信的：free from doubt；面色红润的：healthy reddish

sentences.english: a sanguine view
sentences.chinese: 乐观的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐观的；满怀希望的；面色红润的
detailed_translations.english: happy and hopeful about the future

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: tepid
trans: 不太热心的：little or no interest

sentences.english: a tepid response from the audience
sentences.chinese: 观众冷淡的反应

detailed_translations.chinese: 微温的，温热的；不太热烈的；不热情的
detailed_translations.english: a feeling, reaction etc that is tepid shows a lack of excitement or interest

name: wobble
trans: 摇晃，颤抖：move or proceed unsteadily；犹豫不决：show uncertainty

sentences.english: The pile of bricks wobbled and fell.
