sentences.chinese: 那堆砖摇摇晃晃地倒塌了。

sentences.english: Tom stopped, wobbling from the weight of his load.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆停下来，身上的东西压得他摇摇晃晃。

sentences.english: We might look for a tiny wobble in the position of a star.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以期待在一颗恒星位置上的一个微小晃动。

detailed_translations.english: to move unsteadily from side to side, or make something do this
Wobble is also a noun

name: weather
trans: 安全度过（危机等），经受住：come through

sentences.english: What’s the weather like today?
sentences.chinese: 今天天气如何？

sentences.english: The weather turned bitterly cold.
sentences.chinese: 天气变得很冷了。

detailed_translations.english: the temperature and other conditions such as sun, rain, and wind

detailed_translations.chinese: 经受住；使风化；侵蚀；使受风吹雨打
detailed_translations.english: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time

sentences.english: She exercises every day to keep herself supple.
sentences.chinese: 她每天锻炼以保持身体柔韧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 柔软的；灵活的；顺从的；易弯曲的；逢迎的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is supple bends and moves easily and gracefully

sentences.english: There was something furtive about his actions.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为有点鬼鬼祟祟。

detailed_translations.english: behaving as if you want to keep something secret

sentences.english: The plant exudes a sticky liquid.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物会分泌一种黏液。

detailed_translations.english: to flow out slowly and steadily, or to make something do this

sentences.english: good wholesome fun
sentences.chinese: 健康有益的娱乐

detailed_translations.chinese: 健全的；有益健康的；合乎卫生的；审慎的
detailed_translations.english: likely to make you healthy

name: forthright
trans: 直率的，说话率真的：free in expressing opinions；直接的，不绕弯子的：free from ambiguity or evasiveness：going straight to the point

sentences.english: She answered in her usual forthright manner .
sentences.chinese: 她以一贯的直率作了回答。

detailed_translations.english: direct and honest - used in order to show approval

sentences.english: a cattle prod
sentences.chinese: 赶牛刺棒

detailed_translations.english: a pointed instrument used for pushing animals, to make them move
to quickly push something or someone with your finger or a pointed object

name: revolt
trans: 使厌恶，使反感：fill with disgust；反叛：renounce allegiance

sentences.english: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
sentences.chinese: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

sentences.english: the Polish revolt of 1863
sentences.chinese: 1863年的波兰起义

sentences.english: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.3
sentences.chinese: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.english: The peasants threatened to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 农民威胁说要造反。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
to refuse to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

sentences.english: funeral rites
sentences.chinese: 殡葬仪式

sentences.english: ancient fertility rites
sentences.chinese: 古代的生殖崇拜仪式

sentences.english: These traditional rites are performed only by the women of the village.
sentences.chinese: 这些传统仪式只由村里的女人来进行。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, usually for religious purposes

name: sincere
trans: a.诚实的，正直的；真挚的，纯净的

sentences.english: Please accept my sincere apologies .
sentences.chinese: 请接受我真诚的道歉。

sentences.english: his sincere desire to find out the truth
sentences.chinese: 他想查明真相的真切愿望

detailed_translations.english: a feeling, belief, or statement that is sincere is honest and true, and based on what you really feel and believe

sentences.english: The guard looked at us with a frigid stare.
sentences.chinese: 守卫冷冷地盯着我们。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex

name: falsehood
trans: 谎言：untrue, made in order to deceive

sentences.english: Saunders is deliberately telling a falsehood.
sentences.chinese: 桑德斯在故意说假话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说谎；假话；不真实；错误的信仰
detailed_translations.english: a statement that is untrue

sentences.english: He used to buy them expensive presents, out of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 出于内疚，他以前总是给他们买昂贵的礼物。

sentences.english: He felt an enormous sense of guilt when he thought about how he’d treated her.
sentences.chinese: 他想到自己那样对待她，心里非常歉疚。

sentences.english: He did not deny his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 他没有否认自己有罪。

sentences.english: His guilt was proved beyond all doubt by the prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪行已被原告方证实确凿无疑。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong

name: summon
trans: 召集，召唤：call together；传唤（出庭、出席）：command to appear in court

sentences.english: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

sentences.english: It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她用了整整一个月的时间才鼓起勇气告诉了母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to order someone to come to a place

name: finesse
trans: 娴熟技巧：skill；精心策划：plan out with subtle skill；（巧妙地）躲避：keep away from

sentences.english: Dario played the sonata with great finesse.
sentences.chinese: 达里奥以高超的技艺弹奏了这首奏鸣曲。

detailed_translations.english: if you do something with finesse, you do it with a lot of skill and style

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧妙处理；以偷牌方式先出
detailed_translations.english: to handle a situation well, but in a way that is slightly deceitful

name: irk
trans: 令人烦恼的事物：source of irritation；使烦恼，使厌倦：irritating

sentences.english: The rehearsal process also irked him increasingly.
sentences.chinese: 排练过程也更加让他厌烦。

detailed_translations.english: if something irks you, it makes you feel annoyed

sentences.english: He traveled the southern states, preaching the gospel .
sentences.chinese: 他游历南方各州宣讲福音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说教；讲道；鼓吹；传道；反复灌输
detailed_translations.english: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

name: warrant
trans: 向...保证质量：assume responsibility for the satisfactory quality；批准，认可：give official acceptance

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

name: sip
trans: （尤指小口地）喝：swallow in liquid form

sentences.english: Bees sip honey from flowers and hum their thanks when they leave.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂从花中啜蜜，离开时营营地道谢。 獥，% 韐罔。

sentences.english: We afford you the opportunity to dine with delight, to sip in style, to relax in Comfort.
sentences.chinese: 我们将竭诚为您提供愉快进餐的良机，优雅的啜饮，舒适的休憩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小口喝， 抿； 一小口的量
detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of a drink

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: equilibrium
trans: 均势，平衡：opposing forces are equal；（感情上的）平静：evenness of emotions

sentences.english: The government is anxious not to upset the economic equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 政府急切希望不要打乱经济平衡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 均衡；平静；保持平衡的能力
detailed_translations.english: a balance between different people, groups, or forces that compete with each other, so that none is stronger than the others and a situation is not likely to change suddenly

name: abreast
trans: 并排地：in line；熟知的：knowledge of recent developments

sentences.english: As the car drew abreast of him, Jack suddenly recognised the driver.
sentences.chinese: 那辆车追上来与杰克并行时，他一下子就认出了驾车的人。

detailed_translations.english: to walk, ride etc next to each other, all facing the same way

name: align
trans: v.将某物排列在一条直线上；与某人结盟
使排成一行：line; 调准，校准：adjust

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

sentences.english: John was as bouncy and ebullient as Helen was diffident and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 约翰活泼、热情；而海伦却羞怯、矜持。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞怯的；缺乏自信的；谦虚谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: shy and not wanting to make people notice you or talk about you

sentences.english: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她想跑，但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。

sentences.english: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone to do something
a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present

name: dissent
trans: 持异议，不同意：differ；反对正统：departure accepted；不和谐：lack harmony

sentences.english: There are some dissenting voices (= people who do not agree ) among the undergraduates.
sentences.chinese: 大学生中有一些反对的呼声。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion

name: uncanny
trans: 离奇的，奇异的：extraordinary or abnormal

sentences.english: an uncanny coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不可思议的巧合

detailed_translations.english: very strange and difficult to explain

name: ragged
trans: 衣衫褴褛的：threadbare clothes；凹凸不平的，不光滑的：not smooth

sentences.english: Crowds of ragged children played among the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 一群群破衣烂衫的孩子在岩石间玩耍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 褴褛的，外形参差不齐的
detailed_translations.english: wearing clothes that are old and torn

name: nostalgia
trans: 思乡之情：homesick；怀旧，怀念：sentimental yearning for return

sentences.english: He might be influenced by nostalgia for the surroundings of his happy youth.
sentences.chinese: 他也许被他对快乐青年时代的环境的怀念影响了。

detailed_translations.english: Nostalgia is an affectionate feeling you have for the past, especially for a particularly happy time

name: stoke
trans: 添加燃料：supply fuel；增大，促进：make greater

sentences.english: I stoked the furnace for the night.
sentences.chinese: 我给火炉添煤让它烧过夜。

detailed_translations.english: to add more coal or wood to a fire

name: considerable
trans: （数量上）可观（而值得注意）的：large；值得考虑的，重要的：significant

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: impenetrable
trans: a.不能穿透的；不可理解的
不可渗透的，不可穿透的：impossible to get through；难以理解的：incapable of being comprehended

sentences.english: The trees formed a dark and impenetrable barrier.
sentences.chinese: 这些树形成了一道无法通过的黑暗屏障。

sentences.english: the impenetrable blackness of the night
sentences.chinese: 夜晚伸手不见五指的黑

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能穿过的, 不可理喻的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to get through, see through, or get into

sentences.english: Leo stared back at him without flinching.
sentences.chinese: 利奥毫不畏缩地回瞪着他。

detailed_translations.english: to move your face or body away from someone or something because you are in pain, frightened, or upset
the act or an instance of drawing back

name: callow
trans: a.(鸟)未生羽毛的；(人)未成熟的
不老练的，不成熟的：lacking, experience

sentences.english: ...a callow youth.
sentences.chinese: ...一个羽翼未丰的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 年轻而无经验的；羽毛未丰的
detailed_translations.english: A callow young person has very little experience or knowledge of the way they should behave as an adult

sentences.english: They have been bartering wheat for cotton and timber.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直在用小麦交换棉花和木材。

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行易货贸易；[贸易] 作物物交换；讨价还价
detailed_translations.english: to exchange goods, work, or services for other goods or services rather than for money

detailed_translations.chinese: 易货贸易；物物交换；实物交易
detailed_translations.english: a system of exchanging goods and services for other goods and services rather than using money

name: archetype
trans: 典范，榜样：ideal; 先驱，鼻祖：earlier; 原型：copies

sentences.english: He came to this country 20 years ago and is the archetype of the successful Asian businessman.
sentences.chinese: 他20年前来到这个国家，是成功的亚裔商人的典型。

detailed_translations.english: a perfect example of something, because it has all the most important qualities of things that belong to that type

sentences.english: new potatoes sprinkled with chopped mint
sentences.chinese: 撒上薄荷屑的嫩马铃薯

sentences.english: roast lamb with mint sauce
sentences.chinese: 配薄荷调味汁的烤羔羊肉

sentences.english: Decorate with a sprig of mint .
sentences.chinese: 用小薄荷枝装饰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款
detailed_translations.english: a small plant with green leaves that have a fresh smell and taste and are used in cooking
to make a coin
looking new and in perfect condition

name: rational
trans: 合乎逻辑的：logical；理性的：based on reasoning

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: imperial
trans: 帝国的，帝王的：empire；巨大的，令人惊叹的：impressive in size

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

sentences.english: the opening chords of 'Stairway to Heaven'
sentences.chinese: 《通往天堂的阶梯》的开篇和弦

detailed_translations.english: a combination of several musical notes that are played at the same time and sound pleasant together

sentences.english: a breach of diplomatic protocol
sentences.chinese: 违反外交礼节

detailed_translations.english: a system of rules about the correct way to behave on an official occasion

name: impending
trans: 即将发生的：soon to take place

sentences.english: On the morning of the expedition, I awoke with a feeling of impending disaster.
sentences.chinese: 远征出发的那天早上，我醒来就有一种大难临头的感觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 即将发生的；迫切的；悬挂的
detailed_translations.english: an impending event or situation, especially an unpleasant one, is going to happen very soon

sentences.english: It represents a last-ditch attempt by the country to extricate itself from its economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 这是该国摆脱经济危机的最后一搏。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from a difficult or embarrassing situation, or to help someone escape

name: paranoid
trans: 多疑的，对他人极端恐惧和怀疑的：extreme fear of distrust

sentences.english: a patient suffering from paranoid schizophrenia
sentences.chinese: 一个偏执型精神分裂症病人

sentences.english: ...these sad, deluded paranoids.
sentences.chinese: …这些可悲的、被蒙蔽的妄想狂们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似妄想狂的；属于偏执狂的
detailed_translations.english: suffering from a mental illness that makes you believe that other people are trying to harm you

detailed_translations.chinese: 患妄想狂的人；偏执狂患者
detailed_translations.english: A paranoid is someone who is paranoid

sentences.english: The scene was stunning, and for a time engrossed all our attention.
sentences.chinese: 景色非常美丽，一时间把我们都完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else

name: elevate
trans: （在道德、智力、文化水平上）提升：improve；使兴奋：raise spirits

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: erratic
trans: 善变的：not constant；异常的，不同寻常的：different from the ordinary

sentences.english: His breathing was becoming erratic.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸越来越不均匀。

sentences.english: his erratic behaviour
sentences.chinese: 他难以捉摸的行为

detailed_translations.english: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular

detailed_translations.chinese: 漂泊无定的人；古怪的人

name: defuse
trans: v.从(爆破装置)中卸除引信；缓和紧张状态或危急局面

sentences.english: Police have defused a bomb found in a downtown building.
sentences.chinese: 警察已拆除了在市中心一幢大楼里发现的一枚炸弹的引信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平息；去掉…的雷管；使除去危险性
detailed_translations.english: to improve a difficult or dangerous situation, for example by making people less angry or by dealing with the causes of a problem

name: assert
trans: 断言，肯定地说出：declare, forcefully, aggressively

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: tamper
trans: 恶意篡改，损害：mischievously；玩弄：rashly or foolishly

sentences.english: Don't tamper with my business.
sentences.chinese: 别干预我的事。

sentences.english: It should not overwhelm you with raw HTTP traffic dumps, and it goes far beyond simply providing a framework to tamper with the application by hand.
sentences.chinese: 用户不会再被大量原始的HTTP流量数据淹没，而且这个工具远不仅仅是一个人工干预应用程序的框架。

name: delicacy
trans: （外貌、结构等）精致，极度兴奋，发狂：fineness

sentences.english: Snails are considered a delicacy in France.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，蜗牛被认为是一种珍贵的美食。

detailed_translations.chinese: 美味；佳肴；微妙；精密；精美；敏锐，敏感；世故，圆滑
detailed_translations.english: something good to eat that is expensive or rare

name: implicit
trans: 不言而喻的，心照不宣的：understood though unexpressed；无疑问的，无保留的：without doubt

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

sentences.english: ‘But why can’t I go?’ he said in a querulous voice.
sentences.chinese: “可是为什么我不能去呢？”他抱怨道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易怒的，暴躁的；爱发牢骚的，抱怨的；爱挑剔的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is querulous complains about things in an annoying way

sentences.english: Quinn charmed credulous investors out of millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 奎因花言巧语从轻信的投资者那里骗取了数百万美元。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻信的；因轻信而产生的
detailed_translations.english: always believing what you are told, and therefore easily deceived

name: murmur
trans: 小声的话语：low sound；低声抱怨，发牢骚：grumble

sentences.english: She replied in a low murmur.
sentences.chinese: 她轻轻地柔声回答。

detailed_translations.chinese: 低语；低语声；低声抱怨；潺潺声
detailed_translations.english: a soft low sound made by people speaking quietly or a long way away

detailed_translations.chinese: 低声说；私下抱怨；发出轻柔持续的声音
detailed_translations.english: to make a soft low sound

sentences.english: The men claim they have been victimized because of their political activity.
sentences.chinese: 那些人声称他们因为自己的政治活动而受到了迫害。

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone unfairly because you do not like them, their beliefs, or the race they belong to

name: genial
trans: 和蔼亲切的：easygoing；友好的，热心的：kindly feeling；温暖的：neither too high nor too low

sentences.english: a genial smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and happy

sentences.english: Mona climbed the rickety wooden stairs.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜爬上了摇摇晃晃的木楼梯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 摇晃的；虚弱的；患佝偻病的
detailed_translations.english: A rickety structure or piece of furniture is not very strong or well made, and seems likely to collapse or break

name: preclude
trans: 预先阻止：make impossible in advance；排斥：exclude

sentences.english: rules that preclude experimentation in teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 禁止进行教学方法试验的规定

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something or make something impossible

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

name: divert
trans: 使转向：turn, deflect；使消遣：agreeably；使分心：draw something else

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

sentences.english: the book’s omniscient narrator
sentences.chinese: 本书中全知全能的叙事者

detailed_translations.english: knowing everything

sentences.english: a provisional government
sentences.chinese: 临时政府

sentences.english: We accept provisional bookings by phone.
sentences.chinese: 我们接受电话临时预约。

detailed_translations.english: likely or able to be changed in the future

name: postulate
trans: 前提条件：starting point；假定为真：assume true

sentences.english: He dismissed arguments postulating differing standards for human rights in different cultures and regions.
sentences.chinese: 他无法接受的是假定人权标准在不同文化和地区有所不同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 假定；要求；视…为理所当然
detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something might have happened or be true
something believed to be true, on which an argument or scientific discussion is based

sentences.english: ‘You’re right,’ Rita said, in order to pacify him.
sentences.chinese: “你是对的。”丽塔安抚他道。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone calm, quiet, and satisfied after they have been angry or upset

name: evasive
trans: 难以发现，捕捉，分离的；含糊其辞的：equivocal

sentences.english: an evasive reply
sentences.chinese: 模棱两可的答复

detailed_translations.english: not willing to answer questions directly

sentences.english: Their relationship hasn’t always been amicable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的关系不是一直都很和睦。

detailed_translations.english: an amicable agreement, relationship etc is one in which people feel friendly towards each other and do not want to quarrel

sentences.english: a tortuous path over the mountains to Kandahar
sentences.chinese: 翻山越岭通往坎大哈的一条蜿蜒小径

detailed_translations.english: a tortuous path, stream, road etc has a lot of bends in it and is therefore difficult to travel along

name: solace
trans: 安慰：comfort in sorrow；安慰，安抚：console

sentences.english: Mary was a great solace to me after Arthur died.
sentences.chinese: 阿瑟死后，玛丽就是我最大的安慰。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of emotional comfort at a time of great sadness or disappointment

detailed_translations.chinese: 安慰；抚慰；使快乐（过去式solaced，过去分词solaced，现在分词solacing，第三人称单数solaces）

sentences.english: He would brook no criticism, even from his beloved daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他不能容忍任何批评，哪怕是自己深爱的女儿也不行。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow or accept something
a small stream

sentences.english: ‘Pass away’ is a euphemism for ‘die’.
sentences.chinese: “去世”是“死”的委婉语。

detailed_translations.english: a polite word or expression that you use instead of a more direct one to avoid shocking or upsetting someone

name: repugnant
trans: 令人厌恶的：arousing aversion；不和谐的，不协调的：not harmony

sentences.english: Everything about the affair was repugnant to her.
sentences.chinese: 有关那件事的一切令她反感。

sentences.english: ...Sebastian's sartorial elegance.
sentences.chinese: ...塞巴斯蒂安衣着的优雅。

detailed_translations.english: Sartorial means relating to clothes and to the way they are made or worn

name: hybrid
trans: 杂交品种，混合品种：mixed origin；杂交的：parents of different races

sentences.english: hybrid architecture
sentences.chinese: 具有混合风格的建筑

sentences.english: ...the hybrid corn seed.
sentences.chinese: …杂交玉米种子。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced from parents of different breeds or types
Hybrid is also an adjective

name: practitioner
trans: n.开业者；从事某种手艺者

sentences.english: RMC provides structure in three areas for the practitioner: productivity, guidance , and personalization.
sentences.chinese: RMC在三个领域为从业者提供了结构：生产力，指导和个性化。

sentences.english: The dictionary is mainly for civil aviation practitioner, aviation majored students and Aviation enthusiasts.
sentences.chinese: 词典主要面向民航从业人员、航空专业学员以及航空爱好者。

sentences.english: The articulation of work and life, cast as work-life balance, has become a key feature of much current government, practitioner and academic debate.
sentences.chinese: 当今的工作和生活，扮演工作与生活的平衡，已成为一个关键特性当前的很多政府、从业者和学术争论。

name: giddy
trans: 轻率不严肃的：lacking in seriousness；喜悦的：elated

sentences.english: Greg stared down from the seventh floor and began to feel giddy .
sentences.chinese: 格雷格从七楼望下去，开始觉得头晕了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 头晕的；眼花的；令人眼花缭乱的；轻浮的
detailed_translations.english: feeling slightly sick and unable to balance, because everything seems to be moving

sentences.english: a momentous decision
sentences.chinese: 重大决定

sentences.english: Momentous events are taking place in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国正在发生重大事件。

sentences.english: His colleagues all recognized that this was a momentous occasion .
sentences.chinese: 他的同事都认识到这是一个重要时刻。

sentences.english: one of the most momentous days in British sport
sentences.chinese: 英国体育事业最重要的日子之一

detailed_translations.english: a momentous event, change, or decision is very important because it will have a great influence on the future

sentences.english: No one could console her when Peter died.
sentences.chinese: 彼得去世时没人能够安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed
a flat board that contains the controls for a machine, piece of electrical equipment, computer etc

sentences.english: an overt attempt to silence their political opponents
sentences.chinese: 他们想压制政敌言论的明显企图

sentences.english: Overt race discrimination is illegal.
sentences.chinese: 公然的种族歧视是非法的。

detailed_translations.english: overt actions are done publicly, without trying to hide anything

name: subsidiary
trans: 次要的：secondary importance；起辅助作用的：aid, support

sentences.english: a subsidiary hypothesis
sentences.chinese: 一个附带假设

detailed_translations.english: connected with, but less important than, something else
a company that is owned or controlled by another larger company

sentences.english: The banks made hundreds of imprudent loans in the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪70年代那几家银行轻率地发放了几百笔贷款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的，鲁莽的；不小心的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or wise

name: arid
trans: 干燥的：little or no precipitation；无趣的，无聊的：lack of interest

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的
detailed_translations.english: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

name: embarrass
trans: 使尴尬：experience distress；阻挠，制造障碍：create difficulty

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

sentences.english: Don’t worry about all the details as long as you get the gist (= understand the main meaning ) of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要去管各个细节，只要理解主要意思就行了。

detailed_translations.english: the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

name: barrage
trans: 弹幕：curtain; 有压倒之势的、集中倾泻的（如言语）：overwhelming, outpouring; （同时）袭来：attack with, overwhelming outpouring

sentences.english: ...a hydro-electric tidal barrage.
sentences.chinese: …一座水力发电潮汐拦河坝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弹幕；阻塞；齐射式攻击；[水利] 拦河坝
detailed_translations.english: the continuous firing of guns, dropping of bombs etc, especially to protect soldiers as they move towards an enemy

name: estimable
trans: 值得尊敬的：admirable;可以估量的

sentences.english: ...the estimable Miss Cartwright.
sentences.chinese: ...令人仰慕的卡特赖特小姐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可估计的；可尊敬的；有价值的
detailed_translations.english: deserving respect and admiration

name: flush
trans: （肤色）健康红润的：healthy reddish；富有的：money in abundance；大量的：abundance；冲洗：pour liquid

sentences.english: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊脸涨得通红，目光转向别处。

sentences.english: He flushed angrily .
sentences.chinese: 他气得满脸通红。

detailed_translations.english: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed
if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat

name: disregard
trans: 漠视，不关注：no attention；缺乏兴趣，缺乏关心：interest concern

sentences.english: He ordered the jury to disregard the witness’s last statement.
sentences.chinese: 他指示陪审团忽略证人的最后一句话。

sentences.english: his disregard for her feelings
sentences.chinese: 他对她情感的忽略

detailed_translations.english: to ignore something or treat it as unimportant
when someone ignores something that they should not ignore

name: flag
trans: 旗帜，象征：symbol；变得衰弱：become feeble

sentences.english: Children waving flags greeted the Russian leader.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们挥舞着旗帜，欢迎俄罗斯领导人。

sentences.english: the flag of Kenya
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚国旗

sentences.english: the Spanish flag
sentences.chinese: 西班牙国旗

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization

sentences.english: Few of the manuscripts are still extant.
sentences.chinese: 手稿大都散佚无存。

detailed_translations.english: still existing in spite of being very old

sentences.english: Arcane nullifiers recognize Common, but only an experienced tinker, shouting out the correct codes, may command them.
sentences.chinese: 虽然奥术消除者被认可为是公民，但只要是一名经验丰富的修补匠，高喊出正确的指令，就可以命令它们。

detailed_translations.english: in the past, a tinker was someone who travelled from place to place selling things or repairing metal pots, pans etc

name: sublime
trans: 崇高的，庄严的：high moral；（因为杰出、尊贵、美丽等而）令人惊叹的：inspire awe

sentences.english: The view was sublime.
sentences.chinese: 景色十分迷人。

sentences.english: Her songs are a sublime fusion of pop and Brazilian music.
sentences.chinese: 她的歌曲是流行乐和巴西音乐的巧妙融合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 庄严的；令人崇敬的；极端的；超群的
detailed_translations.english: something that is sublime is so good or beautiful that it affects you deeply
something that is so good or beautiful that you are deeply affected by it

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…纯化；使…升华；使…变高尚

name: acquiesce
trans: 勉强同意；默许：accept, tacitly or passively

sentences.english: Steve seemed to acquiesce in the decision.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂夫看样子默许了这个决定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what someone else wants, or allow something to happen, even though you do not really agree with it

name: vicarious
trans: 代理的，取代的：substitute for another

sentences.english: She invents fantasy lives for her own vicarious pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 她幻想过着各种奇妙的生活，从这种想象中获得乐趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 替代的；代理的；发同感的

sentences.english: I was so hungry my stomach hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我饿得胃都痛了。

sentences.english: His stomach was full of food.
sentences.chinese: 他的胃里塞满了食物。

detailed_translations.english: the organ inside your body where food begins to be  digested
to be able to accept something, especially something unpleasant

name: accord
trans: 一致：consistency；相符合，相一致：in harmony；授予，给予：to grant or give

sentences.english: The punishments accorded with the current code of discipline.
sentences.chinese: 处罚与现行的纪律规则一致。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 使符合；使一致；调节；授予，赠与，给予
detailed_translations.english: to give someone or something special attention or a particular type of treatment

name: vigorous
trans: 精力旺盛的：active strength；强健的：withstand hardship

sentences.english: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。

sentences.english: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动，反对在该地区倾倒核废物。

sentences.english: a vigorous debate
sentences.chinese: 一场激烈的辩论

sentences.english: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。

sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

sentences.english: The birds breed in northern latitudes.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

name: disprove
trans: 反驳，证明为假：prove to be false

sentences.english: These figures disproved Smith’s argument.
sentences.chinese: 这些数据证明史密斯的论点是错误的。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is wrong or not true

name: original
trans: a.最初的，原始的；有创意的
创新的：creative, inventive；最初的，最早的：before

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: depreciate
trans: 贬低…的价值：lower value；轻视：lower estimation, esteem

sentences.english: New cars depreciate in value quickly.
sentences.chinese: 新车掉价很快。

detailed_translations.english: to decrease in value or price

name: quench
trans: 熄灭：put out；使满足：put a complete end to

sentences.english: a desperate bid to quench the raging flames
sentences.chinese: 为扑灭熊熊大火而不顾一切的努力

detailed_translations.english: to stop a fire from burning

name: nibble
trans: 准确，精准：careful details；细微之处：fine point

sentences.english: He nibbled the biscuit cautiously.
sentences.chinese: 他小心地啃着饼干。

detailed_translations.chinese: 细咬；一点一点地咬；吹毛求疵
detailed_translations.english: to eat small amounts of food by taking very small bites

sentences.english: Plastic replicas of the Greek pottery are sold to gullible tourists.
sentences.chinese: 仿古希腊陶器的塑料复制品被卖给易受骗的游客。

detailed_translations.english: too ready to believe what other people tell you, so that you are easily tricked

name: bulge
trans: 凸起：protuberant; 比赛中的优势地位：more favorable condition; 暴涨，突增，在数目或数量上突然而且是临时性的增加：sudden, usually temporary increase; 充满：copiously supplied

sentences.english: The gun made a bulge under his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 手枪从他的夹克里面鼓了出来。

detailed_translations.english: a curved mass on the surface of something, usually caused by something under or inside it
to stick out in a rounded shape, especially because something is very full or too tight

sentences.english: the boys who had snubbed her in high school
sentences.chinese: 在中学里曾经冷落她的那些男孩

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone rudely, especially by ignoring them when you meet
an act of snubbing someone

name: taper
trans: n.细蜡烛；v.(长形物体的)逐渐变细
（使）逐渐变细：become narrower, thinner；逐渐减少，减弱：diminish gradually

sentences.english: small boys holding lighted tapers
sentences.chinese: 拿着点燃的细蜡烛的小男孩

sentences.english: Unlike other trees, it doesn't taper very much. It stays fat all the way up.
sentences.chinese: 不像其他树，它不是越往上越细，而是自下往上一样粗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 细蜡烛，烛芯；逐渐变弱；锥形物
detailed_translations.english: a very thin  candle
If something tapers, or if you taper it, it becomes gradually thinner at one end

name: prerequisite
trans: 先决条件，前提：necessary to an end

sentences.english: A person with ambition is the prerequisite to success.
sentences.chinese: 一个人有雄心壮志是成功的先决条件。

sentences.english: Historical changes to the production of embroidered shoes with embroidery into a local evaluation of the level of ingenuity of a girl prerequisite.
sentences.chinese: 历史的变革使绣花鞋的制作与刺绣水平成为当地评价一个姑娘心灵手巧的先决条件。

sentences.english: Anyone has the possibility to succeed, but the prerequisite of success is your own, both industry knowledge learning and the cultivation of innovation ability, requires great effort.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都有成功的可能性，但成功的先决条件在于你自身，无论是行业知识的学习还是创新能力的培养，都需要付出极大的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的， 作为先决条件的

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary before something else can happen or be done

name: nurture
trans: v.抚育，给…营养物，教养；n.养育，营养物；(总称)环境因素
提供营养：nourishment；培育，培养：provide with understanding

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: imperative
trans: 命令：must be obeyed；命令的，强制性的：forcing one’s compliance；迫切的：needing immediate attention；必要的：impossible to do without

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

sentences.english: He stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel, from whose lofty heights he could see across New York.
sentences.chinese: 他住在四季酒店，从酒店高处可以看到纽约的全景。

sentences.english: lofty ideals of equality and social justice
sentences.chinese: 平等和社会正义的崇高理想

detailed_translations.english: (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive

name: unpretentious
trans: 低调的，谦逊的：modest；坦诚的，自然的：free from deceive

sentences.english: an unpretentious hotel
sentences.chinese: 简朴的酒店

sentences.english: an unpretentious woman
sentences.chinese: 行事低调的女子

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；含蓄的；不炫耀的；不铺张的
detailed_translations.english: not trying to seem better, more important etc than you really are – use this to show approval

name: tangle
trans: 困惑，不解：perplexity；纠缠，使....纠结：in a snare

sentences.english: My hair tangles easily.
sentences.chinese: 我的头发很容易打结。

sentences.english: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 他的降落伞缠在了飞机的轮子上。

detailed_translations.english: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 乱糟糟的一堆， 混乱； 复杂的问题； 困惑
detailed_translations.english: a confused state or situation

name: drizzle
trans: （下）细小、轻柔、似雾的雨，毛毛雨：misty rain

sentences.english: The rain isn’t too bad – it’s only drizzling.
sentences.chinese: 雨下得不大——只是毛毛细雨而已。

detailed_translations.english: if it is drizzling, light rain and mist come out of the sky
weather that is a combination of light rain and mist

name: speculate
trans: 推测，揣测：take to be true；投机倒买：from market fluctuations

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: fad
trans: （短暂的）流行，时尚：popular for a short time

sentences.english: Interest in organic food is not a fad, it’s here to stay.
sentences.chinese: 对有机食品的兴趣不是一时的风尚，它是长久的喜好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时尚；一时的爱好；一时流行的狂热
detailed_translations.english: something that people like or do for a short time, or that is fashionable for a short time

name: stringent
trans: a.(规定)严格的，苛刻的；缺钱的
紧绷的：tight；严格的：marked by rigor

sentences.english: stringent anti-noise regulations
sentences.chinese: 严格的防噪音条例

detailed_translations.chinese: 严格的；严厉的；紧缩的；短缺的
detailed_translations.english: a stringent law, rule, standard etc is very strict and must be obeyed

name: veteran
trans: 老兵；有丰富经验的人：knowledge through long experience；经验丰富的，资深的：knowledge, experience

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

sentences.english: Helen finally capitulated and let her son have a car.
sentences.chinese: 海伦最终让步，同意让儿子买一辆车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 认输，屈服；屈从，停止反抗；有条件投降；让步
detailed_translations.english: to accept or agree to something that you have been opposing for a long time

name: accessory
trans: 辅助的，附属的：secondary, supplementary, subordinate; 帮凶：one, wrongdoing

sentences.english: an accessory to murder
sentences.chinese: 谋杀案的帮凶

sentences.english: the accessory muscles of respiration
sentences.chinese: 副呼吸肌

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
not the most important when compared to others

name: abstract
trans: 做总结，概括：abstract, summarize; 使分心：away, attention

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

sentences.english: He seems rather pompous.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去相当自负。

sentences.english: the book’s pompous style
sentences.chinese: 该书浮夸的文风

detailed_translations.chinese: 自大的；浮夸的；华而不实的；爱炫耀的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is pompous thinks that they are important, and shows this by being very formal and using long words – used to show disapproval

name: seminal
trans: 有发展性的：contributing later development；创新的：creative

sentences.english: a seminal study of eighteenth-century France
sentences.chinese: 对18世纪法国的开创性研究

detailed_translations.english: producing or containing  semen

name: resurrect
trans: 使重生，使复苏：bring back to life

sentences.english: The Home Office have resurrected plans to build a new prison just outside London.
sentences.chinese: 内政部重新提出了在伦敦市外建一座监狱的计划。

sentences.english: another failed attempt to resurrect his career
sentences.chinese: 他重振事业的又一次失败尝试

detailed_translations.english: to bring back an old activity, belief, idea etc that has not existed for a long time

sentences.english: With friends, she sometimes alluded to a feeling that she herself was to blame for her son's predicament.
sentences.chinese: 和朋友们一起时，她有时暗示她感到儿子的困境要怪她自己。

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗指，转弯抹角地说到；略为提及，顺便提到
detailed_translations.english: If you allude to something, you mention it in an indirect way

name: advocate
trans: >v.拥护，支持，鼓吹；n.支持者，拥护者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: depressed
trans: 不开心的，情绪不高的，消沉的：unhappiness；生活境况悲催的：healthful environment

sentences.english: Britain’s depressed housing market
sentences.chinese: 英国不景气的房产市场

sentences.english: She felt lonely and depressed .
sentences.chinese: 她感到孤独和沮丧。

detailed_translations.english: an area, industry etc that is depressed does not have enough economic or business activity

name: futile
trans: a.无效的，无用的;（人）没出息的；琐细的
无效的，无用的：ineffective；不严肃的：lacking in seriousness

sentences.english: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
sentences.chinese: 我努力想再次入睡，但怎么也睡不着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
detailed_translations.english: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

name: flaw
trans: 瑕疵，缺点：imperfection；降低，破坏，使不完美：reduce perfection

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: slate
trans: 列入名单，计划，安排：put on a list

sentences.english: There were several slates missing from the roof.
sentences.chinese: 房顶有几块石板瓦掉了。

detailed_translations.english: a dark grey rock that can easily be split into flat thin pieces

detailed_translations.chinese: 铺石板；严厉批评某人；计划
detailed_translations.english: if something is slated to happen, it is planned to happen in the future, especially at a particular time

sentences.english: The home team squandered a number of chances in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 主队在上半场浪费了几次机会。

detailed_translations.english: to carelessly waste money, time, opportunities etc

sentences.english: Add the mint and allow the flavours to mingle.
sentences.chinese: 加入薄荷，把各种味道混合起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 混合起来， 相混合； 相交往， 相往来
detailed_translations.english: if two feelings, sounds, smells etc mingle, they mix together with each other
if two feelings, sounds, smells etc mingle, they mix together with each other

name: groove
trans: 享受，极其满意，过得快活：take pleasure in

sentences.english: The bolt slid easily into the groove.
sentences.chinese: 插销顺畅地滑入凹槽。

sentences.english: a shallow groove cut into the cliff
sentences.chinese: 悬崖上的一道浅槽

detailed_translations.chinese: [建] 凹槽，槽；最佳状态；惯例
detailed_translations.english: a thin line cut into a hard surface

name: anesthetic
trans: 止痛剂：relieves pain; 无感觉的，麻木的：lacking awareness or sensitivity

sentences.english: Egotism is the anesthetic that dulls the pain of stupidity.
sentences.chinese: 自负是为了麻痹因为愚蠢带来痛楚的麻醉剂。

sentences.english: The acceptance of cocaine as a local anesthetic was immediate, and in this way the history of local anesthesia differs sharply from that of general anesthesia.
sentences.chinese: 可卡因很快被公认为是一种局部麻药，就这点看来，局部麻醉的历史和全身麻醉的发展史有明显的区别。

sentences.english: The injection itself may include local anesthetic and/or saline along with the steroid medication to give immediate pain relief and flush the area of inflammatory agents.
sentences.chinese: 注射药物本身包括局部麻醉剂和和/或生理盐水以及激素类药物，达到迅速止痛并冲洗局部炎性介质的作用。

name: invidious
trans: a.惹人反感的，导致伤害和仇恨的，招人嫉妒的
惹人反感的：cause discontent；羡慕嫉妒恨的：resentment of another’s possessions

sentences.english: By innocently lying to detectives, she’d put herselfinaninvidious position.
sentences.chinese: 由于无意间向侦探撒了谎，她把自己置于一个尴尬的境地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诽谤的；不公平的；引起反感的；易招嫉妒的
detailed_translations.english: unpleasant, especially because it is likely to offend people or make you unpopular

name: array
trans: 排列，阵列：arrangement；排列，摆放：arrange or display；装饰，装修：dress or decorate

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: anarchist
trans: 反抗权威的人：rebels against any authority

sentences.english: West Berlin always had a large anarchist community.
sentences.chinese: 西柏林一直存在一个大的无政府主义群体。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes that governments, laws etc are not necessary

name: histrionic
trans: 戏剧的，演员的：relating to actors

sentences.english: Dorothea let out a histrionic groan.
sentences.chinese: 多罗西亚发出了一声做作的呻吟。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to someone's behaviour as histrionic, you are critical of it because it is very dramatic, exaggerated, and insincere

name: grandiose
trans: 自命不凡的，浮夸的：grandeur；宏大的：greatness

sentences.english: The lack of such leaders may also be the hallmark of a largely post-ideological era in which far less need is felt for unifying doctrines or the grandiose figures who provide them.
sentences.chinese: 这种领袖人物的缺乏可能也是一个大后意识形态时代的重要象征，在这个时代，人们更少需要一个统一的教义或是一个提供给大众的浮夸形象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宏伟的；堂皇的；浮夸的；宏大的
detailed_translations.english: grandiose plans sound very important or impressive, but are not practical

sentences.english: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

sentences.english: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

detailed_translations.english: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

name: din
trans: 喧闹声，嘈杂声：loud noise；重复，使人厌烦地反复灌输：again

sentences.english: We expect the din of the cloud-related chatter to turn into a real roar by this time next year.
sentences.chinese: 我们期望云相关的喋喋不休的喧闹在明年的这个时候变成真正的咆哮。

detailed_translations.english: a loud unpleasant noise that continues for a long time

sentences.english: It has been suggested the founders were not true patriots but men out to protect their own interests.
sentences.chinese: 有人指出创建者并非真正的爱国者，而是一些维护自己利益的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who loves their country and is willing to defend it – used to show approval

sentences.english: As things got worse at work, he began to use alcohol as a crutch.
sentences.chinese: 工作每况愈下，他就开始借酒消愁。

detailed_translations.english: one of a pair of long sticks that you put under your arms to help you walk when you have hurt your leg

sentences.english: The offender must make restitution for the hurt that he or she has caused.
sentences.chinese: 违法者必须为其所造成的伤害作出赔偿。

detailed_translations.english: the act of giving back something that was lost or stolen to its owner, or of paying for damage

sentences.english: ...a motley collection of vans, old buses, cattle trucks, and even a fire engine.
sentences.chinese: ...杂七杂八的一堆车，有运货车、旧公共汽车、运牛卡车，甚至有一辆消防车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杂色的；混杂的；五颜六色的
detailed_translations.english: You can describe a group of things as a motley collection if you think they seem strange together because they are all very different

sentences.english: Soak the clothes in cold water.
sentences.chinese: 把衣服浸泡在冷水里。

sentences.english: Let the pans soak; I’ll wash them later.
sentences.chinese: 把锅泡着吧，我过一会儿再洗。

detailed_translations.english: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean
if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: snare
trans: 无法逃脱的困境：catches and holds；捕捉：capture by

sentences.english: A rabbit was caught in the snare.
sentences.chinese: 一只兔子被套索套住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陷阱；圈套；[外科] 勒除器
detailed_translations.english: a trap for catching an animal, especially one that uses a wire or rope to catch the animal by its foot
to catch an animal by using a snare

sentences.english: The interview reflected a growing rift between the president and Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这次会见反映出总统与国会间日益加深的不和。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or narrow opening in a large mass of rock, cloud etc

name: pristine
trans: 纯净的，质朴的，未被文明腐蚀的：pure, free from dirt or decay

sentences.english: a pristine white shirt
sentences.chinese: 非常干净的白衬衫

sentences.english: They agreed to call a truce .
sentences.chinese: 他们同意宣布休战。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between enemies to stop fighting or arguing for a short time, or the period for which this is arranged

name: humility
trans: 谦卑，谦逊：absence of any feeling s better

sentences.english: ...a deep sense of humility.
sentences.chinese: …深深的谦卑感。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of not being too proud about yourself – use this to show approval

name: worship
trans: 崇拜，敬仰：respect；崇拜，膜拜：offer honor or respect

sentences.english: The ceremony must take place in a recognized place of worship.
sentences.chinese: 该仪式必须在获得认可的敬拜场所举行。

sentences.english: He absolutely worships her.
sentences.chinese: 他太崇拜她了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼拜；崇拜；崇拜: 爱慕：崇敬
detailed_translations.english: the activity of praying or singing in a religious building in order to show respect and love for a god
to admire and love someone very much

name: wilt
trans: （花、植物等）萎焉：limp or flaccid；精神萎靡，憔悴：fatigue or exhaustion

sentences.english: The roses wilted the next day.
sentences.chinese: 这些玫瑰花第二天就枯萎了。

detailed_translations.english: if a plant wilts, it bends over because it is too dry or old

name: trifle
trans: 不重要的事：little importance or value；不正经地对待，玩弄：without serious intent

sentences.english: There’s no point in arguing over trifles.
sentences.chinese: 为琐事争吵毫无意义。

detailed_translations.english: something unimportant or not valuable

sentences.english: Perhaps we are just chasing a mirage.
sentences.chinese: 也许我们只是在追逐一个梦。

detailed_translations.english: an effect caused by hot air in a desert, which makes you think that you can see objects when they are not actually there

name: rehabilitate
trans: 使复原，使康复：restore to healthy condition；（使）洗心革面：better in character

sentences.english: a special unit for rehabilitating stroke patients
sentences.chinese: 协助中风患者康复的特殊病房

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复地位；使残疾者恢复正常的生活
detailed_translations.english: to help someone to live a healthy, useful, or active life again after they have been seriously ill or in prison

name: placid
trans: 宁静的，风平浪静的：free from storms；冷静的，淡定的：free from agitation

sentences.english: a large, placid baby
sentences.chinese: 一个胖胖的、安静的婴儿

sentences.english: She sat still, placid and waiting.
sentences.chinese: 她安安静静坐着等候。

detailed_translations.english: a placid person does not often get angry or upset and does not usually mind doing what other people want them to

sentences.english: As children we were taught to be frugal and hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候被教育要节俭和勤劳。

sentences.english: He led a remarkably frugal existence.
sentences.chinese: 他过着极其节俭的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；朴素的；花钱少的
detailed_translations.english: careful to buy only what is necessary

name: relinquish
trans: 放弃（职位，权力等）：give up；移交，交出：give control or possession

sentences.english: No one wants to relinquish power once they have it.
sentences.chinese: 人一旦有了权就不想放弃。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone else have your position, power, or rights, especially unwillingly

name: hive
trans: 忙碌之地：activity；储备，积累：store up

sentences.english: The most important member of any hive is the queen bee.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个蜂房中最重要的成员都是蜂王。

sentences.english: What people must remember is that one hive quickly become two, two become four and four become eight.
sentences.chinese: 人们一定要记住的是，一个蜂巢很快会变成两个，两个变成四个，四个变成八个。

detailed_translations.english: a small box where  bees  are kept, or the bees that live in this box

sentences.english: She was an industrious and willing worker.
sentences.chinese: 她是个勤劳肯干的工人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is industrious works hard

name: accessible
trans: 可以达到的：within easy reach; 可以理解的：understood; 能够获得的：get

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: reticent
trans: 沉默不语的：inclined to be silent；不愿意的：slow to begin

sentences.english: She is so reticent about her achievements.
sentences.chinese: 她对于自己的成就如此缄默。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉默的；有保留的；谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is reticent does not tell people about things

name: chasm
trans: 分歧，（意见、利益或忠诚上）明显差异：pronounced difference

sentences.english: a rope bridge across the chasm
sentences.chinese: 峡谷上的索桥

detailed_translations.english: a very deep space between two areas of rock or ice, especially one that is dangerous

name: conviction
trans: 深信，确信：being convinced；证明有罪：proved guilty

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

name: discharge
trans: v.流出；释放；解雇；履行义务
解雇：dismiss；释放：free；不承担责任：freeing obligation, responsibility

sentences.english: Sewage is discharged directly into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 污水被直接排放到海里。

sentences.english: the discharge of toxic waste into the sea
sentences.chinese: 有毒废物向海里的排放

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, liquid, smoke etc, or to allow it to escape
when gas, liquid, smoke etc is sent out, or the substance that is sent out

sentences.english: The top layer of skin has to be grafted onto the burns.
sentences.chinese: 表层皮肤必须移植到烧伤处。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a piece of skin, bone etc from part of someone’s body and put it onto or into a part of their body that has been damaged
a piece of healthy skin or bone taken from someone’s body and put in or on another part of their body that has been damaged

sentences.english: And, furthermore, he started to abbreviate.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他开始使用缩写词。

sentences.english: I like to abbreviate my name because it's easier for people to remember.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢缩写我的名字，因为这样人们更容易记住。

sentences.english: N You can even abbreviate and put Y or N.
sentences.chinese: 甚至可以缩写Y或。

name: dappled
trans: 有斑点的，花的：marked with small spots, mottled, spotted；色彩斑斓的：two or more colors

sentences.english: the dappled shade of the trees
sentences.chinese: 斑驳的树影

detailed_translations.english: marked with spots of colour, light, or shade

detailed_translations.chinese: 起斑纹（dapple的过去式和过去分词）

name: crucial
trans: 非常重要的，决定性的：extremely significant

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: snobbish
trans: 谄上傲下的，自大的：offensive air of superiority

sentences.english: Her family seems snobbish.
sentences.chinese: 她家里人好像挺势利的。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that shows you think you are better than other people because you are from a higher social class or know more than they do

sentences.english: ‘Can’t do that,’ he drawled languidly.
sentences.chinese: “不能那样做。” 他懒洋洋地拖着长音。

sentences.english: Jack's southern drawl had become more pronounced as they'd travelled southward.
sentences.chinese: 随着他们愈往南行，杰克拖腔拉调的南方口音就愈发明显了。

detailed_translations.english: to speak slowly, with vowel sounds that are longer than usual

detailed_translations.chinese: 慢吞吞拉长调子的说话方式
detailed_translations.english: Drawl is also a noun

name: discredit
trans: 羞耻，使丧失名誉：damage reputation, disgrace；怀疑，不相信：not true, real

sentences.english: However, I believe in questionings, doubtings, searchings, skepticism, and I discredit credulity or blind faith.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我也相信询问、质疑、探索与怀疑，但拒绝轻信或盲从的信仰。

sentences.english: Lily: : But the interviewers don't think so, they discredit the unmarried women above the normal age have mentality defects, although they are turly bright people.
sentences.chinese: 但是面试官却认为年龄这么大了还没结婚也没男朋友，怀疑她们有心理缺陷，尽管她们确实是人才。 。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of other people’s respect or trust

sentences.english: the ridicule of his peers
sentences.chinese: 他同龄人的奚落

sentences.english: The government’s proposals were held up to ridicule (= suffered ridicule ) by opposition ministers.
sentences.chinese: 政府的提案遭到反对党部长们的嘲笑。

sentences.english: He had become an object of ridicule among the other teachers.
sentences.chinese: 他成了其他教师嘲笑的对象。

detailed_translations.english: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid
to laugh at a person, idea etc and say that they are stupid

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.english: Justice will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 正义终将获胜。

detailed_translations.english: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

name: humdrum
trans: 千篇一律，单调：lack of variety；无聊的，乏味的：lacking excitement

sentences.english: ...her lawyer husband, trapped in a humdrum but well-paid job.
sentences.chinese: ...她整天做着单调乏味的工作但收入颇丰的律师丈夫。

detailed_translations.english: boring and ordinary, and having no variety or interest

name: lullaby
trans: 催眠曲：song lull sleep；使镇静，使安心：free from distress

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲正对着婴儿哼着摇篮曲。

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲正对婴儿哼着摇篮曲。

sentences.english: The lullaby had the baby into the land of Nod in no time.
sentences.chinese: 催眠曲一下子就把婴儿送入了睡乡。

detailed_translations.english: a slow quiet song sung to children to make them go to sleep

sentences.english: It is ludicrous to suggest that I was driving under the influence of alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 说我酒后驾车，这真是太荒唐了。

sentences.english: The court granted him the ludicrous sum of £100 in damages.
sentences.chinese: 法院裁定他获得区区100英镑损害赔偿。

sentences.english: That’s a ludicrous idea.
sentences.chinese: 这个想法很荒唐。

detailed_translations.english: completely unreasonable, stupid, or wrong

sentences.english: The president vetoed the bill, and the Senate failed by a single vote to override his veto.
sentences.chinese: 总统否决了议案，而参议院因一票之差未能推翻他的否决。

detailed_translations.english: If someone in authority overrides a person or their decisions, they cancel their decisions

name: agitate
trans: v.搅动，煽动；使不安，使焦虑
煽动，激起：arouse; 使不安：trouble the mind, disturb

sentences.english: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

sentences.english: ...slick television ads touting the candidates.
sentences.chinese: …吹嘘那些候选人的华而不实的电视广告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兜售；招徕；刺探赛马情报
detailed_translations.english: to try to persuade people to buy goods or services you are offering

name: convenience
trans: n.便利，有益；方便(的用具，机械等)

sentences.english: Ready meals sell well because of their convenience.
sentences.chinese: 即食餐因为方便销路好。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

name: idle
trans: a.(指人)无所事事的；无效的；v.懒散，无所事事
闲置的，未使用的：not turned to use；懒散的：lazy；懒散度日，无所事事：without working

sentences.english: I cannot afford to leave the land lying idle.
sentences.chinese: 我不能让土地闲置。

sentences.english: The whole team stood idle, waiting for the mechanic.
sentences.chinese: 整队人干站着等技工来。

sentences.english: The workers have been idle for the last six months.
sentences.chinese: 最近六个月工人们都很闲。

detailed_translations.english: not working or producing anything

name: rabid
trans: a.患狂犬病的；失去理性的

sentences.english: a group of rabid right-wing fanatics
sentences.chinese: 一群极端的右翼狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 激烈的；狂暴的；偏激的；患狂犬病的
detailed_translations.english: having very extreme and unreasonable opinions

sentences.english: The toad’s skin secretes a deadly poison.
sentences.chinese: 蟾蜍的皮肤会分泌一种致命毒素。

detailed_translations.english: if a part of an animal or plant secretes a liquid substance, it produces it

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: lush
trans: 茂盛呃：vigorously；多产的：producing abundantly；（声音、味道）优美的，令人愉悦的：appealing

sentences.english: lush carpets
sentences.chinese: 华丽的地毯

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的，豪华的；苍翠繁茂的
detailed_translations.english: very beautiful, comfortable, and expensive
an  alcoholic

name: intransigent
trans: 不妥协的，固执的：refusal to compromise

sentences.english: an intransigent attitude
sentences.chinese: 不妥协的态度

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to change your ideas or behaviour, in a way that seems unreasonable

name: bore
trans: v.钻孔；使厌烦；n.孔；令人厌烦的人
令人讨厌的人或事物：causes boredom；使厌倦，使厌烦：make weary

sentences.english: Get the special drill bit to bore the correct size hole for the job.
sentences.chinese: 找个特殊的钻头，钻个尺寸合适的孔。

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep round hole in a hard surface
something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you

name: substantiate
trans: 证实：support with proof；使实体化：give material

sentences.english: Katzen offered little evidence to substantiate his claims .
sentences.chinese: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

name: substitute
trans: 取代者，替代品：takes the place of another；取代，替代：take the place of

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

name: obscure
trans: a.难理解的；不清楚的；v.隐藏；使…模糊
含义模糊的：not clearly, veiled, uncertain meaning；平凡的，不知名的：famous；使模糊：indistinct

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

sentences.english: And last but not least, people with whom you can build a rapport and camaraderie with.
sentences.chinese: 一直到最后、并非最不重要的一个人，与你建立起和谐融洽的友谊。

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

name: disarray
trans: 混乱，无秩序：lack order；使混乱：undo order, arrangement

sentences.english: The nation is in disarray following rioting led by the military.
sentences.chinese: 该国发生由军队发动的暴乱后，陷入一片混乱。

detailed_translations.english: If people or things are in disarray, they are disorganized and confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 使混乱；弄乱；使脱去衣服

name: dominant
trans: 处于支配地位的：controlling others；（基因）显性的：genetic dominance

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: dupe
trans: 复制品，复制：exactly like something else；易受骗的人：easily deceived；欺骗：deceive

sentences.english: He was accused of being a dupe of the Americans.
sentences.chinese: 他被控是美国人的傀儡。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is tricked, especially into becoming involved in something illegal
to trick or deceive someone

sentences.english: He asked me a lot of very pertinent questions .
sentences.chinese: 他问了我许多直接相关的问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相关的，相干的；中肯的；切题的
detailed_translations.english: directly relating to something that is being considered

name: breach
trans: n.裂缝，缺口；v.打破，裂开；违背
（对伦理、法律准则的）破坏：breaking, moral or legal code; 违背：fail to keep

sentences.english: The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.
sentences.chinese: 这个国会议员被指控违反保密条例。

detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement
to break a law, rule, or agreement

name: surcharge
trans: v.对…收取额外费用；n.附加费

sentences.english: No person shall prior to leaving the paid area fail or refuse to pay any fare surcharge or other sum leviable in accordance with these by-laws .
sentences.chinese: 任何人不得在未付或拒付按照本附例可征收的任何车费、附加费或其它款项情况下离开已付车费区域。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone pay an additional amount of money
money that you have to pay in addition to the basic price of something

sentences.english: fatuous questions
sentences.chinese: 愚昧的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 愚笨的；昏庸的；发呆的；自满的
detailed_translations.english: very silly or stupid

name: alibi
trans: n.某人当时不在犯罪现场的申辩或证明
不在场的证明，托辞，借口：excuse

sentences.english: He manages to persuade both his wife and girlfriend to provide him with an alibi.
sentences.chinese: 他设法说服他的妻子和女友都为他提供不在场的证明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不在场证明或辩解；托辞
detailed_translations.english: something that proves that someone was not where a crime happened and therefore could not have done it

name: vicious
trans: 凶恶的，恶毒的：desire to inflict；猛烈的：violence or ferocity

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

name: responsive
trans: 反应的，敏感的：quick to respond

sentences.english: I tried to get him talking about his problems, but he wasn’t very responsive .
sentences.chinese: 我试图让他谈谈他的问题，但他不是很愿意讲。

detailed_translations.english: eager to communicate with people, and to react to them in a positive way

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

sentences.english: a bag of cement
sentences.chinese: 一袋水泥

sentences.english: Most artificial joints are cemented into place.
sentences.chinese: 绝大部分人造关节是被黏结复位的。

detailed_translations.english: a grey powder made from  lime  and clay that becomes hard when it is mixed with water and allowed to dry, and that is used in building
to join two things together using cement , glue, etc.

name: impede
trans: 妨碍，阻碍：slow the progress of

sentences.english: Storms at sea impeded our progress.
sentences.chinese: 海上风暴阻碍了我们的航程。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone or something to move forward or make progress

name: grit
trans: n.沙粒；决心，勇气；v.下定决心，咬紧牙关
（面对困难时所表现出来的）毅力：endure pain or hardship

sentences.english: If they gave gold medals for grit, Karen would be right up there on the winners' podium.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们颁发毅力金牌，卡伦应该站在领奖台上。

detailed_translations.english: determination and courage
to scatter grit on a frozen road to make it less slippery

name: quibble
trans: n.遁词；吹毛求疵的反对意见
吹毛求疵：criticize, cavil；牵强之词：微不足道的差别或不切中要点的异议，小反对：minor objection

sentences.english: Lawmakers spent the day quibbling over the final wording of the resolution.
sentences.chinese: 立法者们花了一天争辩决议的最后措词。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诡辩；挑剔；说模棱两可的话
detailed_translations.english: When people quibble over a small matter, they argue about it even though it is not important

name: authentic
trans: 真实的，非仿造的：exactly; 准确的，相符的：original

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

sentences.english: She sat quietly, meditating on the day’s events.
sentences.chinese: 她静静地坐着，思考着这一天发生的事。

sentences.english: I try to meditate for half an hour every evening.
sentences.chinese: 我每天晚上尽量默想半小时。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想,考虑；(尤指宗教上的)沉思,冥想
detailed_translations.english: to think seriously and deeply about something

name: moribund
trans: 即将结束的，垂死的：approaching death；即将过时：obsolete

sentences.english: The patient was moribund by the time the doctor arrived.
sentences.chinese: 医生赶到的时候病人已经奄奄一息。

detailed_translations.english: slowly dying

name: conflate
trans: 混合：turn into a single mass

sentences.english: He conflates two images from Kipling’s short stories in the film.
sentences.chinese: 影片中，他把吉卜林短篇小说中的两个人物形象合并在一起。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things to form a single new thing

sentences.english: We all have our little foibles .
sentences.chinese: 我们大家都有各自的小毛病。

detailed_translations.english: a small weakness or strange habit that someone has, which does not harm anyone else

sentences.english: The girls were awed by the splendour of the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们对大教堂的宏伟气势大为惊叹。

detailed_translations.english: if you are awed by someone or something, you feel great respect and liking for them, and are often slightly afraid of them
a feeling of great respect and liking for someone or something

name: endemic
trans: 地方性的：to a particular region

sentences.english: Violent crime is now endemic in parts of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥一些地区暴力犯罪成患。

detailed_translations.english: an endemic disease or problem is always present in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

sentences.english: He was gratified by Lucy’s response.
sentences.chinese: 他对露西的回答很满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased and satisfied
a situation in which one state or country controls others

name: manifest
trans: 显然的，明显易懂：understanding；显现，显露：make evident

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

sentences.english: He was debilitated by his illness.
sentences.chinese: 他由于生病身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone ill and weak

name: parody
trans: n.模仿性嘲弄文章或表演；拙劣的模仿
（以嘲笑原作作者的）模仿作品：imitated for ridicule；模仿（以嘲弄）：copy to make fun

sentences.english: Her performance contains a strong element of self-parody (= when someone makes fun of their own style ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的表演包含了强烈的自嘲元素。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拙劣的模仿；诙谐的改编诗文
detailed_translations.english: something that is not a correct or acceptable example of something
to copy someone or something in a way that makes people laugh

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: warp
trans: 使偏向：turn；扭曲，变形：twist；曲解：alter the meaning

sentences.english: The door must be warped. It won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 这门肯定是变形了，关不严。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that has become bent or twisted from its original shape
if something warps, or if heat or cold warps it, it becomes bent or twisted, and loses its original shape

name: expire
trans: 断气，死亡：die；到期：come to an end

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: initiate
trans: v.发起，创始；接纳或介绍某人加入某团体等
创造，发动促进：cause beginning；刚入门的新手：person initiation

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: inept
trans: 愚笨的，荒谬的：lack of judgment；不恰当的，不合时宜的：not appropriate；不称职的，无能力的：incompetent

sentences.english: inept leadership
sentences.chinese: 拙劣的领导

sentences.english: He was criticized for his inept handling of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他因处理这个问题不力而遭到批评。

detailed_translations.english: not good at doing something

name: fluctuate
trans: 波动，无规则地变动：shift back and forth

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。
