detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

sentences.english: He scrawled his name at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 他在底端潦草地写下了自己的名字。

detailed_translations.english: to write in a careless and untidy way, so that your words are not easy to read
untidy, careless writing

name: barbarous
trans: 野蛮的，凶残的：mercilessly; 未开化的：uncivilized

sentences.english: The trade in exotic birds is barbarous.
sentences.chinese: 买卖奇异鸟类是很残忍的。

detailed_translations.english: extremely cruel in a way that is shocking

sentences.english: Unfortunately, parts of the original manuscript have been lost.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，部分原始手稿丢失了。

detailed_translations.english: a book or piece of writing before it is printed

name: vindicate
trans: 为...平反，为...辩护，使无罪：free from blame；证明，证实：give evidence

sentences.english: The charges are false, and we are sure we will be vindicated in court.
sentences.chinese: 指控不实，我们确信法庭会证明我们是无辜的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 维护；证明…无辜；证明…正确
detailed_translations.english: to prove that someone who was blamed for something is in fact not guilty

name: austere
trans: 朴素的，朴实无华的：simple；严肃的，令人生畏的：stern and cold

sentences.english: the church’s austere simplicity
sentences.chinese: 那座教堂的朴实无华

detailed_translations.chinese: 严峻的；简朴的；苦行的；无装饰的
detailed_translations.english: plain and simple and without any decoration

name: squat
trans: 又矮又胖的：broad in build, short in stature

sentences.english: We squatted beside the pool and watched the diver sink slowly down.
sentences.chinese: 我们蹲在池边，看潜水员慢慢沉下水。

detailed_translations.english: to sit with your knees bent under you and your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet
a squatting position
short and thick or low and wide, especially in a way which is not attractive

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: adore
trans: 喜爱，因···感到愉悦：pleasure; 宠爱：tenderness

sentences.english: Betty adores her grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂非常宠爱孙辈。

detailed_translations.english: to love someone very much and feel very proud of them

sentences.english: a malicious girl
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的女孩

detailed_translations.english: very unkind and cruel, and deliberately behaving in a way that is likely to upset or hurt someone

name: elude
trans: 躲闪，躲避：avoid adroitly；使无法理解，使困惑：escape the perception

sentences.english: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到河里，甩掉了追踪他的人。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them

name: flout
trans: 嘲弄性不理会，蔑视：treat with disregard

sentences.english: ...illegal campers who persist in flouting the law.
sentences.chinese: …一向无视法律的非法露营者。

detailed_translations.english: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it

name: epitomize
trans: 摘要，概括：short statement, main points；代表，体现，是…的典型范例：represent a typical example of

sentences.english: This building epitomizes the spirit of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 这栋建筑体现了19世纪的时代精神。

detailed_translations.english: to be a very typical example of something

name: apt
trans: 恰当的，合适的：suitable, appropriate; 有倾向的，可能的：tendency, likely; 聪明的：intelligent, responsive

sentences.english: ‘Love at first sight’ is a very apt description of how he felt when he saw her.
sentences.chinese: 用“一见钟情”来形容他见到她时的感觉再恰当不过。

sentences.english: She had taught him French and he had been an apt student.
sentences.chinese: 她教过他法语，他一直是个聪慧的学生。

detailed_translations.english: exactly right for a particular situation or purpose

sentences.english: This dangerous task exhilarate his spirits.
sentences.chinese: 这项危险的任务使他精神振奋。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very excited and happy

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

name: understudy
trans: n.预备演员，替角；v.充当…的替角

sentences.english: When the play's star broke her leg her understudy wept crocodile tears.
sentences.chinese: 当这部剧的主演摔坏了腿时，她的替角流下了鳄鱼的眼泪。

sentences.english: While the star is recuperating from her illness, her role will be played by her understudy.
sentences.chinese: 当明星正在休养恢复健康时，她的角色由修补演员代替。

detailed_translations.english: to be an understudy for a particular actor in a play
an actor who learns a part in a play so that they can act the part if the usual actor is ill

sentences.english: an affable guy
sentences.chinese: 一个平易近人的人

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to talk to

name: petition
trans: 请愿，正式的申请，申请书：supplication or request；（尤指正式地）请求：,make a request

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: enlighten
trans: v.启发，开导，教导，授予…知识
使知道，启发：inform, instruct；（在道德或精神上）进行教育：provide moral understanding

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

sentences.english: I think there is an historic enmity between them.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们之间存在着宿怨。

detailed_translations.english: Enmity is a feeling of hatred toward someone that lasts for a long time

name: belie
trans: 错误的描述，误述：picture falsely; 证明···为假：false, wrong; 掩饰：shut off from view; 与···相对立，与···相矛盾：counter

sentences.english: Her pleasant manner belied her true character.
sentences.chinese: 她讨人喜欢的举止掩饰了她真实的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩饰；与…不符；使失望；证明…虚假错误
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a false idea about something

sentences.english: ...new offices divided only by glass partitions.
sentences.chinese: …仅仅用玻璃隔板隔开的新办公室。

detailed_translations.chinese: 划分，分开；[数] 分割；隔墙；隔离物
detailed_translations.english: a thin wall that separates one part of a room from another
to divide a country, building, or room into two or more parts

name: glide
trans: 轻松地行动，轻松地通过：smoothly, continuously, effortlessly

sentences.english: Waiters glide between tightly packed tables bearing trays of pasta.
sentences.chinese: 侍者们托着一盘盘的意大利面食在拥挤的餐桌间自如穿行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滑翔；滑行；悄悄地走；消逝
detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly and quietly, as if without effort
a smooth quiet movement that seems to take no effort

sentences.english: she is disenchanted with the marriage

detailed_translations.english: to make disappointed or disillusioned

name: stifle
trans: 抑制（声音、呼吸等）；阻止，扼杀：hold back

sentences.english: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
sentences.chinese: 他差点被烟熏得窒息了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （马等的）后膝关节；（马等的）[动] 后膝关节病

name: congruent
trans: 和谐一致的：in agreement；全等的：coinciding

sentences.english: They want to work in an organization whose values are congruent with their own.
sentences.chinese: 他们想在一家与他们自己的价值观相同的组织里工作。

detailed_translations.english: congruent  triangles  are the same size and shape

sentences.english: ‘Please, Vic, come with us,’ Nancy coaxed.
sentences.chinese: “求你了，维克，跟我们一起去吧。”南希哄劝道。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

name: inaugurate
trans: 使就职：induct into an office；开始：begin

sentences.english: He will be inaugurated (as) President in January.
sentences.chinese: 他将于一月份就任总统。

sentences.english: The moon landing inaugurated a new era in space exploration.
sentences.chinese: 登陆月球开创了太空探索的新纪元。

detailed_translations.english: to introduce a new public official or leader at a special ceremony

name: release
trans: 排放：give off；释放，使获得自由：set free；解雇：let go from office

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: emulate
trans: 效仿并努力超越：excel through imitation

sentences.english: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
sentences.chinese: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
detailed_translations.english: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them

name: inert
trans: （人）懒惰缺乏活力的；（物品）惰性的：sluggish, deficient

sentences.english: inert gases
sentences.chinese: 惰性气体

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 惰性的；呆滞的；迟缓的；无效的
detailed_translations.english: not producing a chemical reaction when combined with other substances

name: maverick
trans: 特立独行之人：does not conform；标新立异的，不合常规的：deviating

sentences.english: He’s always been a bit of a maverick.
sentences.chinese: 他总是有点特立独行。

sentences.english: ...a maverick group of scientists, who oppose the prevailing medical opinion on the disease.
sentences.chinese: …一群特立独行的科学家，他们反对关于这种疾病的医学界的盛行观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 没打烙印的动物；持不同意见的人
未打烙印的；行为不合常规的；特立独行的
detailed_translations.english: Maverick is also an adjective

sentences.english: Todd sat on the front fender, his legs dangling toward the ground.
sentences.chinese: 托德坐在前挡泥板上，双腿耷拉晃荡着。

detailed_translations.chinese: （汽车等的）挡泥板；防卫物；（暖炉的）炉围；（船只的）碰垫
detailed_translations.english: the side part of a car that covers the wheels

name: husky
trans: （尤指声音）沙哑的，粗糙的：rough；高大威猛的：muscular

sentences.english: ‘Come quickly,’ she said in a husky whisper.
sentences.chinese: “快来。”她用沙哑的嗓音低声说道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声音沙哑的；有壳的；强壮的
detailed_translations.english: a husky voice is deep, quiet, and attractive

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮结实之人；爱斯基摩人
detailed_translations.english: a dog with thick hair used in Canada and Alaska to pull  sledges  over the snow

name: inflame
trans: 点燃，燃烧：set on fire；使加剧：more violent

sentences.english: The shooting inflamed ethnic tensions.
sentences.chinese: 枪击事件加剧了种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: How do you test the prototype of the vending machine?
sentences.chinese: 你如何测试一个自动售货机的原型?。

sentences.english: What is the difference between these prototype declaration?
sentences.chinese: 这些原型声明的区别是什么？

sentences.english: But how do you come up with the architecture for this evolutionary prototype?
sentences.chinese: 但是你将如何为这个进化的原型提出系统的架构呢？

detailed_translations.english: the first form that a new design of a car, machine etc has, or a model of it used to test the design before it is produced

name: voluminous
trans: 卷数多的，大量的，庞大的：great number

sentences.english: He took voluminous notes during the lecture.
sentences.chinese: 他在听课时作了大量笔记。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大量的；多卷的，长篇的；著书多的
detailed_translations.english: voluminous books, documents etc are very long and contain a lot of detail

name: precipitate
trans: 匆忙的：careless speed；促使，导致：cause to happen

sentences.english: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.english: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入
detailed_translations.english: to make something serious happen suddenly or more quickly than was expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的
detailed_translations.english: A precipitate action or decision happens or is made more quickly or suddenly than most people think is sensible

name: gripe
trans: 抱怨：dissatisfaction；（通过连续让人讨厌的举动）激怒，惹怒：disturb

detailed_translations.english: sudden bad stomach pains

sentences.english: insurance providing indemnity against future liabilities
sentences.chinese: 对将来的债务提供保障的保险

detailed_translations.english: protection against loss or damage, especially in the form of a promise to pay for any losses or damage

name: esoteric
trans: 深奥难懂的：difficult to understand；少数人知道的：not known by the general

sentences.english: ...esoteric knowledge.
sentences.chinese: …深奥难懂的知识。

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘传的；限于圈内人的；难懂的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as esoteric, you mean it is known, understood, or appreciated by only a small number of people

sentences.english: His friends entreated him not to go.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友们恳求他不要去。

sentences.english: He entreated them to delay their departure.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求他们晚些再走。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone, in a very emotional way, to do something for you

name: airtight
trans: 无瑕疵的：no, flaw; 密封的，不透气的：impermeable to air

sentences.english: airtight containers
sentences.chinese: 密封容器

detailed_translations.chinese: 密闭的，密封的；无懈可击的
detailed_translations.english: not allowing air to get in or out

sentences.english: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
sentences.chinese: 他声称那些毒品是有人为了栽赃陷害他而放在那里的。

detailed_translations.english: If something incriminates you, it suggests that you are responsible for something bad, especially a crime

sentences.english: We watched our fellow students saunter into the building.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着同学们漫步走进了那栋楼。

detailed_translations.english: to walk in a slow relaxed way, especially so that you look confident or proud

name: opaque
trans: 不透光的：impenetrable by light, neither transparent translucent；晦涩的：obscure

sentences.english: a shower with an opaque glass door
sentences.chinese: 装有不透明玻璃门的淋浴间

detailed_translations.chinese: 不透明的；不传热的；迟钝的
detailed_translations.english: opaque glass or liquid is difficult to see through and often thick

sentences.english: Blue veins showed through her translucent skin.
sentences.chinese: 她半透明的皮肤下青筋显现。

detailed_translations.english: not trans-parent, but clear enough to allow light to pass through

name: eclectic
trans: 混合的，多元化的：from various sources

sentences.english: But they are the tip of an eclectic iceberg in the country.
sentences.chinese: 其实这只不过是折衷主义在这个国家表现出来的冰山一角。

sentences.english: One of my (several) frustrations in life is the eclectic way the word “science” is used in human discourse.
sentences.chinese: 我在生活中遇到的挫折之一，是试图改变人类在使用“科学”一词时的折衷的态度。

sentences.english: At the same time, countless of Jazz clubs, discotheques and the endless music from open air beer garden even made the OrdRoad turn into a popular gathering location for eclectic today.
sentences.chinese: 同时不计其数的爵士俱乐部，迪斯科舞厅和露天啤酒花园的无休止的音乐也使乌节路成为了今天折中主义者聚集的场所。

name: canny
trans: 精明的，聪明的：careful and shrewed

sentences.english: a canny political advisor
sentences.chinese: 精明的政治顾问

detailed_translations.english: clever, careful, and not easily deceived, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

sentences.english: a servile attitude
sentences.chinese: 卑躬屈膝的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 奴隶的；奴性的；卑屈的；卑屈的
detailed_translations.english: very eager to obey someone because you want to please them – used to show disapproval

name: fraught
trans: 充满的：full；令人忧虑的：emotional distress

sentences.english: The earliest operations employing this technique were fraught with dangers.
sentences.chinese: 最早采用这一技术的手术充满了危险。

detailed_translations.english: If a situation or action is fraught with problems or risks, it is filled with them

name: scruple
trans: （良心上的）不安：uneasy feeling about the rightness

sentences.english: a man with no moral scruples
sentences.chinese: 一个道德上无所顾忌的男人

detailed_translations.english: a belief about what is right and wrong that prevents you from doing bad things

name: deflect
trans: 使偏斜，使转向：turn aside from a straight course

sentences.english: He deflected the blow with his forearm.
sentences.chinese: 他用前臂挡开了打来的一拳。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction

sentences.english: a wily politician
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的政客

detailed_translations.english: clever at getting what you want, especially by tricking people

name: resilience
trans: 弹力：resume original shape；恢复能力：ability to recover quickly

sentences.english: And I think what we're seeing in the economy now is the inherent resilience of the American economy and the American people.
sentences.chinese: 而且我认为，我认为，在经济方面，我们现在看到的是美国经济和美国人民一直以来所固有的弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of a substance such as rubber to return to its original shape after it has been pressed or bent

name: ceremonious
trans: 讲究礼节的，庄重的：careful attention to set forms

sentences.english: Putting on a hat can be a ceremonious act, an elegant gesture in the ritual of dressing.
sentences.chinese: 戴帽子被看作一种礼节性的举动， 是着装仪式上一个优雅的举动。

sentences.english: When their bodies arrived in Shanghai, all walks of life in Shanghai held ceremonious funeral service for them.
sentences.chinese: 其灵榇抵达上海后，上海社会各界为之举行了隆重的祭奠活动。

sentences.english: The Spring Festival is the most ceremonious traditional festival, we the Chinese nation is the most festive atmosphere all holidays a festival.
sentences.chinese: 春节是我们中华民族最隆重的传统节日，是所有的节日中最有节日氛围的一个节日。

detailed_translations.english: done in a formal serious way, as if you were in a ceremony

sentences.english: a wedding rehearsal
sentences.chinese: 婚礼的预演

detailed_translations.chinese: 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述
detailed_translations.english: a time when all the people in a play, concert etc practise before a public performance

name: peel
trans: 剥去...的皮：strip off；脱去（衣服等）：take off clothes

sentences.english: Peel and dice the potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 把马铃薯去皮并切成丁。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
the skin of some fruits and vegetables, especially the thick skin of fruits such as oranges, which you do not eat

name: fragile
trans: 易碎的：broken；易受伤的，脆弱的：easily injured

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

name: blur
trans: n.模糊不清的事物；v.使…模糊
（使）变得朦胧，（使）变得不清楚：vague; 使不易理解：unclear to the understanding

sentences.english: The street lights were blurred by the fog.
sentences.chinese: 街灯在迷雾的笼罩下十分昏暗。

sentences.english: Many of the details in the picture are blurred.
sentences.chinese: 照片中的许多细节部分都模糊了。

detailed_translations.english: to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear
a shape that you cannot see clearly

name: dissect
trans: 仔细分析：examine, analyze minute；切成片（尤其是为了解剖研究）：cut apart separate

sentences.english: books in which the lives of famous people are dissected
sentences.chinese: 剖析名人生平的书籍

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to understand it

name: hew
trans: 遵守：confirm, hold to something firmly；支持：steadfast support

sentences.english: hewn stone
sentences.chinese: 切割好的石头

detailed_translations.english: to cut something with a cutting tool

detailed_translations.chinese: (Hew)人名；(英)休；(东南亚国家华语)丘

sentences.english: Staff use the poison to exterminate moles and rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 员工用毒药来消灭鼹鼠和野兔。

detailed_translations.english: to kill large numbers of people or animals of a particular type so that they no longer exist

name: accelerate
trans: 加速：faster; 使提前发生：earlier; 变大，变多：greater

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: fabricate
trans: 捏造：make up；搭建，组建，打造：bring into being by combining

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

name: plausible
trans: a.似是而非的，似乎合理的；嘴巧的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

sentences.english: I was sorely tempted to retaliate.
sentences.chinese: 我非常想报复。

detailed_translations.english: to do something bad to someone because they have done something bad to you

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: ingrained
trans: 本质的，根深蒂固的：firmly established

sentences.english: Morals tend to be deeply ingrained.
sentences.chinese: 道德观念往往是根深蒂固的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根深蒂固的；彻头彻尾的；生染的
detailed_translations.english: ingrained attitudes or behaviour are firmly established and therefore difficult to change

detailed_translations.chinese: 使根深蒂固（ingrain的过去分词形式）；生染；就原料染色

sentences.english: an attempt to subvert the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 颠覆民主进程的企图

detailed_translations.english: to try to destroy the power and influence of a government or the established system

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

sentences.english: I just shrugged my shoulders and ignored him.
sentences.chinese: 我只是耸耸肩，没有理睬他。

sentences.english: ‘Suit yourself,’ he said with a shrug.
sentences.chinese: “随你的便。”他耸耸肩说道。

detailed_translations.english: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something
a movement of your shoulders upwards and then downwards again that you make to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

name: uncouth
trans: 粗俗的，没有品位的：lacking in refinement

sentences.english: His nephew is an uncouth young man.
sentences.chinese: 他的侄子是一个粗野的年轻人。

sentences.english: He made the most uncouth and clumsy gestures of delight.
sentences.chinese: 他做出的表示快乐的动作也是极笨拙、极难看的。

sentences.english: We do have the odd barbarian as below who need to release his uncouth behavior as a result of acute servility .
sentences.chinese: 我们确实有象楼下那样的异类野蛮人， 他们要发泄因极度奴性引起的粗野行为。

detailed_translations.english: behaving and speaking in a way that is rude or socially unacceptable

name: dispose
trans: 使倾向于：tendency incline；处理掉（与of连用，dispose of）：get rid of, throw out；有序地布置：orderly

sentences.english: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

name: vaporize
trans: 使（液体）蒸发：convert by heat；彻底消灭：destroy

sentences.english: The benzene vaporized and formed a huge cloud of gas.
sentences.chinese: 苯蒸发形成了一大团气体。

detailed_translations.english: to change into a vapour, or to make something, especially a liquid, do this

name: allay
trans: 减轻：subdue, reduce, intensity or severity

sentences.english: The president made a statement to allay public anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 总统发表了一项声明以缓解公众的忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less afraid, worried etc

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

name: sporadic
trans: 偶尔的，零星发生的：not often occurring

sentences.english: There has been sporadic violence downtown.
sentences.chinese: 市中心时有暴力事件发生。

detailed_translations.english: happening fairly often, but not regularly

name: trudge
trans: 吃力而笨拙地走：heavily or clumsily

sentences.english: We trudged home through the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们艰难地穿过雪地走回了家。

sentences.english: We were reluctant to start the long trudge home.
sentences.chinese: 我们不情愿的开始长途跋涉回家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跋涉；步履艰难地走，费力地走
detailed_translations.english: to walk with slow heavy steps, especially because you are tired or it is difficult to walk
Trudge is also a noun

name: disinterested
trans: 公正的，无偏见的：free from selfish, unbiased；没有兴趣的：lack interest, concern

sentences.english: A lawyer should provide disinterested advice.
sentences.chinese: 律师应该提供客观公正的建议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无私的；公正的；冷漠的；廉洁的
detailed_translations.english: able to judge a situation fairly because you are not concerned with gaining any personal advantage from it

detailed_translations.chinese: 使不再有利害关系；使无兴趣（disinterest的过去分词）

sentences.english: Doctors had tried to dissuade patients from smoking.
sentences.chinese: 医生曾试图说服病人不要抽烟。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone not to do something

sentences.english: It will be a calamity for farmers if the crops fail again.
sentences.chinese: 如果再次歉收，将会给农民带来灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible and unexpected event that causes a lot of damage or suffering

sentences.english: The election of Mary Robinson in 1990 was a watershed in Irish politics.
sentences.chinese: 1990年玛丽·鲁滨逊的当选是爱尔兰政治的分水岭。

detailed_translations.chinese: （美）流域；分水岭；集水区；转折点
detailed_translations.english: an event or time when important changes happen in history or in your life

name: lethal
trans: 非常有害的，致命的：extremely harmful

sentences.english: a lethal dose of heroin
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的海洛因

sentences.english: a lethal weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命的武器

sentences.english: death by lethal injection
sentences.chinese: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡

sentences.english: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
sentences.chinese: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

detailed_translations.english: causing death, or able to cause death

name: dilate
trans: （使）膨胀，扩大：enlarge, expand, wide；详细表达：more fully greater detail

sentences.english: dilated pupils
sentences.chinese: 扩大的瞳孔

detailed_translations.english: if a hollow part of your body dilates or if something dilates it, it becomes wider

sentences.english: Kennedy’s predecessor as President was the war hero Dwight Eisenhower.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who had your job before you started doing it

name: grandstand
trans: 为了给人留下印象而表演，哗众取宠：impress

sentences.english: The grandstand was filled with men in seersucker suits, braces and pocket squares.
sentences.chinese: 看台上的男士都身着泡泡纱西服，配着背带和西服袋巾。

sentences.english: Kim Fonda said she also saw the plane disrespect toward where she was seated in the grandstand.
sentences.chinese: 肯.芬达说在她坐的看台上，她也看到飞机向她横冲直撞过来

sentences.english: He held a presidential review of the troops from a flag-draped grandstand built in front of the White House.
sentences.chinese: 他在白宫前面的看台上检阅了部队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正面看台；观众；哗众取宠的表演
detailed_translations.english: a large structure that has many rows of seats where people sit and watch sports competitions, games, or races

detailed_translations.chinese: 做博取观众喝采的演技

sentences.english: The faeces contain nitrogen which fertilizes the soil.
sentences.chinese: 排泄物含有肥沃土壤的氮。

detailed_translations.english: To fertilize land means to improve its quality in order to make plants grow well on it, by spreading solid animal waste or a chemical mixture on it

name: mean
trans: 卑贱的：ignoble；吝啬的：sharing little；打算，怀有目的：purpose or goal；意味着：convey, show or indicate

sentences.english: The red light means ‘Stop’.
sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.english: This light means you’re running low on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

detailed_translations.english: to have or represent a particular meaning

name: consign
trans: 转交，转移（给他人）：control of another

detailed_translations.chinese: 交付；托运；寄存；把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere, especially in order to sell it

name: frustrate
trans: 挫败，阻挠：prevent；使沮丧：lessen the courage

sentences.english: Their attempts to speak to him were frustrated by the guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们想跟他说话，但被警卫拦住了。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone’s plans, efforts, or attempts from succeeding

name: efface
trans: 擦掉，抹去；使不明显：make indistinct

sentences.english: Nothing can efface the last picture I have of them from my mind.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能抹去他们在我脑海中留下的最后印象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抹去，抹掉；使自己不受人注意
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or remove something

name: budge
trans: （使）改变立场或态度：alter a position; 停止抵抗，屈服：cease resistance

sentences.english: She leaned on the door, but it wouldn’t budge.
sentences.chinese: 她靠在门上，但是门纹丝不动。

sentences.english: The horse refused to budge an inch .
sentences.chinese: 那匹马寸步都不肯走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挪动；微微移动；改变态度或意见；服从
detailed_translations.english: to move, or to make someone or something move

name: luxurious
trans: 豪华的：wealth and comfort；奢侈的：excessive gratification

sentences.english: a luxurious 30-room villa
sentences.chinese: 一栋有30个房间的豪华度假别墅

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, beautiful, and comfortable

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

sentences.english: There’s also the intrinsic pleasure you get from boosting your knowledge and becoming more erudite.
sentences.chinese: 这也有利于你发自内心地努力奋进获得更多学识变得更博学。

sentences.english: The supreme symbol for the author is the word; the erudite Hirst in The Voyage Out has the forename St John recalling the evangelist whose opening line was ‘In the beginning was the Word’.
sentences.chinese: 文字是作家最有力的表达符号，《远航》中博学的赫斯特的教名为圣·约翰，取自感召福音的传教士之名。 他在小说中的开场白为：“语言是世界的初始”。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lot of knowledge based on careful study

sentences.english: Who smile and frown, wince and hiss.
sentences.chinese: 他们微笑和皱眉，畏缩与嘶嘘。

sentences.english: We all wince at the thought of how Xerox utterly failed to innovate on PARC's inventions, allowing Apple and Microsoft to run away with most of them.
sentences.chinese: 我们都退避在想到施乐如何完全的失败再帕洛阿尔托研究中心的发明，允许苹果和微软从他们这儿逃走。

sentences.english: And for the leaders in Bejing to shrink and wince and draw back in the presence of these individuals and their ideas sends a clear message.
sentences.chinese: 北京的领导人对他们的催促显的畏畏缩缩，并不让这些人抛头露面，政府的以对理念给外界发出了一个清晰的信号。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly feel very uncomfortable or embarrassed because of something that happens, something you remember etc

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

sentences.english: She lived through the turmoil of the French Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 她经历过法国大革命的混乱之后仍旧活着。

detailed_translations.english: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

sentences.english: This policy is scarcely consonant with the government’s declared aims.
sentences.chinese: 这项政策与政府所宣称的目标基本上不符。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a combination of musical notes that sounds pleasant
a speech sound made by partly or completely stopping the flow of air through your mouth

name: connoisseur
trans: 鉴赏家（尤指艺术领域）：with discrimination, appreciation；专家：high level of knowledge

sentences.english: a wine connoisseur
sentences.chinese: 品酒专家

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about something such as art, food, or music

name: incontrovertible
trans: 无可争议的：not open to question

sentences.english: CCTV provided incontrovertible evidence that he was at the scene of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 闭路电视提供了案发时他在犯罪现场的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无可争议的；无疑的；明白的
detailed_translations.english: definitely true and impossible to be proved false

name: scowl
trans: 皱眉（表现出不高兴）：expression displeasure

sentences.english: The boss manifested his disgust with a scowl.
sentences.chinese: 老板皱皱眉表露出厌恶。

sentences.english: Their inability to scowl seemed to impair their ability to see why pushy telemarketers or a lack of birthday wishes might make one’s face fall.
sentences.chinese: 无法生气地皱眉似乎让他们不能很好地理解为什么咄咄逼人的电话销售或是没得到生日祝愿会让人沉下脸来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愁容；怒容；阴沉沉的样子

sentences.english: The seafood here is a gourmet's delight.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的海鲜是美食家的一大享受。

sentences.english: Flavoured coffee is sold at gourmet food stores and coffee shops.
sentences.chinese: 调味咖啡在美食店和咖啡馆出售。

sentences.english: The couple share a love of gourmet cooking.
sentences.chinese: 这对夫妇都有烹饪美食的爱好。

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about food and wine and who enjoys good food and wine
Gourmet food is nicer or more unusual or sophisticated than ordinary food, and is often more expensive

name: prosperous
trans: 成功的，繁盛的：vigorous growth, well-being

sentences.english: a prosperous landowner
sentences.chinese: 富裕的土地拥有者

detailed_translations.english: rich and successful

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

sentences.english: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的这座教堂下面还有残余的古罗马地板。

detailed_translations.english: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

sentences.english: a frying pan
sentences.chinese: 炒锅

sentences.english: pots and pans
sentences.chinese: 锅碗瓢盆

sentences.english: Cook the pasta in a large pan of boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 把意大利面放在一大锅开水里煮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平底锅；盘状的器皿；淘盘子，金盘，秤盘
detailed_translations.english: a round metal container that you use for cooking, usually with one long handle and a lid

detailed_translations.chinese: 淘金；在浅锅中烹调（食物）；[非正式用语]严厉的批评
detailed_translations.english: to wash soil in a metal container in order to separate gold from other substances

name: timid
trans: 胆小的，不自信的lacking courage, self-confidence

sentences.english: I was a timid child.
sentences.chinese: 我曾是个胆小的孩子。

sentences.english: a policy that is both timid and inadequate
sentences.chinese: 一项既无胆识又不完善的政策

detailed_translations.english: not having courage or confidence

name: fumble
trans: v.摸索，笨拙搜寻；弄乱，搞糟
笨拙地做：awkward attempts；（无意识的）失误：departure from truth

sentences.english: She reached round to fumble the light on.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手摸索着去开灯。

detailed_translations.english: to try to hold, move, or find something with your hands in an awkward way

sentences.english: the dancer’s graceful movements
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another

name: tenuous
trans: 没有实际内容的，空洞的：little substance

sentences.english: For now, the band’s travel plans are tenuous.
sentences.chinese: 乐队的巡演计划暂时还没确定。

detailed_translations.english: very thin and easily broken

name: cumbersome
trans: 笨重的，难处理的：difficult to handle

sentences.english: Doctors are complaining that the system is cumbersome and bureaucratic.
sentences.chinese: 医生抱怨说该体制复杂繁琐，很官僚。

sentences.english: cumbersome procedures
sentences.chinese: 繁琐的程序

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨重的；累赘的；难处理的
detailed_translations.english: a process or system that is cumbersome is slow and difficult

sentences.english: ...the evanescent scents of summer herbs.
sentences.chinese: ...夏季香草逐渐消散的味道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 容易消散的；逐渐消失的；会凋零的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is evanescent gradually disappears from sight or memory

sentences.english: ...the ignominy of being fired.
sentences.chinese: ...被开除的羞辱。

detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that makes you feel ashamed or embarrassed, especially in public

name: ballad
trans: （由简单诗节和叠句组成的）民歌：poem

sentences.english: ...an eighteenth century ballad about some lost children called the Babes in the Wood.
sentences.chinese: …一首关于迷路儿童的名为《丛林中的宝贝》的18世纪民间叙事诗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歌谣，民谣；叙事歌谣；流行抒情歌曲
detailed_translations.english: a slow love song

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: fickle
trans: a.(爱情或友谊上)易变的，不坚定的
易变的：likely to change；不忠诚的：not true in one’s allegiance

sentences.english: an unpredictable and fickle lover
sentences.chinese: 一个捉摸不透、三心二意的情人

detailed_translations.chinese: 浮躁的；易变的；变幻无常的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval

name: ensemble
trans: 合唱，合奏曲：two or move vocalists

sentences.english: an attractive ensemble
sentences.chinese: 一套漂亮的服装

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体；总效果；全套服装；全套家具；合奏组
detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes that are worn together

sentences.english: As she closed the door, she heard Tom exchanging good-natured banter with Jane.
sentences.chinese: 她关门时听见汤姆与简在开着善意的玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: Banter is teasing or joking talk that is amusing and friendly

name: patent
trans: a.显而易见的；n.专利权(证书)
显而易见的，明显的：readily visible

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

sentences.english: Obama will be the zenith of black America for as long as he lives.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马毕其一生都将成为美国黑人运动成就的顶点。

detailed_translations.english: the most successful point in the development of something

name: stratify
trans: 将...分成各种等级：divide into classes

sentences.english: We currently use a large repository of data from our operational systems to help us stratify, or classify, members.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我们使用我们业务系统的一个大型数据存储库来帮助我们对会员进行分层或分类。

sentences.english: They wanted an instrument that could reasonably stratify adults aged 65 or older into those with a low, moderate, or high risk of developing dementia within six years.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要一项工具，它可以合理地将65岁或以上老年人分成6年内具有低风险、中度风险或高度风险罹患痴呆症的人群。

detailed_translations.english: to form or be formed in layers or strata

sentences.english: Simon waited until the laughter subsided.
sentences.chinese: 西蒙一直等到笑声平息下来。

sentences.english: The pains in his head had subsided, but he still felt dizzy and sick.
sentences.chinese: 他的头痛已经减轻，但仍感到眩晕和恶心。

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, pain, sound etc subsides, it gradually becomes less and then stops

name: lyric
trans: （可以哼唱的）小曲：musical composition；如诗歌般流畅优美的：suggestive of poetry or music

sentences.english: Wordsworth was one of the greatest lyric poets of his time.
sentences.chinese: 华兹华斯是他那个时代最伟大的抒情诗人之一。

detailed_translations.english: expressing strong personal emotions such as love, in a way that is similar to music in its sounds and  rhythm
the words of a song

sentences.english: a shy woman who shunned publicity
sentences.chinese: 不爱抛头露面的羞怯女子

sentences.english: Victims of the disease found themselves shunned by society.
sentences.chinese: 患这种病的人发现，社会上的人都躲着 他们。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid someone or something

name: gamble
trans: 赌博，孤注一掷：bet；（使）受到威胁，冒险：in danger

sentences.english: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

sentences.english: Yesterday, he named his cabinet and took a big gamble in the process.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他冒了很大的风险任命了他的内阁。

detailed_translations.english: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

detailed_translations.chinese: 赌博； 投机， 冒险
detailed_translations.english: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people

sentences.english: Throughout the trial, he had shown no remorse .
sentences.chinese: 整个审判过程中，他没有表示出一丝悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of being sorry that you have done something very bad

name: creep
trans: 缓慢地行进：slowly；匍匐前进：body close to the ground

sentences.english: He crept back up the stairs, trying to avoid the ones that creaked.
sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

sentences.english: The sinews on his neck stood out like knotted string.
sentences.chinese: 他颈部的肌腱像打结的绳般凸出。

detailed_translations.english: a part of your body that connects a muscle to a bone

sentences.english: The November air stung my cheeks, a harbinger of winter.
sentences.chinese: 11月的空气刺痛了我的脸颊，这是冬天要来的先兆。

detailed_translations.english: a sign that something is going to happen soon

name: exhaust
trans: n.(机器排出的)废气，蒸气；v.使非常疲倦
耗尽：consume entirely, complete use of；筋疲力尽：wear out

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

sentences.english: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
sentences.chinese: 把床单撤下来清洗。

sentences.english: a strip of paper
sentences.chinese: 一张纸条

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

name: gladiator
trans: 角斗士：engaged fight death；参与打斗或辩论的人：engaging in controversy

sentences.english: This is an arena for gladiators only, for the Titans of the track.
sentences.chinese: 这是个仅为勇士而且是仅为此行里的大力士勇士所设的竞技场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 角斗士， 与野兽搏斗者
detailed_translations.english: a soldier who fought against other men or wild animals as an entertainment in ancient Rome

name: reign
trans: 统治权：right to command；占统治地位或盛行：be predominant

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

sentences.english: a criminal prosecution
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼

sentences.english: The evidence is not sufficient to bring a prosecution against him.
sentences.chinese: 现有证据不足以对他提出起诉。

detailed_translations.english: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law

name: obligatory
trans: 强制性的：compulsory；（见得多以至于）无聊的：dull

sentences.english: She offered him the obligatory cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 她照例给他端来一杯茶。

detailed_translations.chinese: (法律或道义上)必须的，应尽的
detailed_translations.english: something that is obligatory must be done because of a law, rule etc

name: fallacious
trans: 谬误的，不合逻辑的：containing fallacy；欺骗性的：tending to deceive

sentences.english: Such an argument is misleading, if not wholly fallacious.
sentences.chinese: 这种论点即使不完全是谬误，也是误导人的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谬误的；骗人的；靠不住的；不合理的
detailed_translations.english: containing or based on false ideas

name: insurgent
trans: a.叛乱的，起事的；n.叛乱分子

sentences.english: There, she worked as a low-level intelligence analyst helping her unit assess insurgent activity in the area.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，她是一名初级情报分析员，工作内容是帮助所在部队评估该地区的叛乱活动。

sentences.english: But new reports show a sharp rise in insurgent attacks -- including a 55% increase in children being injured.
sentences.chinese: 但有新的报告显示，叛乱者发动的袭击数量大幅上升，儿童受伤人数也上升了55%。

detailed_translations.english: one of a group of people fighting against the government of their own country, or against authority

sentences.english: an egalitarian society
sentences.chinese: 人人平等的社会

detailed_translations.english: based on the belief that everyone is equal and should have equal rights

sentences.english: Border skirmishes between India and Pakistan were common.
sentences.chinese: 印巴边境的小冲突曾经是常有的事。

sentences.english: They were skirmishing close to the minefield now.
sentences.chinese: 他们当时正在雷区附近小规模交火。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小冲突，小规模战斗；小争论
detailed_translations.english: a fight between small groups of soldiers, ships etc, especially one that happens away from the main part of a battle – used in news reports

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行小规模战斗；发生小争论
detailed_translations.english: If people skirmish, they fight

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

sentences.english: a fishing vessel
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: a burst blood vessel
sentences.chinese: 破裂的血管

sentences.english: a Bronze Age drinking vessel
sentences.chinese: 青铜器时代的饮具

detailed_translations.english: a ship or large boat

name: diversity
trans: 多样性：variety, multiformity；分歧，不同点：different

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

sentences.english: First use some iodine to disinfect the wound.
sentences.chinese: 先用碘酒给伤口消毒。

sentences.english: Disinfect the area thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 把这个区域彻底消毒。

detailed_translations.english: to clean something with a chemical that destroys  bacteria

name: transitory
trans: 短暂的：lasting only a short time

sentences.english: Most teenage romances are transitory.
sentences.chinese: 大多数少年时代的罗曼史都转瞬即逝。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing for only a short time

name: descend
trans: 下降：downward；世代相传：pass by inheritance

sentences.english: Our plane started to descend.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

name: dilettante
trans: 业余爱好者（对艺术或知识领域涉猎浅薄者）／缺乏专业技术的：superficial interest/lacking expert skill

sentences.english: He tolerated the presence of an amateur, idler and dilettante and proved a perfect teacher and matchless travel companion.
sentences.chinese: 他能够容忍我这个业余爱好者的浅薄与无知，当之无愧是一个好老师和一个无与伦比的好伙伴。

sentences.english: It is also a phenomenological layers which encourage dilettante contemplation.
sentences.chinese: 这也是一个鼓励业余爱好者深思的现象层。

detailed_translations.chinese: 业余爱好者；一知半解者
浅薄的；业余艺术爱好的
（在艺术、科学等方面）浅尝辄止

name: shrink
trans: （在数量或价值方面）降低，减小：reduced；（使）本能性地退却（如因遇到使人惊恐的事物），（使）退缩：draw back；表示出不情愿，犹豫：hesitate

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

name: florid
trans: 辞藻华丽的，花哨的：fancy expressions；装饰华丽的：elaborately decorated

sentences.english: Jacobs was a stout, florid man.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布斯是个身材结实，脸色红润的男人。

sentences.english: The country had long been ruled by tyrants.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家长期受暴君统治。

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power and uses it in a cruel and unfair way

name: fleeting
trans: 稍纵即逝的，短暂的：for short time

sentences.english: Time is fleeting.; Time flies.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝。

sentences.english: I watched, smiling, knowing how fleeting these moments when they are small are.
sentences.chinese: 我微笑的看着这一切，我知道这个时刻是多么的短暂。

sentences.english: Most touches were only about five seconds, but in these fleeting moments, we’re capable of communicating distinct emotions, just as we are with the face.
sentences.chinese: 大部分触摸只有五秒左右，然而就是在这么短暂的时间里，我们有能力传达明确的情绪，正像我们通过表情所做的那样。

name: carve
trans: 雕刻：three-dimensional representation; （通过长期不懈努力）开创，开拓：produce or bring about

sentences.english: carved wooden chairs
sentences.chinese: 木雕椅子

sentences.english: Carve the meat into slices.
sentences.chinese: 把肉切成片。

detailed_translations.english: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone

sentences.english: Strange I was stubborn like duplicity said every word is the public taste.
sentences.chinese: 怪我生性倔强喜欢口是心非说的每一句话都不合大众口味。

sentences.english: Since the promotion of a new era is more focused on inner beauty why duplicity of people to meet others vanity and so praised it?
sentences.chinese: 既然新时代提倡的是更加注重于内在美，那为什么口是心非的人为了满足他人的虚荣心而如此称赞呢？

name: blunt
trans: 使变钝：less sharp; 减弱（力度等）：weaken in strength or feeling; 直率的：direct, brief

sentences.english: Sharpen all your blunt knives.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的钝刀子都磨一磨。

sentences.english: a blunt pencil
sentences.chinese: 钝铅笔

detailed_translations.chinese: 钝的；率直的，直言不讳的
detailed_translations.english: not sharp or pointed

detailed_translations.chinese: 使迟钝； 使减弱； 使钝
detailed_translations.english: to make a feeling less strong

name: aboveboard
trans: 无欺诈的，光明正大的：free from，deceit or duplicity

sentences.english: But while there are certainly aboveboard agents and applications, other recruiters engage in fraudulent behavior.
sentences.chinese: 但有一些光明正大的代理机构和申请的同时，另一些招生者从事欺诈行为。

sentences.english: It guarantees a fair and aboveboard election by letting every voter express his or her will freely without subject to coercion, surveillance or threat by anyone.
sentences.chinese: 它通过让每位选民自由表达自己的选举意志，并且没有任何人可以对选民进行胁迫、监视以及威胁，来保证选举是公平、光明正大的。

sentences.english: You can rebuild trust, but only if your husband behaves in a manner that is completely aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 只要你的丈夫的行为方式完全光明正大，你们完全可以重新建立信任。

sentences.english: His business dealings were aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 他的商业交易是光明正大的。

sentences.english: If there was one thing she prided herself on, it was being open and aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 如果她对自己有一事而自豪，那就是她的公开及光明正大。

detailed_translations.english: An arrangement or deal that is aboveboard is legal and is being carried out openly and honestly. A person who is aboveboard is open and honest about what they are doing.

name: caprice
trans: n.奇思怪想，变化无常，任性
一时冲动的决定：impulsive change; 反复无常，善变：change, impulsively

sentences.english: the caprices of a spoilt child
sentences.chinese: 一个被宠坏的孩子的任性行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇思怪想， 反复无常， 任性
detailed_translations.english: a sudden and unreasonable change of mind or behaviour

sentences.english: All the infected clothing was incinerated.
sentences.chinese: 所有沾染了细菌的衣服都被焚化了。

detailed_translations.english: to burn something completely in order to destroy it

detailed_translations.chinese: 关键；难题；十字架形，坩埚

name: derelict
trans: a.荒废的；玩忽职守的；n.被遗弃的人
玩忽职守的，不认真的：lacking duty, carelessly；被社会遗弃的人：social misfit

sentences.english: Her body was found dumped in a derelict warehouse less than a mile from her home.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体被发现丢在离她家不到一英里的一座废弃的仓库里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩忽职守的；无主的；被抛弃了的
detailed_translations.english: a derelict building or piece of land is in very bad condition because it has not been used for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗弃物；玩忽职守者；被遗弃的人

name: mosaic
trans: n.马赛克；镶嵌细工(把小块玻璃石头等镶嵌成图画)
综合物，马赛克般的东西：collection

sentences.english: rooms decorated with wall paintings and mosaics
sentences.chinese: 用壁画和马赛克装饰的房间

sentences.english: a 3rd-century Roman mosaic floor
sentences.chinese: 三世纪罗马镶嵌地面

detailed_translations.chinese: 摩西的；拼成的；嵌花式的

detailed_translations.english: a pattern or picture made by fitting together small pieces of coloured stone, glass etc

name: deadlock
trans: 僵局：a state of inaction or neutralization；使陷入僵局，使停顿：to a deadlock

sentences.english: The talks have reached a complete deadlock .
sentences.chinese: 会谈完全陷入僵局。

sentences.english: a last-ditch effort to break the deadlock
sentences.chinese: 打破僵局的最后努力

sentences.english: Negotiations ended in deadlock.
sentences.chinese: 谈判最后陷入了僵局。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a disagreement cannot be settled

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: plumb
trans: adv.精确地；v.深入了解；测水深
测深度：measure the depth；垂直的：vertical；仔细深入地检查；探索，探究：examine deeply

sentences.english: Psychologists try to plumb the deepest mysteries of the human psyche.
sentences.chinese: 心理学家试图探究人类心理最深层的奥秘。

detailed_translations.english: exactly upright or level

name: conjure
trans: v.恳求，祈求；变魔术，变戏法
请求，恳求：entreat earnestly；在脑海中浮现，想起：form a mental picture

sentences.english: The magician conjured a rabbit out of his hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师从帽子里变出一只兔子来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变魔术， 变戏法； 召唤
detailed_translations.english: to perform clever tricks in which you seem to make things appear, disappear, or change by magic

sentences.english: Our cow is carrying again.
sentences.chinese: 我家的母牛又怀胎了。

sentences.english: The cow is expected to calve next week.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛预期下周生小牛。

sentences.english: The cow cast a calf.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛早产了。

detailed_translations.english: a large female animal that is kept on farms and used to produce milk or meat

name: withhold
trans: 抑制；扣压，不给予：refrain from giving

sentences.english: I withheld payment until they had completed the work.
sentences.chinese: 我扣着钱，直到他们完工。

sentences.english: Ian was accused of withholding vital information from the police.
sentences.chinese: 伊恩被控向警方隐瞒重要信息。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to give someone something

name: baleful
trans: 有害的：harmful; 凶兆的，凶恶的：evil; 致命的：causing death

sentences.english: a baleful look
sentences.chinese: 恶狠狠的目光

detailed_translations.english: expressing anger, hatred, or a wish to harm someone

name: cohesive
trans: 有粘性的；有凝聚力的：cohesion or coherence

sentences.english: a cohesive community
sentences.chinese: 团结的社区

detailed_translations.english: connected or related in a reasonable way to form a whole

name: mash
trans: 面具，伪装：display insincere；伪装，掩饰：disguise

sentences.english: Pick a few leaves from the common lawn weed plantain, wash them, mash them, and apply as a poultice to the affected skin.
sentences.chinese: 从常见的草坪杂草车前草上摘几片叶子，洗净，捣碎，然后像膏药一样敷在受感染的皮肤上。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of  malt  or crushed grain and hot water, used to make beer or  whisky

name: foster
trans: 促进，鼓励，培养：help the growth；养育：bring to maturity

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: hasty
trans: 轻率的：superficial excessive or careless speed

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: discrepancy
trans: （在事实和宣称之间的）差异或矛盾：divergence, disagreement

sentences.english: A modification of the common-origin theory accounts for the density discrepancy .
sentences.chinese: 关于共同起源的理论，有一种改进的论点解释了密度的不符。

detailed_translations.english: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

sentences.english: the firm clasp of her hand
sentences.chinese: 她有力的握手

detailed_translations.english: a small metal object for fastening a bag, belt, piece of jewellery etc
to hold someone or something tightly, closing your fingers or arms around them

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

name: bully
trans: v.以强欺弱，威胁；n.欺负别人者
欺凌弱小者：intimidating manner; 最好的，最棒的：best

sentences.english: Bullies are often cowards.
sentences.chinese: 恃强凌弱者往往是懦夫。

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses their strength or power to frighten or hurt someone who is weaker
to threaten to hurt someone or frighten them, especially someone smaller or weaker

name: secular
trans: 世俗的，尘世的：worldly or temporal

sentences.english: secular education
sentences.chinese: 世俗教育

sentences.english: our modern secular society
sentences.chinese: 我们的现代世俗社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；长期的；现世的；不朽的
detailed_translations.english: not connected with or controlled by a church or other religious authority

detailed_translations.chinese: 修道院外的教士，(对宗教家而言的) 俗人

sentences.english: Her skirt hangs in perfect wide pleats.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙子打着漂亮的宽褶自然下垂。

detailed_translations.english: a flat narrow fold in a skirt, a pair of trousers, a dress etc

name: babble
trans: v.胡言乱语；牙牙学语；喋喋不休
发出含糊无意义的嘟囔声，胡乱说：utter, meaningless; 闲聊：rambling conversation

sentences.english: Similar to us, birds learn to sing by mimicking the adults, and the early chirps are akin to a baby's babble.
sentences.chinese: 和人类一样，鸟类通过模仿长者学习鸣叫，最开始鸣叫时类似于婴儿的牙牙学语。

sentences.english: If your child often has a pacifier in his mouth, he may be less likely to babble and practice talking, or the pacifier may distort his speech.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的宝宝经常含着奶嘴，那这样可能会减少宝宝牙牙学语，练习说话的机会，或者奶嘴可能会搅乱他的言语发展。

name: adjunct
trans: 附属物，非必需部分：not essentially a part

sentences.english: For me, it represents a potent adjunct to antidepressant medications and, for some patients, it’s something you can take in lieu of pills.
sentences.chinese: 对于我，它是一个抗抑郁剂曾用药物的强有力的助手，对一些病人来说，它是能够代替药丸的东西。

sentences.english: " Lyte urges caution as well."It MAY, in really big capitals, prove to be an adjunct to therapy, but there are a number of steps that need to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我们在花费了大量的人力物力之后，也许，也许证明它可以成为一种附属的治疗手段，但是我们仍然有大量的工作要做。

detailed_translations.english: something that is added or joined to something that is bigger or more important

sentences.english: He accused the US of meddling in China’s internal affairs .
sentences.chinese: 他指责美国干涉中国内政。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately try to influence or change a situation that does not concern you, or that you do not understand

name: prospect
trans: 探查，勘探：go into discovery；期待，期望的事物：looking forward to

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: accede
trans: 赞成：approval, consent; 就任，就职：come into an office

sentences.english: Other countries could accede to the deal if they wanted.
sentences.chinese: 其他国家如果需要，却可能同意这种开放。

sentences.english: The foreign Ministers expressed satisfaction with the latest developments of efforts of some ASEAN countries to accede to the World Trade Organization and support for their early entry.
sentences.chinese: 外长们对部分东盟国家争取加入世界贸易组织的最新进展感到满意，并支持其早日加入。

name: homogenize
trans: 使统一化：make agree single established standard

sentences.english: plans to homogenize the various school systems
sentences.chinese: 统一各类不同学制的计划

detailed_translations.english: to change something so that its parts become similar or the same

name: justify
trans: 证明...的合理性，为...辩解：prove to be just, right

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

sentences.english: The flames had singed her hair.
sentences.chinese: 火焰燎了她的头发。

detailed_translations.english: to burn the surface of something slightly, or to be burned slightly
a mark on the surface of something where it has been burnt slightly

sentences.english: the grandeur of the mountains
sentences.chinese: 山峦的巍峨壮丽

detailed_translations.english: impressive beauty, power, or size

sentences.english: ...percussion instruments, redolent of Far Eastern cultures.
sentences.chinese: ...使人联想到了远东文化的打击乐器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 芬芳的；有…香味的；令人想起…的
detailed_translations.english: making you think of something

sentences.english: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格
detailed_translations.english: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something
to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

name: mercenary
trans: （外国军队的）雇佣军：soldier hired；唯利是图的，贪婪的：monetary or material gain

sentences.english: She did it for purely mercenary reasons.
sentences.chinese: 她这么做纯粹是为了钱。

sentences.english: a mercenary attitude
sentences.chinese: 唯利是图的态度

detailed_translations.english: only interested in the money you may be able to get from a person, job etc
a soldier who fights for any country or group that will pay him

name: substantial
trans: 物质的：having substance；有重大意义的：considerable in importance

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: aspect
trans: n.(问题等的)方面；面貌，外表

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

name: court
trans: n.法庭，法院；宫廷，朝廷；v.献殷勤；追求

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: nerve
trans: （坚强的）意志，勇气：power of endurance；给予勇气，鼓励：give courage

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: shroud
trans: 隐蔽物，可起隐蔽、保护或屏护作用的物体：conceals, protects, screens；将...从视线中隔离，遮蔽：shut off from sight

sentences.english: The fog rolled in, and a grey shroud covered the city.
sentences.chinese: 大雾滚滚而来，一张灰色的天幕笼罩着这个城市。

detailed_translations.chinese: 寿衣；覆盖物；船的横桅索；[电] 护罩
detailed_translations.english: a cloth that is wrapped around a dead person’s body before it is buried
to cover or hide something

name: slant
trans: （看待问题、思考的）角度，看法：way of looking；倾斜的：slanting direction；歪曲（事实等）：create a wrong impression

sentences.english: The article had an anti-union slant .
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章有反工会倾向。

detailed_translations.english: a way of writing about or thinking about a subject that is based on a particular opinion or set of ideas
to slope or make something slope in a particular direction

name: skirt
trans: 界限，边界：marks the outer limit；绕行，避开：go around

sentences.english: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: The story has received scant attention in the press.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没在报界引起多少注意。

sentences.english: They produce goods with scant regard for quality.
sentences.chinese: 他们的产品不够重视质量。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不足的；缺乏的；勉强够的
detailed_translations.english: not enough

sentences.english: We agreed on a skeleton outline of the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 我们给提案商定了一个基本框架。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨架，骨骼；纲要；骨瘦如柴的人
detailed_translations.english: the most important parts of something, to which more detail can be added later

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨骼的；骨瘦如柴的；概略的

name: havoc
trans: 大混乱：out of order；大范围破坏：nonexistent unsound or useless

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这座城市造成了大破坏。

sentences.english: He points out that some past offenders in Michigan have been released only to cause havoc and end up in jail again.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，过去密歇根释放的一些犯人只是与造成严重破坏的人有关，而且最后又都重新回到监狱里。

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏。

name: decode
trans: 解码：change into ordinary language；对…有清晰的想法，理解，解读：clear idea

sentences.english: The software decodes the information embedded in the satellite broadcasts.
sentences.chinese: 这种软件能够解读卫星广播中的信息。

detailed_translations.english: if a computer decodes data, it receives it and changes it into a form that can be used by the computer or understood by a person

name: bogus
trans: 伪造的，假冒的：being such in appearance only；虚伪的，做作的：lacking,  spontaneous quality

sentences.english: bogus insurance claims
sentences.chinese: 虚报的保险索赔

sentences.english: bogus applications for asylum
sentences.chinese: 虚假的避难申请

detailed_translations.english: not true or real, although someone is trying to make you think it is

name: crook
trans: 使弯曲：away from a straight line

sentences.english: The crooks got away across the park.
sentences.chinese: 那些骗子穿过公园跑掉了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骗子，坏蛋；弯处，弯曲部分；钩状物
detailed_translations.english: a dishonest person or criminal
if you crook your finger or your arm, you bend it

name: partisan
trans: 跟随者，信徒：follows；（狂热。坚定的）拥护者，支持者：excessively devoted；偏袒的：one side

sentences.english: British newspapers are highly partisan .
sentences.chinese: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 党派的；效忠的；偏袒的；盲目推崇的
detailed_translations.english: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country

sentences.english: On weekdays, the marmosets steered clear of the roar of traffic, and on Sundays they shunned the clamor of visiting crowds.
sentences.chinese: 工作日的时候，这些狨猴避开嘈杂的交通，星期天的时候它们就会避开喧闹的游客。

name: strut
trans: 趾高气昂地走：walk pompous；支柱，压杆strengthen a framework

sentences.english: He struts around town like he owns the place.
sentences.chinese: 他在城里趾高气扬地走着，好像他拥有着这地方似的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 炫耀；在…上趾高气扬地走；给…加支撑
detailed_translations.english: to walk proudly with your head high and your chest pushed forwards, showing that you think you are important
a long thin piece of metal or wood used to support a part of a building, the wing of an aircraft etc

sentences.english: Police records attest to his long history of violence.
sentences.chinese: 警方记录证明他有长期的暴力史。

detailed_translations.english: to show or prove that something is true

sentences.english: her glossy black hair
sentences.chinese: 她那亮泽的黑发

sentences.english: the glossy surface of the leaves
sentences.chinese: 叶子光亮的表面

detailed_translations.english: shiny and smooth

name: inch
trans: 少量，很短的距离：small degree；（使）慢慢移动：move slowly

sentences.english: The curtains were an inch too short.
sentences.chinese: 窗帘短了一英寸。

sentences.english: Rainfall here is under 15 inches a year.
sentences.chinese: 本地的年降雨量不到15英寸。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.

sentences.english: a flaccid penis
sentences.chinese: 疲软的阴茎

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 弛缓的；软弱的；无活力的
detailed_translations.english: soft and weak instead of firm

sentences.english: The Puritans left England to escape being persecuted.
sentences.chinese: 清教徒离开了英国以躲避迫害。

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone cruelly or unfairly over a period of time, especially because of their religious or political beliefs

sentences.english: ...matters pertaining to naval district defence.
sentences.chinese: …与海军区域防卫有关的问题。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it

name: grovel
trans: 卑躬屈膝：draw back, fearful submission

sentences.english: I saw him grovelling in the road for his hat.
sentences.chinese: 我看到他趴在路上找帽子。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone a lot or behave with a lot of respect towards them because you think that they are important and will be able to help you in some way – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: ‘How long will she be ill?’ he asked. There was an ominous silence.
sentences.chinese: “她的病多久会好？”他问。大家的沉默让人感觉不妙。

sentences.english: The car is making an ominous rattling sound.
sentences.chinese: 汽车在发出一种不妙的咔嗒声。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel that something bad is going to happen

name: devout
trans: （对于宗教）虔诚的：devoted to religion；忠诚的：allegiance

sentences.english: a devout Catholic
sentences.chinese: 虔诚的天主徒

detailed_translations.english: someone who is devout has a very strong belief in a religion

sentences.english: The medical profession has been debased by these revelations.
sentences.chinese: 这些事被披露后，医学界的声誉受到了损害。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something lose its value or people’s respect

name: sidestep
trans: （通过逃避而）不遵守：avoid having to comply with

sentences.english: The report sidesteps the environmental issues.
sentences.chinese: 报告回避了环境问题。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid dealing with something difficult

name: safeguard
trans: 保护措施：prevent accident；保护：make safe

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

detailed_translations.chinese: [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施
detailed_translations.english: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
to protect something from harm or damage

name: bane
trans: 祸根：ruin; 有害物质：kill or injure a living thing

sentences.english: Her brother is the bane of her life .
sentences.chinese: 她弟弟是她生活中的灾星。

sentences.english: His calligraphy is vigorous and forceful.
sentences.chinese: 他的书法苍劲有力。

sentences.english: His effortless calligraphy has an unconventional grace of its own.
sentences.chinese: 他的书法， 信笔写来， 十分超脱。

detailed_translations.english: the art of producing beautiful writing using special pens or brushes, or the writing produced this way

name: antipathy
trans: 厌恶，反感：aversion, dislike；令人反感的事物：objection of aversion

sentences.english: ...the voting public's antipathy toward the president.
sentences.chinese: …投票民众对总统的憎恶。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of strong dislike towards someone or something

sentences.english: ...the parable of the Good Samaritan.
sentences.chinese: …善良的撒玛利亚人的寓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 寓言，比喻；隐晦或谜般的格言
detailed_translations.english: a short simple story that teaches a moral or religious lesson, especially one of the stories told by Jesus in the Bible

name: stitch
trans: n.(缝纫时的)一针，一钩；v.缝合

sentences.english: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他头上不得不缝了十针。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

name: sly
trans: 狡猾的：clever or cunning；隐秘的，偷偷的：acting in secret

sentences.english: He leaned forward with a sly smile.
sentences.chinese: 他俯身向前诡秘地一笑。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sly cleverly deceives people in order to get what they want

name: renovate
trans: 修复，维修：restore；使重获新生，使焕然一新：bring back to life

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

name: avid
trans: 急切渴望的：enthusiasm; 贪婪（钱财）的：eager, for material possessions

sentences.english: He misses not having enough books because he's an avid reader.
sentences.chinese: 他遗憾没有足够的书，因为他是一个热爱读书的人。

detailed_translations.english: You use avid to describe someone who is very enthusiastic about something that they do

sentences.english: But it can also inspire and uplift and exalt, because power can be used to help people accomplish marvelous things.
sentences.chinese: 但是，权力也可以激励人、振奋人和提升人，因为它可以帮助人们成就非同寻常的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something into a high rank or position

sentences.english: I wasn’t sure whether to treat her words as a jest.
sentences.chinese: 我吃不准是否该把她的话当成玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: something you say that is intended to be funny, not serious
to say things that you do not really mean in order to amuse people

sentences.english: He loathes their politics.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌他们那一套政治。

detailed_translations.english: to hate someone or something very much

sentences.english: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 据信饮用水已受到污染。

detailed_translations.english: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

sentences.english: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

sentences.english: The United Nations imposed an arms embargo against the country.
sentences.chinese: 联合国对该国施行了武器贸易禁运。

sentences.english: The fruit was embargoed.
sentences.chinese: 水果被禁运了。

sentences.english: They embargoed oil shipments to the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 他们禁止了对美国石油船运。

detailed_translations.english: an official order to stop trade with another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止， 禁止出入港口
detailed_translations.english: If goods of a particular kind are embargoed, people are not allowed to import them from a particular country or export them to a particular country

name: ingenious
trans: 聪明的，有创造才能的：resourceful, cleverness

sentences.english: an ingenious device
sentences.chinese: 精巧的装置

sentences.english: an ingenious cook
sentences.chinese: 心灵手巧的厨师

detailed_translations.english: (of an object, a plan, an idea, etc.) very suitable for a particular purpose and resulting from clever new ideas

sentences.english: petty squabbles
sentences.chinese: 小口角

sentences.english: petty restrictions
sentences.chinese: 小限制

detailed_translations.chinese: 琐碎的；小气的；小规模的
detailed_translations.english: a petty problem, detail etc is small and unimportant

sentences.english: The smell repelled him.
sentences.chinese: 这气味让他反感。
