detailed_translations.english: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

name: morbid
trans: 疾病的，疾病所致的：by disease；（思想性格）变态的：unwholesome thoughts

sentences.english: The trip was made all the worse by Frankie’s morbid fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗基对坐飞机有种病态的恐惧，使得旅途变得更加糟糕。

sentences.english: His head was full of morbid thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑袋里全是不健康的思想。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的；由病引起的；恐怖的；病变部位的
detailed_translations.english: with a strong and unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death

name: cryptic
trans: 秘密的：secret；含义模糊的：ambiguous meaning；超出理解能力的：beyond one’s powers to know

sentences.english: This thrilling story will keep you on the edge of your seat as you explore the house, collect items and unravel cryptic secrets.
sentences.chinese: 这惊心动魄的故事，将让你在你的座位边，为您探索的房子，收集物品和解开神秘的秘密。

sentences.english: It was the cryptic first sign of a cyberespionage and information-warfare campaign devised to disrupt the 2016 presidential election, the first such attempt by a foreign power in American history.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场网络间谍—信息战行动的第一个神秘迹象，该行动旨在干扰2016年的总统大选，在美国的历史上，这还是第一次有外国势力有这样的举动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的； 含义模糊的
detailed_translations.english: having a meaning that is mysterious or not easily understood

sentences.english: Lubricate all moving parts with grease.
sentences.chinese: 给所有活动部件加润滑油。

detailed_translations.chinese: 润滑；涂油；起润滑剂作用
detailed_translations.english: to put a lubricant on something in order to make it move more smoothly

sentences.english: Nothing could obliterate the memory of those tragic events.
sentences.chinese: 那些悲惨事件的记忆是无法抹去的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a thought, feeling, or memory from someone’s mind

sentences.english: exotic birds with colourful crests
sentences.chinese: 羽冠鲜艳多彩的珍禽

detailed_translations.english: the top or highest point of something such as a hill or a wave
to reach the top of a hill or mountain

sentences.english: One cleric resigned over plans to evict the protesters forcibly, arguing that the Church should have been more supportive of their cause.
sentences.chinese: 一位因为计划强行驱逐示威者而辞职的神职人员辩解说国教会应当给予他们更多的支持。

sentences.english: It uses complex network analysis to identify where stealth attacks are taking place and provides the tools organisations need to evict the perpetrators and shore up the network against future threats.
sentences.chinese: 它使用复杂的网络分析，以确定哪些地方正在发生的隐蔽攻击，并提供必要的工具驱逐攻击者，支持网络抵御未来的威胁。

sentences.english: The family saw off attempts by Britain's Royal Navy to evict them and also an attempt in 1978 by a group of German and Dutch businessmen to seize Sealand by force.
sentences.chinese: 但英国海军却多次试图将贝茨家族从“海国”驱逐出去。 1978年，一群来自德国和荷兰的商人曾试图通过武力占领这块“领土”。

sentences.english: You said in your address that "developing excellence is a slow, painstaking process".
sentences.chinese: 你在你的致词中说“发展卓越性是一个缓慢艰苦的过程”。

sentences.english: In order to transform their environment, he drew up the project with painstaking accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 为了改造环境， 他苦心孤诣地制订了这个计划。

name: strand
trans: 绳，线之一股：single filament；遗弃，使置之困境：leave in a unfavorable place

sentences.english: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.english: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc
If you are stranded, you are prevented from leaving a place, for example because of bad weather

name: tirade
trans: 长篇抨击性演讲：angry censorious or denunciatory

sentences.english: Now I fully recognize that I’m sitting here, a nobody myself, spouting off in what could be considered a hypocritical tirade, guilty of the same thing Ms. Barr is.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我完全意识到我正坐在这儿，只有我自己，进行着一次被认为是伪善的长篇演讲，对同巴尔遇到的同样的事儿感到内疚。

sentences.english: During a war the interests of the state are paramount, and those of the individual come last.
sentences.chinese: 战争时期国家利益是首要的，个人利益置于最后。

sentences.english: Women’s role as mothers is of paramount importance to society.
sentences.chinese: 女性作为母亲的角色对社会至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最重要的，主要的；至高无上的
detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else

name: insular
trans: （观念、想法等）孤立狭隘的：narrow provincial viewpoint

sentences.english: an insular community
sentences.chinese: 保守封闭的社团

detailed_translations.chinese: 孤立的；与世隔绝的；海岛的；岛民的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or like an island

name: redeem
trans: 实践，履行（诺言等）：required；改过自新：make better

sentences.english: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
sentences.chinese: 奥利维尔的表演补救了一出本是二流水平的戏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复
detailed_translations.english: to make something less bad

name: distract
trans: 转移（注意力），使分心：draw, direct different；使焦虑，使不安：trouble, uneasy；疯狂的：insane, mad

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

sentences.english: She despised her neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 她看不起她的邻居。

detailed_translations.english: to dislike and have a low opinion of someone or something

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: buoy
trans: 使充满勇气和力量，使振作：courage or strength

sentences.english: The party is buoyed up by the latest opinion poll results.
sentences.chinese: 该党因为最近一次民意测验的结果而受到鼓舞。

detailed_translations.chinese: [水运] 浮标；浮筒；救生圈；航标
detailed_translations.english: an object that floats on the sea, a lake etc to mark a safe or dangerous area
to keep something floating

sentences.english: Refugee workers said such action was a violation of medical ethics.
sentences.chinese: 难民工作者称这种行为违背了医学道德。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理学；伦理观；道德标准
detailed_translations.english: Ethics are moral beliefs and rules about right and wrong

name: raffle
trans: n.(尤指为公益事业举办的)抽奖售物(活动)

sentences.english: a woman selling raffle tickets
sentences.chinese: 一位卖奖券的妇女

sentences.english: During each show we will be raffling a fabulous prize.
sentences.chinese: 每次展览我们都会通过抽彩送出惊人的奖品。

detailed_translations.english: a competition or game in which people buy numbered tickets and can win prizes
If someone raffles something, they give it as a prize in a raffle

name: hurricane
trans: 飓风：a violent rotating storm；飓风般的事物，引起动荡的事物：resembling a hurricane

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: barricade
trans: 障碍物：obstruction, rampart; 用障碍物阻止通过：prevent access

sentences.english: The fans were kept back behind barricades.
sentences.chinese: 歌迷们被拦在路障后面。

detailed_translations.english: a temporary wall or fence across a road, door etc that prevents people from going through
to build a barricade to prevent someone or something from getting in

name: surrender
trans: 交出，放弃，投降：give over to；使沉溺于：give（oneself）over

sentences.english: Germany surrendered on May 7th, 1945.
sentences.chinese: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。

sentences.english: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子被限定在十分钟之内投降。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win

sentences.english: They turned fire hoses on the people and drenched them.
sentences.chinese: 他们打开消防水龙头朝人群喷去，把他们浇湿。

sentences.english: ...the idea of spending two whole days hanging on to a raft and getting drenched by icy water.
sentences.chinese: …在筏子上飘流整整两天并让冰冷的水湿透的想法。

detailed_translations.english: To drench something or someone means to make them completely wet

sentences.english: She evinced no surprise at seeing them together.
sentences.chinese: 看到他们在一起，她没有表露出惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling or have a quality in a way that people can easily notice

name: pillar
trans: 柱子：support；（物质、精神等方面的）支柱：support

sentences.english: Eight massive stone pillars supported the roof.
sentences.chinese: 八根巨大的石柱支撑起房顶。

sentences.english: Mr Fitzwilliam had been seen as a pillar of the community.
sentences.chinese: 菲茨威廉先生已被视为社区的骨干。

detailed_translations.english: a tall upright round post used as a support for a roof or bridge

name: drone
trans: v.嗡嗡地响，单调地说；n.单调的低音
低沉单调地说；嗡嗡地叫：talk monotonous；（昆虫振翅般）单调嗡嗡的声音：monotonous sound；混日子：doing nothing

sentences.english: An airplane droned overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者
detailed_translations.english: a continuous low dull sound
to make a continuous low dull sound

sentences.english: Republican senators were scathing in their criticism of today's hearing.
sentences.chinese: 共和党参议员们对今天听证会的批评很尖锐。

detailed_translations.english: a scathing remark criticizes someone or something very severely

sentences.english: The computer course is ideal for novices.
sentences.chinese: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

sentences.english: This trail is not recommended for novice bikers.
sentences.chinese: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

name: stalwart
trans: 无所畏惧的：no fear；（体魄等）强健的：strength vigor；坚定的：firm, resolute

sentences.english: The original flick is a stalwart of the genre, and it is the duty of everyone, not just horror fans, to watch it at least once.
sentences.chinese: 原版电影是一种坚定的流派，不仅仅是狂热的影迷，每个人都有义务去看至少一遍。

sentences.english: It described the group's head as a "stalwart of the opposition faction", according to the South China Morning Post, which saw the notice on a website run by Minzu University in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 根据南华早报的消息，通知描述了该组织的领导人是一个“反对派坚定的支持者”，南华早报是在北京民族大学运行的网站上看到这则通知的。

detailed_translations.english: strong in appearance
someone who is very loyal to a particular organization or set of ideas, and works hard for them

sentences.english: a judicious choice
sentences.chinese: 审慎而明智的选择

detailed_translations.chinese: 明智的；头脑精明的；判断正确的
detailed_translations.english: done in a sensible and careful way

sentences.english: Police attempts to infiltrate neo-Nazi groups were largely unsuccessful.
sentences.chinese: 警方想打入新纳粹团体的行动基本上不成功。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly join an organization or enter a place in order to find out information about it or harm it

sentences.english: We watched as the fire slowly kindled.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着火慢慢地燃烧起来。

detailed_translations.english: to start burning; to make a fire start burning

name: monarch
trans: 君主，帝王：rules；巨头，大亨：person of rank, power, or influence

sentences.english: Britain's head of state is a constitutional monarch.
sentences.chinese: 英国的国家元首是君主立宪的国王或女王。

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen

name: gratuitous
trans: 无根据的，无理由的：unwarranted；无报酬的，免费的：without return；多余的：not needed

sentences.english: children’s books which include gratuitous violence
sentences.chinese: 包含无谓暴力内容的儿童书籍

detailed_translations.chinese: 无理由的，无端的；免费的
detailed_translations.english: said or done without a good reason, in a way that offends someone

name: mar
trans: 污点，坏点：spoils the appearance；破坏，削弱：impair

sentences.english: Their wedding was marred by the death of Jenny’s mother a week earlier.
sentences.chinese: 一周之前珍妮母亲的过世使他们的婚礼蒙上了一层阴影。

sentences.english: A frown marred his handsome features.
sentences.chinese: 紧锁的眉头破坏了他俊美的面容。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less attractive or enjoyable

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

sentences.english: Henry looked up, then continued his monologue.
sentences.chinese: 亨利抬起头，然后继续他的长篇独白。

detailed_translations.english: a long speech by one person

name: stock
trans: 库存，储备：inventory；普通的，常备的：commonly used

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

sentences.english: Shakespeare’s sonnets
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的十四行诗

detailed_translations.english: a poem with 14 lines which  rhyme  with each other in a fixed pattern

name: admonish
trans: 建议：give advice; 责备：reprove gently

sentences.english: They admonished me for taking risks with my health.
sentences.chinese: 他们告诫我不要拿自己的健康来冒险。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone severely that they have done something wrong

name: founder
trans: 建立者：one establishes；完败：fail utterly；沉没：become submerged

sentences.english: Their marriage began to founder soon after the honeymoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻在蜜月之后不久便触礁了。

detailed_translations.english: to fail after a period of time because something has gone wrong
someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc

name: dehydrate
trans: 去除水分，使干燥：remove water；使失去活力：deprive of vitality

sentences.english: The substance is dehydrated and stored as powder.
sentences.chinese: 该物质经脱水处理后以粉末形式储存。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等
detailed_translations.english: to remove the liquid from a substance such as food or a chemical

name: dynamic
trans: 有力量的，有活力的：productive activity

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

sentences.english: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.english: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

detailed_translations.english: at or from the beginning of an event or process

name: appropriate
trans: 私自挪用：take possession, without permission; 适当的：suitable, fitting

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: autonomy
trans: 政治上的独立：self-governing; 自我主导的自由，（尤其是）精神独立：independence

sentences.english: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
sentences.chinese: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

detailed_translations.english: freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself

name: bliss
trans: 极度快乐：ecstasy; 极乐世界：place of perfect happiness

sentences.english: I didn’t have to get up till 11 – it was sheer bliss.
sentences.chinese: 我可以睡到11点才起来，真幸福啊。

detailed_translations.english: perfect happiness or enjoyment

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

name: indifferent
trans: a.不感兴趣的，漠不关心的
公平的：impartiality；（质量、档次等）中规中矩的，一般的：average；不感兴趣的，冷漠的：lack of interest

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: salutary
trans: 有益健康的：promoting health；有利的，利好的：promoting well-being

sentences.english: I notice we have janitors and janitresses now in offices, and our young men unfortunately miss that salutary branch of business education.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到现在的办公室都配备了工友，这使我们的年轻人不幸丢掉了这个有益的企业教育的一个内容。

sentences.english: Already a celebrity in his field, this "salutary tyrant, " as Riboud called him, dictated "which books to read, what political ideas I should have, which museums and galleries to visit.
sentences.chinese: 这位被里布称为“有益的暴君”的摄影师当时已经是这一领域的名人，他规定了“我该看什么书，持有什么政治理念，去什么博物馆和画廊”。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有益的， 有益健康的
detailed_translations.english: a salutary experience is unpleasant but teaches you something

sentences.english: Elsie muttered something I couldn’t catch and walked off.
sentences.chinese: 埃尔茜咕哝了一句什么，我也没有听懂，她就走掉了。

sentences.english: ‘He’s such an unpleasant man,’ Alyssia muttered under her breath .
sentences.chinese: “他真是个讨厌的人。”阿莉西娅轻声嘟囔着。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in a low voice, especially because you are annoyed about something, or you do not want people to hear you

name: distinctive
trans: 完全不同的：not of the same kind；特征性的，典型的：serving to identify

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

name: issue
trans: v.出来，流出；发给，分发；n.(书刊的)期
（有争议的）话题，议题：matter that is in dispute；发布（期刊）等：produce and release；（使）流出：flow out

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: immune
trans: 不易被感染的，有免疫力的：having resistance to infection；不受影响的：not affected by influence；不受约束的，免除的：not subject to an obligation

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: illuminate
trans: 照明：make shining；阐明：make plain；启迪，启发：spiritual understanding

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

sentences.english: Anna squinted in the sudden bright sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 太阳光突然变强，安娜眯起了眼睛。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something with your eyes partly closed in order to see better
a condition of your eye muscles that makes each eye look in a slightly different direction

sentences.english: Some claim that the herb has therapeutic value for treating pain.
sentences.chinese: 有些人称这种草药具有止痛的疗效。

detailed_translations.chinese: 治疗的；治疗学的；有益于健康的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the treatment or cure of an illness

name: vernacular
trans: 方言：nonstandard language；非正式的，口头的：suitable for speech

sentences.english: In some churches, they speak Latin, but in others they use the vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 在一些教堂中，人们讲拉丁语，但在其他一些教堂中，人们使用本地话。

sentences.english: The common speech of a people; the vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 本国语，不规范语一个民族普通的语言；地方话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本国话；方言；土语；民间风格
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language that ordinary people use, especially one that is not the official language

sentences.english: Follow Austin Creek for a few miles.
sentences.chinese: 沿着奥斯汀河走上几英里。

detailed_translations.english: a small narrow stream or river

sentences.english: She was voluble with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 她因为激动而变得很健谈。

sentences.english: Bert is a voluble, gregarious man.
sentences.chinese: 伯特是个健谈且善于交际的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健谈的；缠绕的；易旋转的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is voluble, you mean that they talk a lot with great energy and enthusiasm

name: cynic
trans: n.犬儒主义者，愤世嫉俗者

sentences.english: Even hardened cynics believe the meeting is a step towards peace.
sentences.chinese: 就连最顽固的愤世嫉俗者也认为这次会议向和平迈出了一步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤世嫉俗者；犬儒学派的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is not willing to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

sentences.english: Police evacuated the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方将该地区人员全部疏散。

detailed_translations.english: to send people away from a dangerous place to a safe place

name: ascetic
trans: 苦行的，克己的，禁欲的：self-denial; 禁欲者：person, self-discipline

sentences.english: an ascetic life
sentences.chinese: 清苦的生活

detailed_translations.english: living without any physical pleasures or comforts, especially for religious reasons
An ascetic is someone who is ascetic

name: kindred
trans: 类似的；具有相似或相近的起源、本性或性质的：similar origin

sentences.english: The protest included members of Free the Streets and kindred organisations.
sentences.chinese: 参加此次抗议的包括“解放街头”组织以及类似团体的成员。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the same group or family
your whole family

name: patronize
trans: v.以高人一等的态度对待；光顾，惠顾
赞助：provide aid；以高人一等的态度对待：treat haughtily

sentences.english: Don’t patronize me!
sentences.chinese: 别对我摆出一副纡尊降贵的样子！

sentences.english: The program focuses on kids’ interests without patronizing them.
sentences.chinese: 该节目以平等的态度关注孩子们的兴趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 以高人一等的态度对待； 光顾； 赞助， 资助
detailed_translations.english: to talk to someone in a way which seems friendly but shows that you think they are not as intelligent or do not know as much as you

name: curt
trans: a.(言词、行为)简略而草率的
言词简略的，直接（以至显得粗鲁）的：direct, brief, and potentially rude；言简意赅的：convey much information

sentences.english: With a curt nod, he turned away and sat down.
sentences.chinese: 他简慢地点点头就转身坐下了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 简略的；简要的；草率的；简单粗暴的
(Curt)人名；(法)屈尔；(英)柯特；(德、西、芬、罗、瑞典)库尔特

name: ecstasy
trans: 无法自控的情绪：beyond self-control；狂喜：intense joy

sentences.english: ...a state of almost religious ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: …一种近乎宗教极乐的状态。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme happiness

sentences.english: He crouched in the shadows near the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他蹲在门道近旁的阴暗处。

sentences.english: Paula crouched down and held her hands out to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉蹲下来，把手伸向火堆。

sentences.english: They walked in a crouch, each bent over close to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他们蹲伏着行走，一个个弯着腰快要贴着地面了。

detailed_translations.english: to lower your body close to the ground by bending your knees completely
Crouch is also a noun

name: ignite
trans: 点燃：set fire to；激起，唤起（感情）：arouse the passions

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

name: lucid
trans: a.表达清楚的，明白易懂的
有光亮的：suffused with light；神志清楚的：full use of one’s mind；表达清晰的，简单易懂的：easily understood

sentences.english: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
sentences.chinese: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明晰的；透明的；易懂的；头脑清楚的
detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

sentences.english: Her persistence paid off when she was offered the job of manager.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了经理的职位，不懈坚持终于有了回报。

sentences.english: ‘Why can’t I come?’ repeated Will with dogged persistence .
sentences.chinese: “我为什么不能去？”威尔不死心地又问了一遍。

detailed_translations.english: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it

name: stealth
trans: 秘密行动：proceeding furtively；秘密的：not to attract attention

sentences.english: Cats rely on stealth to catch their prey.
sentences.chinese: 猫科动物靠偷袭捕捉猎物。

detailed_translations.english: when you do something very quietly, slowly or secretly, so that no one notices you

name: digress
trans: 脱离主题：turn aside main subject

sentences.english: I've digressed a little to explain the situation so far, so let me now recap.
sentences.chinese: 我刚才稍微离题说明了迄今的情况，现在让我重述一下要点。

sentences.english: She digressed from her prepared speech to pay tribute to the president.
sentences.chinese: 她偏离了预先准备的讲稿，对总统表示了敬意。

detailed_translations.english: If you digress, you move away from the subject you are talking or writing about and talk or write about something different for a while

name: acclaim
trans: 称赞：public acknowledgment or admiration；赞扬，赞颂：approval

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: slack
trans: a.懒散的，懈怠的；(绳)松弛的；v.松懈，怠惰
松弛的：not tightly fastened；疏忽的，大意的：failing to give proper care

sentences.english: He was accused of slacking and taking too many holidays.
sentences.chinese: 他被指责工作不努力，休假太多。

detailed_translations.english: to make less effort than usual, or to be lazy in your work

detailed_translations.chinese: 懈怠的，马虎的；萧条的，清淡的，不活跃的；松的
detailed_translations.english: hanging loosely, or not pulled tight
part of a rope that is not stretched tight

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

sentences.english: You shouldn’t deride their efforts.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该嘲笑他们的努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make remarks or jokes that show you think someone or something is silly or useless

sentences.english: They were charged with inciting racial hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

sentences.english: They lived in a squalid hovel for the next five years.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的五年中，他们住在一间肮脏不堪的小破屋里。

detailed_translations.english: A hovel is a small hut, especially one which is dirty or needs a lot of repair

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…住在茅屋；把…拴入棚舍

name: invigorate
trans: 使精神，使强壮，鼓舞激励：impart vigor

sentences.english: Carey’s hope was that the church would be renewed and invigorated.
sentences.chinese: 凯里希望教会能复兴。

detailed_translations.english: to make the people in an organization or group feel excited again, so that they want to make something successful

name: countenance
trans: 容忍：put up with；赞成，推崇：favorable opinion；沉着，冷静：evenness

sentences.english: All colour drained from her countenance.
sentences.chinese: 她面无血色。

detailed_translations.english: your face or your expression
to accept, support, or approve of something

name: annul
trans: 宣告无效，取消：legally invalid; 抵消：balance, ineffective

sentences.english: Their marriage was annulled last year.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻关系去年宣告解除。

detailed_translations.english: to officially state that a marriage or legal agreement no longer exists

name: ineluctable
trans: 无法逃避的，必然的：not to be avoided

sentences.english: ...the ineluctable tendency of populations to exceed resources.
sentences.chinese: ...人口超出资源承载限度的不可避免的趋势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可避免的；无法逃避的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to avoid

name: finicky
trans: 过分讲究的，挑剔的：extremely meticulous

sentences.english: She’s very finicky about what she eats.
sentences.chinese: 她吃东西非常讲究。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过分讲究的；过分注意的；过分繁琐的
detailed_translations.english: too concerned with unimportant details and small things that you like or dislike

name: utter
trans: 出（声），说（话）：articulate；完全的，绝对的：entire

sentences.english: That’s utter nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 真是一派胡言！

sentences.english: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。

sentences.english: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
sentences.chinese: 我惊恐万分地看着他拔出枪来。

sentences.english: fifteen years of utter confusion
sentences.chinese: 15年的大混乱

detailed_translations.english: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty

name: dismay
trans: 使失去勇气：lose courage；使不安，使焦虑：trouble, uneasy

sentences.english: The thought of leaving filled him with dismay .
sentences.chinese: 想到要离开，他心里充满了忧伤。

sentences.english: The committee was dismayed by what it had been told.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会被所告知的情况搞得焦虑不安。

detailed_translations.english: the worry, disappoint-ment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens
If you are dismayed by something, it makes you feel afraid, worried, or sad

sentences.english: The rule of the Czar was sanctified by the Russian Orthodox Church.
sentences.chinese: 沙皇统治是经俄国东正教会认可的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使圣洁；使神圣化；把…奉献给神；认可
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem morally right or acceptable or to give something official approval

sentences.english: More vaccines are needed to replenish our stocks.
sentences.chinese: 还需要更多的疫苗来补充我们的储备。

detailed_translations.chinese: 补充，再装满；把…装满；给…添加燃料
detailed_translations.english: to put new supplies into something, or to fill something again

sentences.english: Their map has since been superseded by photographic atlases.
sentences.chinese: 他们的地图从此被摄影地图册取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取代，代替；紧接着……而到来
detailed_translations.english: if a new idea, product, or method supersedes another one, it becomes used instead because it is more modern or effective

sentences.english: He asked for immediate help from the United States to dismantle the warheads.
sentences.chinese: 他向美国请求即时援助，拆除弹头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拆除；取消；解散；除掉…的覆盖物
detailed_translations.english: If you dismantle a machine or structure, you carefully separate it into its different parts

name: dilute
trans: 稀释／经稀释的：concentrated/low strength, concentration；削弱：diminish strength, flavor, brilliance

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

name: renounce
trans: （正式地）放弃：give up；宣布与…决裂：refuse to follow

sentences.english: Edward renounced his claim to the French throne.
sentences.chinese: 爱德华宣布放弃对法国王位的继承权。

sentences.english: She renounced her citizenship.
sentences.chinese: 她宣布放弃国籍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣布放弃；与…断绝关系；垫牌
detailed_translations.english: if you renounce an official position, title, right etc, you publicly say that you will not keep it any more

name: mediate
trans: 调解，调停：bring about an agreement

sentences.english: The former president has agreed to mediate the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 前总统同意就和谈进行斡旋。

detailed_translations.english: to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc

sentences.english: the shouts of street vendors
sentences.chinese: 街头小贩的吆喝声

detailed_translations.chinese: 卖主；小贩；供应商；[贸易] 自动售货机
detailed_translations.english: someone who sells things, especially on the street

sentences.english: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
sentences.chinese: …难民大量涌入所造成的问题。

detailed_translations.english: the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly

sentences.english: ...a new paradigm of production.
sentences.chinese: …一种新的生产范例。

detailed_translations.english: a very clear or typical example of something

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

name: infirm
trans: 虚弱的：weak in body；不果断的，优柔寡断的：lacking firmness of will

sentences.english: ...her aging, infirm husband.
sentences.chinese: …她那年迈体弱的丈夫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰弱的；意志薄弱的；不坚固的
detailed_translations.english: A person who is infirm is weak or ill, and usually old

sentences.english: He's got the knack of getting people to listen.
sentences.chinese: 他有让人们倾听的诀窍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诀窍；本领；熟练技术；巧妙手法
detailed_translations.english: a natural skill or ability

name: feckless
trans: 无成果的，没有价值的：having no worth；粗心不负责任的：careless

sentences.english: Alice’s feckless younger brother
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯那个没出息的弟弟

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的；软弱的；没精神的；不负责任的；无气力的
detailed_translations.english: lacking determination, and not achieving anything in your life

name: robust
trans: 精力充沛的，强壮的，健康的：full of strength

sentences.english: a robust man of six feet four
sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

detailed_translations.english: a robust person is strong and healthy

sentences.english: Potter had argued that the government coerced him into pleading guilty.
sentences.chinese: 波特曾争辩说是政府胁迫他认罪。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something they do not want to do by threatening them

sentences.english: a bottle of milk
sentences.chinese: 一瓶奶

sentences.english: Would you like some milk in your tea?
sentences.chinese: 你茶里要加点奶吗？

sentences.english: a pint of semi-skimmed milk
sentences.chinese: 一品脱半脱脂奶

sentences.english: I helped to milk the cows.
sentences.chinese: 我帮忙挤牛奶。

detailed_translations.english: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people
to take milk from a cow or goat

name: grimace
trans: 因痛苦而面部扭曲，（作）怪相，（作）鬼脸：contortion pain, disgust or disapproval

sentences.english: She started to sit up, grimaced, and sank back weakly against the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 她开始坐起来，痛苦地皱着脸，又虚弱地靠回到枕头上。

detailed_translations.english: If you grimace, you twist your face in an ugly way because you are annoyed, disgusted, or in pain
an expression you make by twisting your face because you do not like something or because you are feeling pain

sentences.english: a heinous crime
sentences.chinese: 滔天罪行

detailed_translations.english: very shocking and immoral

sentences.english: rookie cops
sentences.chinese: 新手警察

detailed_translations.english: someone who has just started doing a job and has little experience

name: bravado
trans: 假装勇敢：pretense; 虚张声势：swaggering

sentences.english: youthful bravado
sentences.chinese: 年轻人的逞强行为

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is deliberately intended to make other people believe you are brave and confident

sentences.english: ...the opinion of savants on the composition of the lunar surface.
sentences.chinese: ...专家们对于月球表面成分的意见。

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a subject

sentences.english: ensconced in a chair

detailed_translations.english: to establish or settle firmly or comfortably

name: spontaneous
trans: 自发的，不经思索的：without apparent thought

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

sentences.english: His face contorts as he screams out the lyrics.
sentences.chinese: 当他大声朗读这些抒情诗时，脸都变形了。

detailed_translations.english: if you contort something, or if it contorts, it twists out of its normal shape and looks strange or unattractive

name: slippery
trans: 光滑的：slide；隐秘的：acting in secret；意义不明确的：not precise in meaning

sentences.english: In places, the path can be wet and slippery.
sentences.chinese: 路上有些地方可能又湿又滑。

sentences.english: the slippery notion of ‘standards’
sentences.chinese: “标准”这一模糊概念

detailed_translations.english: something that is slippery is difficult to hold, walk on etc because it is wet or  greasy

sentences.english: a bale of straw
sentences.chinese: 一大捆稻草

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something such as paper or  hay  that is tightly tied together especially into a block

sentences.english: If your child regresses to babyish behaviour, all you know for certain is that the child is under stress.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的孩子退步到幼稚的行为，你可以肯定的是孩子正处在压力之下。

detailed_translations.english: When people or things regress, they return to an earlier and less advanced stage of development

name: impassive
trans: 冷漠的，无感情的：no sign of feeling

sentences.english: Her impassive face showed no reaction at all.
sentences.chinese: 她表情冷淡，毫无反应。

detailed_translations.english: not showing any emotion

sentences.english: I could spend each day gorging on chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 我可以将每一天都花在狂吃巧克力上。

detailed_translations.english: If you gorge on something or gorge yourself on it, you eat lots of it in a very greedy way
a deep narrow valley with steep sides

name: tact
trans: 机敏，精明，不冒犯：keen sense, maintain good relations

sentences.english: Her patience and tact were legendary .
sentences.chinese: 她的耐心和机智是出名的。

sentences.english: Are you hurting others by your lack of tact?
sentences.chinese: 你曾经因为缺乏机智而伤害过他人吗？

sentences.english: If you have a genuine complaint about someone or something, communicate the issue with tact, consideration and neutrality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你确实对某人或某事有意见，还是老练、细致并中立地沟通解决吧。

sentences.english: a provincial election
sentences.chinese: 省级选举

sentences.english: the provincial government of Quebec
sentences.chinese: 魁北克省政府

detailed_translations.english: relating to or coming from a province

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗野的人；乡下人；外地人

name: adamant
trans: 固执的，不可动摇的：unshakable, unyielding, inflexible

sentences.english: She begged me to change my mind, but I remained adamant .
sentences.chinese: 她求我改变主意，但我坚决不肯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 固执的，坚强的；坚定不移的；坚硬无比的
detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your opinion or a decision that you have made

sentences.english: She ran away with him to Mexico and espoused the revolutionary cause.
sentences.chinese: 她与他一起逃到了墨西哥，支持革命事业。

detailed_translations.english: to support an idea, belief etc, especially a political one

name: tonic
trans: n.增进健康之物，补品；a.滋补的
滋补的，有益健康的：stimulating vigor, beneficial

sentences.english: A lot of people need a tonic at the end of the winter.
sentences.chinese: 很多人冬末需要进补。

detailed_translations.english: a drink that you have as a medicine to give you more energy or strength when you feel tired

detailed_translations.chinese: 滋补的；声调的；使精神振作的

name: peck
trans: 大量：considerable amount；（不情愿地）小口咬：in small bites

sentences.english: It was winter and the sparrows were pecking at whatever they could find.
sentences.chinese: 已是冬天了，麻雀们能找到什么就啄食什么。

detailed_translations.english: if a bird pecks something or pecks at something, it makes quick repeated movements with its beak to try to eat part of it, make a hole in it etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 许多；配克（容量单位，等于2加仑）；啄痕；快速轻吻
detailed_translations.english: an action in which a bird pecks someone or something with its beak

name: insipid
trans: （食品）清淡无味的：lacking favor；平淡的，无聊的：lacking interest

sentences.english: an insipid pasta dish
sentences.chinese: 一盘没有味道的意大利面食

detailed_translations.english: food or drink that is insipid does not have much taste

name: subject
trans: 臣民，受支配的人：under authority；取决于（其他因素）的：under the influence

sentences.english: Paul has strong opinions on most subjects.
sentences.chinese: 保罗在大多数问题上观点激烈。

sentences.english: The subjects covered in this chapter are exercise and nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 本章涵盖的主题是运动和营养。

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目； 学科； 主语
detailed_translations.english: the thing you are talking about or considering in a conversation, discussion, book, film etc
to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly

sentences.english: His meager wage is not enough to support their five children.
sentences.chinese: 靠他一个人的微薄工资不足以养活他们的五个孩子。

sentences.english: Do you think those savings are meager, or not worth the effort?
sentences.chinese: 你认为这些节省的开支是微薄的，或者是不值得努力获得的吗？

sentences.english: It was medieval European monks who introduced scientific brewing techniques in an effort to produce a nutritious beverage to supplement their meager diets.
sentences.chinese: 正是中世纪欧洲的僧侣们引进科学的啤酒酿造技术，制造有营养的饮料， 从而补充了他们贫乏的饮食。

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

sentences.english: ‘We made the front page!’ Jos exulted.
sentences.chinese: “我们上了头版！”乔斯欣喜若狂道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂喜，欢欣鼓舞；非常高兴
detailed_translations.english: to show that you are very happy and proud, especially because you have succeeded in doing something

sentences.english: ...Mencken's strictures on the 1920s, with its self-righteous prohibition on alcohol and unconventional ideas.
sentences.chinese: ...门肯对20世纪20年代自以为是的禁酒令及对非传统思想的禁锢的苛评。

detailed_translations.english: You can use strictures to refer to severe criticism or disapproval of something

name: filter
trans: 过滤：pass through a filter；去除杂质：remove impurities

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

sentences.english: Their departure was hastened by an abnormally cold winter.
sentences.chinese: 那个冬天异常寒冷，所以他们提前走了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something happen faster or sooner

name: clot
trans: 密集的一群：a number of things, a unit; 堵塞：prevent, through, filling with something; 凝结：jelly

sentences.english: The patient's blood refused to clot.
sentences.chinese: 病人的血液无法凝结。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid such as blood or milk clots, or if something clots it, it becomes thicker and more solid
a thick almost solid mass formed when blood or milk dries

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

sentences.english: The sergeant was demoted to private.
sentences.chinese: 这名中士被降为列兵。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone’s rank or position lower or less important

name: reflect
trans: 反射：change direction；反映，显露：make manifest；思考：think seriously

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

sentences.english: ...a chicken coop.

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关进笼子里；限制；拘禁
detailed_translations.english: to confine in a restricted area

detailed_translations.chinese: 值勤警察在警车里打瞌睡

detailed_translations.english: a building for small animals, especially chickens

sentences.english: He passed into a deep slumber.
sentences.chinese: 他酣然入梦。

detailed_translations.english: sleep
to sleep

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable

sentences.english: The police interrogated the suspect for several hours.
sentences.chinese: 警察盘问了这名嫌疑犯好几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats

name: indelible
trans: a.擦拭不掉的，不可磨灭的
（印记等）无法擦除的：impossible to remove；无法忘怀的：not easily forgotten

sentences.english: Her words left an indelible impression on me for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 她的话多年来我都难以忘怀。

detailed_translations.english: impossible to remove or forget

name: canvass
trans: 仔细检查，详尽讨论：examine carefully or discuss thoroughly; 游说，去（一个地区）的各处或找到（个人）来拉选票或订单：solicits votes or orders

sentences.english: I'm canvassing for the Republican Party.
sentences.chinese: 我在为共和党拉选票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 细究；彻底检查；向…拉票或拉生意
detailed_translations.english: If you canvass for a particular person or political party, you go around an area trying to persuade people to vote for that person or party

name: pirate
trans: 盗版，盗用：without actual right；海岛：robber seas

sentences.english: Computer game pirates cost the industry twenty million pounds a year.
sentences.chinese: 电脑游戏盗版者每年要给该行业带来两千万英镑的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海盗；盗版；侵犯专利权者
detailed_translations.english: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them
to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, video, or computer program

name: requisite
trans: 必需品：something necessary；必不可少的，必备的：necessary

sentences.english: He lacks the requisite qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他缺少必要的资历。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的，必不可少的；需要的
detailed_translations.english: needed for a particular purpose
something that is needed for a particular purpose

name: provident
trans: 节俭的：frugal, economical；有远见的：awareness for the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；有先见之明的；顾及未来的
detailed_translations.english: careful and sensible in the way you plan things, especially by saving money for the future

name: surreptitious
trans: 偷偷摸摸的，保密的：escape being observed

sentences.english: Rory tried to sneak a surreptitious glance at Adam’s wristwatch.
sentences.chinese: 罗里试图偷偷看一眼亚当的手表。

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘密的；鬼鬼祟祟的；暗中的
detailed_translations.english: done secretly or quickly because you do not want other people to notice

name: audacious
trans: 大胆的，（但往往）愚勇的：fearlessly, recklessly; 蔑视（法律、礼节）的，无礼的：contemptuous of law; 乐于冒险的：take risks; 大胆创新的：verve

sentences.english: the risks involved in such an audacious operation
sentences.chinese: 如此大胆的行动中存在的风险

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚颜无耻的；大胆鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: showing great courage or confidence in a way that is impressive or slightly shocking

sentences.english: Mother is devoted to Dad although they squabble all the time.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈深爱着爸爸，虽然他们总是为琐事争吵。

sentences.english: There have been minor squabbles about phone bills.
sentences.chinese: 为电话账单已闹过口角。

detailed_translations.english: to argue about something unimportant
Squabble is also a noun

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

sentences.english: All those lives maintained in the rarefied air of the absurd could not persevere without some profound and constant thought to infuse its strength into them.
sentences.chinese: 没有某种深邃的思想一成不变地为之输入力量，所有这些在荒谬的稀薄空气中维持的生命都无法继续。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

name: lumber
trans: v.蹒跚而行，笨拙地走；n.杂物；木材
木材：tree logs；笨拙地行动：clumsiness；使负担（从而拖累）：burden

sentences.english: A blue bus lumbered past.
sentences.chinese: 一辆蓝色公共汽车慢吞吞地驶过。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伐木；喧闹地向前走；笨重地行动，缓慢地移动
detailed_translations.english: to move in a slow awkward way

detailed_translations.chinese: 木材；废物，无用的杂物；隆隆声
detailed_translations.english: pieces of wood used for building, that have been cut to specific lengths and widths

sentences.english: I go jogging every morning.
sentences.chinese: 我每天早晨都去慢跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 慢跑；轻推；蹒跚行进；使颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising
a slow steady run, especially done as a way of exercising

name: religion
trans: 宗教，信仰：beliefs；（对于宗教信仰的）忠诚，虔诚：loyalty to God

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

sentences.english: He was always so meek and mild .
sentences.chinese: 他总是那么温顺。

detailed_translations.english: very quiet and gentle and unwilling to argue with people

name: magnitude
trans: 重要，重大：greatness in significance；巨大：greatness in size

sentences.english: an increase of this order of magnitude
sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的增长

sentences.english: The star varies in brightness by about three magnitudes.
sentences.chinese: 星体的亮度大约分三个星等。

detailed_translations.english: the great size or importance of something

name: incipient
trans: 起初的，初现的：beginning to come into being

sentences.english: a sign of incipient madness
sentences.chinese: 精神失常的早期征兆

detailed_translations.chinese: 初期的；初始的；起初的；发端的
detailed_translations.english: starting to happen or exist

sentences.english: House prices have plummeted down.
sentences.chinese: 房价已经暴跌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 垂直落下；（价格、水平等）骤然下跌
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly and quickly decrease in value or amount

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: vulnerable
trans: 易受攻击的，脆弱的：open to attack

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

sentences.english: There is a social stigma attached to single parenthood.
sentences.chinese: 单身父母在社会上的名声不光彩。

sentences.english: In the US, smoking carries a stigma .
sentences.chinese: 在美国，吸烟是不光彩的。

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 柱头；耻辱；污名；烙印；特征
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling in society that being in a particular situation or having a particular illness is something to be ashamed of

name: accommodate
trans: 提供所需（例如服务、借贷、寄宿）：provide; 改变以适应新情况、新场景：make, suitable;使和谐：free of conflicts

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: lurch
trans: n.突然向前或旁边倒；v.蹒跚而行

sentences.english: The property sector was another casualty of the lurch toward higher interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 房地产业是利率突然提高的又一受损行业。

detailed_translations.english: Lurch is also a noun
to walk or move suddenly in an uncontrolled or unsteady way

name: quarry
trans: 采石场：stone is obtained；目标，猎物：pursuit

sentences.english: a slate quarry
sentences.chinese: 板岩采石场

detailed_translations.english: a place where large amounts of stone or sand are dug out of the ground
to dig stone or sand from a quarry

name: aversion
trans: 非常讨厌，极厌恶：dislike; 令人厌恶的事物：someone that is hated

sentences.english: Many people have a natural and emotional aversion to insects.
sentences.chinese: 很多人对昆虫有一种天生的厌恶之感。

detailed_translations.english: a strong dislike of something or someone

sentences.english: a fictitious address
sentences.chinese: 杜撰的地址

sentences.english: fictitious characters
sentences.chinese: 虚构的人物

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚构的；假想的；编造的；假装的
detailed_translations.english: not true, or not real

sentences.english: Jie was extremely tyrannical and dissolute.
sentences.chinese: 桀是个极端残暴，放荡的人。

sentences.english: Nellie was married twice, the first time to a dissolute diplomat whose death left her a wealthy woman.
sentences.chinese: 妮利结过两次婚，第一次嫁给了一个风流的外交官，外交官死后给他留下了大笔财富，使她成为一个有钱的女人。

sentences.english: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.
sentences.chinese: 我还听说他生活放荡不羁，但这也许只是恶意的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: having an immoral way of life, for example drinking too much alcohol or having sex with many people
to provide or use too little of something

name: reproach
trans: 令人羞愧的事物，耻辱：causes shame；批评，责备：express criticism

sentences.english: ‘You don’t need me,’ she said quietly, without reproach.
sentences.chinese: “你不需要我。”她语气平静，没有丝毫责备。

detailed_translations.english: criticism, blame, or disapproval

sentences.english: He looked mournful, even near to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去很悲伤，几乎要掉泪了。

detailed_translations.english: If you are mournful, you are very sad

name: lag
trans: 最终的，最后的：following all others；缓慢行走：slowness；萎靡，失去活力：lose bodily strength

sentences.english: In this scenario, due to the lag time required to assimilate new resources, the relationship between required resources and estimated delivery timeframe may even turn negative.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，由于时间已经落后，需要吸收新的人力资源，需要的资源和预计的交付时间的关系甚至更加复杂。

sentences.english: But to many, at least as far as science is concerned, it is the countries that were doing well that are now doing better, whereas those at the bottom continue to lag significantly behind.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于许多人而言，至少在科学方面，正是那些在过去做的很好的国家现在正在做的更好，而那些位于底层的国家的科学继续落后。

sentences.english: One is that some countries still lag behind.
sentences.chinese: 一个原因是一些国家仍很落后。

sentences.english: Recent events have made his central theme even more apposite.
sentences.chinese: 近期发生的事件使他的主题思想显得更为恰当。

detailed_translations.english: suitable to what is happening or being discussed

sentences.english: The film pays homage to Martin Scorsese’s ‘Mean Streets’.
sentences.chinese: 该影片向马丁·斯科塞斯的《穷街陋巷》致敬。

detailed_translations.english: something you do to show respect for someone or something you think is important

name: subtle
trans: 微妙的，难以感知的：difficult perceive；巧妙的，间接或带有欺骗性的：clever deceptive means

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

sentences.english: We have a duty to uphold the law.
sentences.chinese: 维护法律是我们的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist

sentences.english: the myriad causes of homelessness
sentences.chinese: 导致人们无家可归的种种原因

detailed_translations.english: very many

detailed_translations.chinese: 无数，极大数量；无数的人或物
detailed_translations.english: a very large number of things

name: credible
trans: 可信，值得信赖的：worthy of being accepted

sentences.english: Her excuse was barely credible.
sentences.chinese: 她的借口无法让人信服。

sentences.english: a credible alternative to nuclear power
sentences.chinese: 原子能的可靠替代物

detailed_translations.english: deserving or able to be believed or trusted

name: hale
trans: 强壮的，健壮的：free from infirmity or illness；拖，拉：cause to follow

sentences.english: She’s still hale and hearty at 74.
sentences.chinese: 她74岁仍然精神矍铄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矍铄的（尤指老人）；强壮的
detailed_translations.english: someone, especially an old person, who is hale and hearty is very healthy and active
to pull or drag; haul

name: bask
trans: 休息，悠然自得：lie or relax

sentences.english: All through the hot, still days of their holiday Amy basked in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在整个炎热、寂静的假期里埃米都在晒太阳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 晒太阳；取暖；愉快或舒适
detailed_translations.english: to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat of the sun or a fire

name: slur
trans: 耻辱：mark of guilt；含糊地发音：indistinctly；疏忽，忽略：without due, consideration

sentences.english: His voice sounded slurred.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听起来含混不清。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忽视；草率地看过；含糊地念；诋毁
detailed_translations.english: to speak unclearly without separating your words or sounds correctly
an unfair criticism that is intended to make people dislike someone or something

sentences.english: the debacle of the 1994 elections
sentences.chinese: 1994年大选的惨败

detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that is a complete failure

name: batch
trans: 一批次的量：unit; 一小群人：small number of persons

sentences.english: an overnight batch file
sentences.chinese: 夜间批处理文件

detailed_translations.chinese: 一批；一炉；一次所制之量
detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that arrive or are dealt with together
to group (items) for efficient processing

sentences.english: We were shocked at the callous disregard for human life.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这种无视人类生命的冷漠感到震惊。

sentences.english: a callous attitude
sentences.chinese: 冷漠的态度

sentences.english: the callous slaughter of seals
sentences.chinese: 对海豹的无情残杀

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；麻木的；硬结的；起老茧的
detailed_translations.english: not caring that other people are suffering

detailed_translations.chinese: 使冷酷无情；使硬结；使生茧

name: contract
trans: 契约，合同：binding agreement；收缩：reduce size；感染疾病：become affected

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: deprecate
trans: 不喜欢：unfavorable opinion；贬低，轻视：express scornfully；降低…的重要性，使低调：play down

sentences.english: As a lawyer, I would deprecate any sort of legal control on gene therapy at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 作为律师，我会反对在现阶段对基因疗法进行任何形式的法律管制。

sentences.english: Though the environment doesn't have a mouth to deprecate what humans have done to her, she retaliates through action.
sentences.chinese: 尽管环境没有嘴巴来反对人类对她所做的一切，她通过行动来报复。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly disapprove of or criticize something

name: spate
trans: 突发的洪水：sudden flood；大量：large number

sentences.english: With the drought and wildfires in Russia and the floods in Pakistan, the world's spate of weird weather is already taking its toll on global food prices.
sentences.chinese: 伴随着俄罗斯发生的大火和干旱以及在巴基斯坦的洪水,世界的一连串的怪异天气已经造成了全球粮食价格的上涨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洪水；一阵；大雨；突然迸发

sentences.english: a telling argument
sentences.chinese: 有说服力的论点

detailed_translations.english: having a great or important effect
when you tell a story

sentences.english: Her body began to shake with mirth.
sentences.chinese: 她笑得浑身直颤。

detailed_translations.english: happiness and laughter

name: condemn
trans: 谴责（...为不道德的、邪恶的）：declare to be reprehensible, wrong, or evil

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

sentences.english: I could simply not be heard in the tumult.
sentences.chinese: 一片嘈杂声中别人根本听不到我说话。

detailed_translations.english: a confused, noisy, and excited situation, often caused by a large crowd

name: lash
trans: 击打：hard strike；猛击，撞击：strike with force；捆扎：bind

sentences.english: Giant waves lashed the sea wall.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪拍打着海堤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鞭打；冲击；摆动；扎捆；煽动；讽刺
detailed_translations.english: to tie something tightly to something else with a rope

detailed_translations.chinese: 鞭打；睫毛；鞭子；责骂；讽刺
detailed_translations.english: a hit with a whip, especially as a punishment

sentences.english: The storms and torrential rain caused traffic chaos across the country.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨和倾盆大雨造成了全国的交通混乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奔流的， 洪流的， 湍急的

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

detailed_translations.english: short, with no unnecessary words

name: hallmark
trans: n.(在金银上的)纯度印记；特征

detailed_translations.english: an idea, method, or quality that is typical of a particular person or thing

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…盖上品质证明印记；使具有…标志
detailed_translations.english: to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or platinum

name: license
trans: 许可，认可：approval；自由：move freely；放荡：disregard for standards；准许，授权使用：permit or authorize

sentences.english: No special license will be regranted to anyone from now on.
sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.english: Remind me to renew the driver's license.It will lapse next month.
sentences.chinese: 提醒我更换驾驶执照，它下个月就失效了。

sentences.english: The next time the client connects to the server, it will obtain another license.
sentences.chinese: 在客户端下一次连接到服务器时，它将获得另一个许可证。

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

sentences.english: Please remain vigilant at all times and report anything suspicious.
sentences.chinese: 请时刻保持警惕，有可疑情况随时报告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 警惕的；警醒的；注意的；警戒的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to what is happening, so that you will notice any danger or illegal activity

name: peer
trans: 同等地位的人，同辈：equal；好奇地凝视：look

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

sentences.english: a hideous dress
sentences.chinese: 一条很难看的连衣裙

sentences.english: hideous crimes
sentences.chinese: 丑恶的罪行

sentences.english: Dinnertime that day was hideous.
sentences.chinese: 那天的晚餐很不愉快。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant or ugly

name: dent
trans: 凹陷，凹痕：depression；（数量，程度上）削弱：make smaller

sentences.english: Eight years of effort have hardly put a dent in drug trafficking.
sentences.chinese: 八年的努力几乎没有减少贩毒活动。

detailed_translations.english: a hollow area in the surface of something, usually made by something hitting it
if you dent something, or if it dents, you hit or press it so that its surface is bent inwards

sentences.english: an insolent tone of voice
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的语气

sentences.english: You insolent child!
sentences.chinese: 你这个没礼貌的孩子！

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼的；傲慢的；粗野的；无耻的
detailed_translations.english: rude and not showing any respect

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

sentences.english: Her actions infuriated her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她的举动使她母亲极为生气。

sentences.english: It infuriated him that Beth was with another man.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝和另一个男人在一起，这使他极为愤怒。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely angry

sentences.english: minced lamb
sentences.chinese: 碎羔羊肉

sentences.english: Mince the meat up with some onion and garlic.
sentences.chinese: 把肉和些许洋葱、大蒜混合在一起剁碎。

detailed_translations.english: to cut food, especially meat, into very small pieces, usually using a machine
meat, especially  beef  , that has been cut into very small pieces using a special machine

name: impetuous
trans: 冲动的，性急的，轻率的：impulsive vehemence；剧烈的，猛烈的：violence of movement

sentences.english: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪高昂，行事鲁莽。

sentences.english: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
sentences.chinese: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

detailed_translations.english: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality

name: catholic
trans: a.普遍的；广泛的；(人)宽厚的
普遍的，包容的：not limited or specialized

sentences.english: She has catholic tastes (= likes a lot of different things ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的兴趣非常广泛。

sentences.english: a catholic collection of records
sentences.chinese: 包罗万象的唱片收藏

sentences.english: At least nine out of ten Mexicans are baptized Catholics.
sentences.chinese: 至少十分之九的墨西哥人是受过洗礼的天主教徒。

detailed_translations.english: including a very wide variety of things
A Catholic is a member of the Catholic Church

name: incendiary
trans: 煽动者：person who stirs up；煽动性的：tending to inflame

sentences.english: A shower of incendiaries struck the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 阵雨般的燃烧弹击中了歌剧院。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧弹；纵火犯，放火者；煽动者
detailed_translations.english: a bomb designed to cause a fire
an incendiary speech, piece of writing etc is intended to make people angry

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: frequent
trans: 时常拜访：often；时常发生的，重复再现的：short intervals

sentences.english: Trains rushed past at frequent intervals .
sentences.chinese: 火车频频驶过。

sentences.english: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她是家里的常客。

detailed_translations.english: happening or doing something often
to go to a particular place often
heterodox beliefs, practices etc are not approved of by a particular group, especially a religious one

name: animate
trans: a.活的，有生命的；v.赋予生命
活的：有活力的：life; 使有活力，支持：high-spirited energy; 使行动，驱使：action; 使活灵活现，使栩栩如生：lifelike movement

sentences.english: Laughter animated his face for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 笑容使他的脸上一时增添了生气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使有生气；使活泼；鼓舞；推动
detailed_translations.english: to give life or energy to something
living

sentences.english: We took a gravel road that meandered through farmland.
sentences.chinese: 我们走上了一条蜿蜒穿越农田的石子路。

detailed_translations.english: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way rather than take the most direct way possible

name: anecdote
trans: 短小有趣的故事：short narrative, interesting, amusing

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: immaculate
trans: 干净的，纯净的：free from dirt；完美的，没有任何错误的：without fault

sentences.english: her immaculate stage performances
sentences.chinese: 她完美的舞台表演

detailed_translations.chinese: 完美的；洁净的；无瑕疵的
detailed_translations.english: exactly correct or perfect in every detail

sentences.english: the stench of urine
sentences.chinese: 尿臭味

detailed_translations.english: a very strong bad smell

name: bigot
trans: n.(宗教、政治等的)盲信者；心胸狭窄者
固执己见者，有偏见的人：obstinately devoted

sentences.english: racist bigots
sentences.chinese: 偏执的种族主义者

detailed_translations.chinese: 偏执的人；顽固者；盲信者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is bigoted

name: dandy
trans: 纨绔子弟，爱打扮的人：appearance；最佳的，最好的：very best kind

sentences.english: We’re at our hotel, and everything is fine and dandy .
sentences.chinese: 我们在自己的宾馆里，一切都非常好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上等的，极好的（口语）；服装华丽的
detailed_translations.english: very good – often used in a slightly humorous way
a man who spends a lot of time and money on his clothes and appearance

name: inimitable
trans: a.无法仿效的，不可比拟的
无法效仿的，独特的：not imitated

sentences.english: He makes his own point in his own inimitable way.
sentences.chinese: 他以他独有的的方式阐述了自己的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独特的；无比的；无法仿效的
detailed_translations.english: You use inimitable to describe someone, especially a performer, when you like or admire them because of their special qualities

sentences.english: a synthesis of Eastern and Western philosophical ideas
sentences.chinese: 东西方哲学思想的结合

sentences.english: the synthesis of proteins
sentences.chinese: 蛋白质的合成

sentences.english: speech synthesis software
sentences.chinese: 语音合成软件

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合，综合物；（化学或生物学物质的）合成；（用电子方式对声音、语音或音乐的）合成
detailed_translations.english: something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

name: stoic
trans: 隐忍的，冷静的：unaffected by pleasure or pain

sentences.english: But, in most instances, people living in poverty respond to these societal ills with stoic resilience as they work to escape the degrading reality of their daily lives.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在大多数情况下，生活贫穷的人们以坚忍的韧性来面对这些社会弊疾，努力逃避他们日常生活中有辱尊严的现实。

sentences.english: People of the Tohoku region are stoic, compassionate, calm and humble.
sentences.chinese: 东北地区的人们坚忍顽强、平静怜悯、谦逊大度。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does not show their emotions and does not complain when bad things happen to them

sentences.english: conversations about the most banal subjects
sentences.chinese: 最无聊的谈话

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting, because of a lack of new or different ideas

name: contend
trans: 竞争，争夺：strive or vie in contest；声明，声称：state as a fact

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: hackneyed
trans: 陈腐的，缺乏创新的：lacking freshness originality

sentences.english: Power corrupts and absolute power corrupts absolutely. That's the old hackneyed phrase, but it's true.
sentences.chinese: 权力导致腐败，绝对权力导致绝对腐败。这虽是老生常谈，但无半点虚言。

detailed_translations.english: a hackneyed phrase is boring and does not have much meaning because it has been used so often

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租（马匹、马车等）；役使（hackney的过去式）

sentences.english: The falling snow muffled the sound of our footsteps.
sentences.chinese: 飘落的雪使我们的脚步声变得低沉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 蒙住；裹住；抑制；发低沉的声音
detailed_translations.english: to cover yourself or another person with something thick and warm

detailed_translations.chinese: 低沉的声音；消声器；包裹物（如头巾，围巾等）；唇鼻部

sentences.english: The water in Lake Powell is used to irrigate the area.
sentences.chinese: 包尔湖的水被用来灌溉该地区。

detailed_translations.english: to supply land or crops with water

name: vile
trans: 丑陋的：unpleasant to look at；（道德上）可鄙的，卑鄙的：morally despicable

sentences.english: a vile act of betrayal
sentences.chinese: 卑鄙的背叛行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑鄙的；邪恶的；低廉的；肮脏的
detailed_translations.english: evil or immoral

sentences.english: Those in business are not, on the whole, conversant with basic scientific principles.
sentences.chinese: 总体来说，经商的人不熟悉基本的科学原理。

detailed_translations.english: having knowledge or experience of something

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

name: euphoria
trans: 感觉极其愉快：overwhelming usually pleasurable

sentences.english: There was a general atmosphere of pessimism after the euphoria of last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年的狂喜过后出现了普遍的悲观气氛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神欢快，[临床] 欣快；兴高采烈；欣快症；幸福愉快感

sentences.english: The plane veered off course.
sentences.chinese: 飞机偏离了航线。

sentences.english: Follow the path and veer left after 400m.
sentences.chinese: 沿着这条小路走400米，然后向左转。

sentences.english: The wind was veering north.
sentences.chinese: 风向往北偏了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转向；改变观点；风向顺时针转；调转船尾向上风
detailed_translations.english: to change direction
a change of course or direction

name: complacent
trans: 自满的，自鸣得意的：excessive or unjustified satisfaction；无所谓的，不关心的：lack of interest or concern

sentences.english: There’s a danger of becoming complacent if you win a few games.
sentences.chinese: 赢了几场比赛可能就会变得沾沾自喜。

sentences.english: a complacent attitude towards the problem
sentences.chinese: 对问题满不在乎的态度

detailed_translations.english: pleased with a situation, especially something you have achieved, so that you stop trying to improve or change things – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Dogs must be vaccinated against distemper.
sentences.chinese: 犬类必须接种疫苗以防犬热病。

detailed_translations.english: to protect a person or animal from a disease by giving them a vaccine

name: delineate
trans: 勾勒，用线条描绘：by drawn or painted lines；描写，描绘：describe，portray

sentences.english: Biography must to some extent delineate characters.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，传记一定要描述人物。

detailed_translations.english: If you delineate something such as an idea or situation, you describe it or define it, often in a lot of detail

sentences.english: The mania for dinosaurs began in the late 1800s.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙热兴起于19世纪晚期。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医]颠狂, 狂躁, 癖好, 狂热
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time

name: fast
trans: n.绝食，斋戒；adv.很快地，紧紧地
绝食，斋戒：abstaining from food；快速的：quick；忠诚的：firm in one’s allegiance；稳固的，难以拆卸的：firmly positioned

sentences.english: a fast car
sentences.chinese: 速度很快的汽车

sentences.english: That can’t be the time - my watch must be fast.
sentences.chinese: 不可能是这个时间——一定是我的表快了。

sentences.english: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
sentences.chinese: 慢点——你开得太快了。

detailed_translations.english: moving or able to move quickly
moving quickly

name: cede
trans: （根据条约）放弃，割让：surrender possession of

sentences.english: Only a short campaign took place in Puerto Rico, but after the war Spain ceded the island to America.
sentences.chinese: 波多黎各岛仅经历了一场短暂的战斗，但大战后西班牙把该岛割让给了美国。

detailed_translations.english: to give something such as an area of land or a right to a country or person, especially when you are forced to

name: relish
trans: 喜好，偏好：appreciation or liking；（愿望达成时的）高兴，满足感：when wishes are met；享受，喜欢：take pleasure

sentences.english: I relish the challenge of doing jobs that others turn down.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢接受挑战做别人拒绝做的工作。

sentences.english: The three men ate with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那3个人吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen
Relish is also a noun

name: serene
trans: 安静的：free from uproar；稳重的，镇静的：unaffected, calm

sentences.english: The child’s face was serene and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子的神情宁静可爱。

sentences.english: a serene mountain lake
sentences.chinese: 静谧的山间湖泊

detailed_translations.chinese: 平静的；安详的；清澈的；晴朗的
detailed_translations.english: very calm or peaceful

name: dapper
trans: a.整洁漂亮的；动作敏捷的
衣冠整洁的：strikingly neat and trim

sentences.english: a dapper little man in a grey suit
sentences.chinese: 一身灰西装、打扮利落的小个子男人

detailed_translations.chinese: 短小精悍的；衣冠楚楚的；整洁的；整齐的
detailed_translations.english: a man who is dapper is nicely dressed, has a neat appearance, and is usually small or thin

detailed_translations.chinese: (Dapper)人名；(英)达珀；(意)达珀尔；(德)达佩尔

name: blunder
trans: v.犯大错；笨拙地做；n.愚蠢之举
过失：error, mistake; 在···方面犯了很愚蠢且通常很严重的错误，糟蹋：make a stupid, error; 蹒跚：unsteadily
