sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: gallant
trans: a.勇敢的；(向女人)献殷勤的
英勇的：brave, chivalrous；高贵的，慷慨的：dignified and generous

sentences.english: a gallant attempt to save lives
sentences.chinese: 救人的勇敢之举

detailed_translations.chinese: 英勇的，勇敢的；华丽的；雄伟的
detailed_translations.english: brave

name: husband
trans: v.妥善而又节约地管理；做…的丈夫

sentences.english: Have you met my husband Roy?
sentences.chinese: 你见过我的丈夫罗伊吗？

detailed_translations.english: the man that a woman is married to

name: compound
trans: 混合物：something composed；混合的：consisting；混合：together；扩大，增多：greater；和解：agree

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

name: paraphrase
trans: 转述，意译，改写；in different words

sentences.english: The last two clauses were an exact quote rather than a paraphrase of Mr. Forth's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个分句是对福思先生言论的准确引用而不是改述。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that expresses in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written

name: dormant
trans: 静止的，不活跃的：inactivity；（动物）冬眠的：suspended

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: claim
trans: v.要求或索; 要n.声称拥有的权力
要求（权利）：ask for, right; 断言：state as a fact; 剥夺生命：deprive, life; 权利：right

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

sentences.english: ...the preface to Kelman's novel.
sentences.chinese: …凯尔曼小说的前言。

sentences.english: I will preface what I am going to say with a few lines from Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 我将引用莎士比亚的几行诗作为我讲话的开场白。

detailed_translations.english: an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech
If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first

name: conciliate
trans: 平息，抚慰：lessen the anger；调解：compatible, reconcile

sentences.english: efforts to conciliate the unions
sentences.chinese: 对工会进行调停的努力

detailed_translations.chinese: 安抚，安慰；调和；驯服；怀柔；赢得
detailed_translations.english: to do something to make people more likely to stop arguing, especially by giving them something they want

sentences.english: I had a little lapse of concentration in the middle of the race.
sentences.chinese: 我在比赛中走了一下神。

sentences.english: He was a genius and because of it you could accept lapses of taste.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个天才，因此他偶失得体，人们也可以接受。

detailed_translations.english: A lapse of something such as concentration or judgment is a temporary lack of that thing, which can often cause you to make a mistake

name: sanction
trans: 批准，同意，许可：make valid；制裁：coercive measure

sentences.english: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.chinese: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.english: the threat of trade sanctions
sentences.chinese: 贸易制裁的威胁

sentences.english: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.chinese: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.english: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.chinese: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

detailed_translations.english: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something

name: dire
trans: 不吉利的，不详的：calamity；可怕的，恐怖的：fear；迫切的：immediate, urgent；悲惨的：lacking cheer

sentences.english: warnings of dire consequences that often don’t come true
sentences.chinese: 对严重后果的警告，尽管这些后果常常不会出现

sentences.english: The country is in dire need of food aid.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家急需食品援助。

sentences.english: The situation looked dire.
sentences.chinese: 情况看来非常严重。

detailed_translations.english: extremely serious or terrible

name: awkward
trans: 缺乏灵活性和技巧的：lacking dexterity; （处理问题）缺乏手段和智谋的：a lack of skill and tact; 臃肿笨拙的，不优雅的：lacking ease; 令人尴尬的：embarrassment; （因过大或过重设计问题）难以操作的：difficult to use

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: numb
trans: 失去感觉的：devoid of sensation；麻木的，无感情的：devoid of emotion

sentences.english: The cold had numbed her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指冻僵了。

sentences.english: the numbing effect of the drug
sentences.chinese: 那种药物的麻醉效果

detailed_translations.chinese: 使麻木；使发愣；使失去感觉
detailed_translations.english: to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
a part of your body that is numb is unable to feel anything, for example because you are very cold

sentences.english: can be, if I forebode aright, no power, short of the Divine mercy, to disclose, whether by uttered words, or by type or emblem, the secrets that may be buried with a human heart.
sentences.chinese: 如果我的预感不错的话，除去上天的仁慈，没有什么力量，无论是通过讲出来的语言或是任何形式的标志，能够揭示可能埋在一个人心里的秘密。

detailed_translations.english: to warn of or indicate (an event, result, etc) in advance

name: legend
trans: n.地图里的说明文字或图例
传奇，传说：popular myth；图例：explanatory list map

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

name: prudent
trans: a.审慎的，三思而后行的，精明的

sentences.english: prudent house buyers
sentences.chinese: 谨慎的购房者

detailed_translations.english: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks

name: repulse
trans: v.驱逐，击退；厌恶；n.驱逐，击退，厌恶

sentences.english: Government troops repulsed an attack by rebel forces.
sentences.chinese: 政府军击退了叛军的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone and successfully stop their attack on you

name: cling
trans: 粘结，粘合：physical sticking；紧贴；坚持：adhere

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: check
trans: 使突然停止，阻止：arrest, abruptly; 同意，一致：agreement

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: censor
trans: 审查并删除不良的东西：examine, delete

sentences.english: The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

sentences.english: The ground-floor windows are obscured by wire mesh.
sentences.chinese: 底楼的窗户被铁丝网罩着。

detailed_translations.english: Mesh is material like a net made from wire, thread, or plastic
if two ideas or things mesh, they fit together very well

name: institute
trans: v.制定，创立(社团，规章)；n.学院，协会

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: fathom
trans: n.英寻(量水深用，相当于1.83米)；v.彻底明白，了解
测量（深度）：measure the depth；彻底理解，弄懂：come to understand

sentences.english: I still can’t fathom out what she meant.
sentences.chinese: 我还是弄不清她的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 看穿；彻底了解；测量…的深度
detailed_translations.english: to understand what something means after thinking about it carefully

detailed_translations.chinese: 英寻（测量水深的长度单位）
detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the depth of water, equal to six feet or about 1.8 metres

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

name: abate
trans: 减轻（程度或者强度）：reduce，degree，intensity；减少（数量），降低（价值）：reduce，amount，value

sentences.english: We waited for the storm to abate.
sentences.chinese: 我们等风暴减弱。

detailed_translations.english: to become less strong or decrease

name: invoke
trans: v.祈求；恳求；(法律的)实施生效
实施：put into effect；产生，造成：be the cause

sentences.english: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 使人联想到落基山脉的画

sentences.english: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
sentences.chinese: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

sentences.english: Don't gloat,the same misfortune may happen to you one day.
sentences.chinese: 不要幸灾乐祸，说不定同样的不幸会落到你的头上。

sentences.english: Yet, in announcing the news to the United States and the world, Obama was careful not to gloat, as his predecessor George W Bush might well have done had the killing taken place under his watch.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在向美国和世界宣布这个消息时，奥巴马却显的小心谨慎，没有表现出一点幸灾乐祸，因为他的前任乔治·布什任期内没有完成的事情被他完成了。

sentences.english: It is easy to gloat when the cool jock with the hot girlfriend wrecks his sweet car, especially if he seems kind of smug.
sentences.chinese: 当酷酷的大学运动员和热辣的女友坐他的爱车失事后，特别是这人有些自以为是，那么幸灾乐祸的想法是很自然会产生的。

name: catastrophe
trans: 大灾难：tragedy; 彻底的失败：utter failure

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

name: imperious
trans: 爱发号施令的：ordering people；傲慢的，专横呃：arrogantly domineering；迫切的：compelling

sentences.english: She raised her hand in an imperious gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她傲慢地扬起手。

detailed_translations.english: giving orders and expecting to be obeyed, in a way that seems too proud

sentences.english: Officials refuse to divulge details of the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 官员们拒绝透露谈判的细节。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone information that should be secret

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["punishment by God"],"COLLOINEXA":["divine retribution"]}
sentences.chinese: 上帝的惩罚

detailed_translations.english: severe punishment for something very serious

sentences.english: Its film industry operates in its own curiously hermetic way.
sentences.chinese: 它的电影业以奇特而封闭的方式运作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 密封的；与外界隔绝的；不透气的；炼金术的
detailed_translations.english: If a container has a hermetic seal, the seal is very tight so that no air can get in or out

name: cultivate
trans: 提升，加强：improve；种植，培养：promote growth

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: revive
trans: 恢复意识：return to consciousness；再获新生：active again

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: marvel
trans: 令人惊奇的事物：surprise, admiration or wonder；（因为壮观、美丽等而）表示惊讶：feel amazement

sentences.english: ‘The man is a genius,’ marvelled Claire.
sentences.chinese: “这人是个天才。”克莱尔赞叹道。

sentences.english: The whale, like the dolphin, has become a symbol of the marvels of creation.
sentences.chinese: 鲸，和海豚一样，已经成为造物杰作的象征。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or express great surprise or admiration at something, especially someone’s behaviour
You can describe something or someone as a marvel to indicate that you think that they are wonderful

sentences.english: He has a wonderful whimsical sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 他怪异的幽默感令人惊叹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的；异想天开的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: unusual or strange and often amusing

sentences.english: But its decline across Europe is not uniform; in each country, the church faces a different mixture of threats and residual strengths.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在欧洲这种萎缩并不均匀，在每一个国家，教会都面对着多种不同威胁和残余的优势。

sentences.english: These, however, have been exposed to the digestive mercies of bacteria in the large intestine, and any residual goodies have been removed from them that way.
sentences.chinese: 然而这些是被暴露到大肠消化道寄生细菌产生的结果，并且任何剩余糖分都是通过这种方式被移除的。

detailed_translations.english: remaining after a process, event etc is finished

sentences.english: He strode toward her.
sentences.chinese: 他大步向她走去。

sentences.english: Paco reached the door in only three strides.
sentences.chinese: 帕科三大步就走到了门口。

detailed_translations.english: to walk quickly with long steps
a long step you make while you are walking

name: forage
trans: n.(牛马的)饲料，粮草；v.搜寻，翻寻

sentences.english: Do notlet animals graze until you are notified that forage in your area is safe.
sentences.chinese: 得到你所在区域的饲料安全的通知前，不要让动物吃青草。

detailed_translations.english: food supplies for horses and cattle
to go around searching for food or other supplies

name: summary
trans: n.摘要，概要；a.摘要的，简略的
摘要：abstract；就地的，立即的：on the spot

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

name: intangible
trans: 无法感知的，无形的：capable perceived

sentences.english: The island has an intangible quality of holiness.
sentences.chinese: 该岛屿有一种难以形容的神圣感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无形的，触摸不到的；难以理解的
detailed_translations.english: an intangible quality or feeling is difficult to describe exactly

sentences.english: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
sentences.chinese: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。

sentences.english: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

detailed_translations.english: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

name: complacency
trans: 自满，无忧患意识：self-satisfaction, unawareness of trouble

sentences.english: Doctors have warned against complacency in fighting common diseases.
sentences.chinese: 医生警告说，治疗常见病不能一见好就掉以轻心。

sentences.english: Despite yesterday’s win, there is clearly no room for complacency if the team want to stay top of the league.
sentences.chinese: 尽管这支球队昨天赢了，但要在联赛中独占鳌头，就不能骄傲自满。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of satisfaction with a situation or with what you have achieved, so that you stop trying to improve or change things – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: the salient points of the report
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的要点

detailed_translations.english: the salient points or features of something are the most important or most noticeable parts of it

name: fracture
trans: 破裂：breaking；打碎，破坏：separate into pieces

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

name: collapse
trans: 突然倒塌或收缩：fall, shrink; 完全耗尽体力：depletion, energy, strength; 失败：unsuccessful

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: disguise
trans: 伪装（防止被认出）：prevent recognition；隐藏，掩饰：secret shut off

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

name: foolproof
trans: a.容易懂的，简易而不会误用的
十分简单以至于不会失败的：leave no opportunity for error, misuse or failure

sentences.english: The system is not 100 per cent foolproof.
sentences.chinese: 该系统不是百分之百不出毛病的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 十分简单的；十分安全的；不会错的
detailed_translations.english: Something such as a plan or a machine that is foolproof is so well designed, easy to understand, or easy to use that it cannot go wrong or be used wrongly

sentences.english: a renegade army unit
sentences.chinese: 一支变节的陆军分队

detailed_translations.english: someone who leaves one side in a war, politics etc in order to join the opposing side – used to show disapproval

name: demonstrate
trans: （通过证据）证明，表明：make clear using examples；使明白易懂：make plain or understandable；表现，表露：make known

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

sentences.english: I fell headlong into a pool of icy water.
sentences.chinese: 我一个倒栽葱跌入了冰冷的池水中。

sentences.english: a headlong dive/rush
sentences.chinese: 头先入水的跳水；莽撞的向前冲

detailed_translations.english: with your head first and the rest of your body following

name: heretical
trans: 异教的，异端邪说的：departure standards

sentences.english: I made the then heretical suggestion that it might be cheaper to design new machines.
sentences.chinese: 我提出了当时被当做旁门左道的建议，说设计新机器或许更省钱。

detailed_translations.english: A belief or action that is heretical is one that most people think is wrong because it disagrees with beliefs that are generally accepted

name: supplant
trans: 排挤，篡夺...的位置：usurp the place of

sentences.english: Barker was soon supplanted as party leader.
sentences.chinese: 巴克在党内的领导地位很快就被人取代了。

detailed_translations.english: to take the place of a person or thing so that they are no longer used, no longer in a position of power etc

name: amenity
trans: n.礼仪；使人感到舒适的事物
（环境、设备等的）舒适，人性化：comfort; 融洽，和谐：pleasant, agreeable

sentences.english: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.
sentences.chinese: 该酒店位于市中心，紧邻商店和当地的便利设施。

sentences.english: houses that lack basic amenities
sentences.chinese: 缺乏基本生活设施的房屋

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施
detailed_translations.english: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in

sentences.english: The audience coughed down the tedious speaker.
sentences.chinese: 听众用咳嗽声阻挠演讲人的沉闷发言。

sentences.english: There's no point in labouring at a tedious task.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦地干单调乏味的工作没有意义。

name: pungent
trans: 辛辣的，讽刺的：use of wit cause hurt feelings

sentences.english: He expressed some fairly pungent criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 他提出了一针见血的批评。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辛辣的；刺激性的；刺鼻的；苦痛的；尖刻的
detailed_translations.english: having a strong taste or smell

sentences.english: a convex lens
sentences.chinese: 凸透镜

sentences.english: a convex mirror
sentences.chinese: 凸镜

detailed_translations.english: curved outwards, like the surface of the eye

name: arbitrary
trans: 专横的，独断专行的：force one's will on others；独裁的，拥有无限权力的：without interference by others；缺乏计划的，随意的：lacking a definite plan

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: deliberate
trans: a.深思熟虑的，故意的；v.慎重考虑

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: feign
trans: 制造假象，装出…的样子：give a false appearance

sentences.english: Feigning a headache, I went upstairs to my room.
sentences.chinese: 我假装头痛，上楼到自己房间去了。

detailed_translations.english: to pretend to have a particular feeling or to be ill, asleep etc

sentences.english: a church filled with the smell of incense
sentences.chinese: 充满焚香气味的教堂

sentences.english: lighted incense sticks
sentences.chinese: 点燃的棒香

detailed_translations.english: a substance that has a pleasant smell when you burn it
to make someone very angry

name: whiff
trans: 微风：slight gust；细微的信号，轻微痕迹：imperceptible sign

sentences.english: He caught a whiff of her perfume.
sentences.chinese: 他闻到了她身上的一丝香水味。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一点点；单人小划艇；琴鲆属鱼；吸气或吹气

name: pine
trans: n.松树；v.(因疾病等)憔悴；渴望
渴望，奢望：yearn；因渴望而憔悴：lose vigor

sentences.english: I pine for the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望乡下的生活。

detailed_translations.english: If you pine for something, you want it very much, especially when it is unlikely that you will be able to have it
a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter

sentences.english: corrugated cardboard
sentences.chinese: 瓦楞纸板

detailed_translations.chinese: 波纹的；缩成皱纹的；有瓦楞的
detailed_translations.english: in the shape of waves or folds, or made like this in order to give something strength

name: squall
trans: n.短暂、突然且猛烈的风暴；短暂的骚动
（通常伴随雨或雪的）风暴，暴风雪，暴风雨：violent windstorm；尖叫：scream

sentences.english: There was an infant squalling in the back of the church.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的后面有个婴儿大声啼哭的声音。

sentences.english: ...squalling guitars.
sentences.chinese: ...刺耳的吉他声。

detailed_translations.english: If a person or animal squalls, they make a loud unpleasant noise like the noise made by a crying baby

detailed_translations.chinese: 暴风；麻烦；高声哭喊；尖叫
detailed_translations.english: a shrill or noisy yell or howl

name: flounder
trans: v.挣扎；艰苦地移动；n.比目鱼

sentences.english: More and more firms are floundering because of the recession.
sentences.chinese: 由于经济衰退，越来越多的公司举步维艰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挣扎，折腾；错乱地做事或说话
detailed_translations.english: to have a lot of problems and be likely to fail completely
a European flatfish, Platichthys flesus having a greyish-brown body covered with prickly scales: family Pleuronectidae: an important food fish

name: fetter
trans: 枷锁，限制：limits one’s freedom；束缚：restrain from motion

sentences.english: fettered by family responsibilities
sentences.chinese: 受家庭责任的束缚

detailed_translations.english: to restrict someone’s freedom and prevent them from doing what they want

name: balm
trans: 香油，止痛膏，安慰物：sweet-smelling oil, soothe; 香气：pleasant smell

sentences.english: lip balm
sentences.chinese: 润唇膏

detailed_translations.chinese: 香油；镇痛软膏；香峰草，香树膏
detailed_translations.english: an oily liquid with a strong pleasant smell that you rub into your skin, often to reduce pain

sentences.english: two minutes to traverse the park
sentences.chinese: 两分钟横穿公园

detailed_translations.english: a sideways movement across a very steep slope in mountain-climbing

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿过；反对；详细研究；在…来回移动
detailed_translations.english: to move across, over, or through something, especially an area of land or water

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: conservative
trans: 守旧的，不愿改变的：oppose change；不招摇的，低调的：not showy；谨慎小心的：close attentiveness

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

sentences.english: ...people of the utmost moral rectitude.
sentences.chinese: ...道义上极度正直的人。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is honest and morally correct

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

sentences.english: Kennedy exhorted his listeners to turn away from violence.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪劝告他的听众要远离暴力。

sentences.english: He exhorted his companions, "Try to accomplish your aim with diligence."
sentences.chinese: 他勉励他的同志，“尝试以勤奋来实现目标。”

detailed_translations.english: If you exhort someone to do something, you try hard to persuade or encourage them to do it

name: instigate
trans: 煽动，激起：urge forward, stir up

sentences.english: Abettors, who instigate others to commit crimes, are not only the instigators but also the disseminator of criminal intent.
sentences.chinese: 教唆犯作为教唆他人犯罪的人，不仅是犯意的挑起者，也是犯意的传播者。

sentences.english: This paper can be divided into four parts. The first part briefly outlines the previous achievements on"instigate the lawsuits".
sentences.chinese: 本文分为四部分，第一部分对有关“教唆词讼”的先行研究作了一个简要的概述。

sentences.english: That chair doesn’t look very sturdy.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子看上去不太结实。

sentences.english: They kept up a sturdy opposition to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直坚决反对那项计划。

detailed_translations.english: (of an object) strong and not easily damaged

name: neutralize
trans: 中和：acid undergo neutralization；破坏，使无效：make inoperative or ineffective

sentences.english: Rising prices neutralize increased wages.
sentences.chinese: 不断上涨的物价会抵消工资的增长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抵销；使…中和；使…无效；使…中立
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from having any effect

name: chronic
trans: 经常发生的，复发的：frequent recurrence;习惯性的，不可能改变的：not likely, change

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

sentences.english: ‘It’s not true,’ she said, in a quavering voice.
sentences.chinese: “这不是真的。”她颤声说道。

sentences.english: ‘No,’ he quavered.
sentences.chinese: “不。”他声音都颤抖了。

detailed_translations.english: if your voice quavers, it shakes as you speak, especially because you are nervous or upset
a musical note which continues for an eighth of the length of a semibreve

name: entrance
trans: 进入权，进入许可：means of entering or participation；使入迷：wonder, enchantment

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

name: visionary
trans: a.有远见的；幻想的；n.空想家
空想的，不切实际的：guided by ideals；幻觉的：in the imagination；有远见的：foresight

sentences.english: Under his visionary leadership, the city prospered.
sentences.chinese: 在他富有远见的领导下，这座城市蓬勃发展。

detailed_translations.english: existing only in someone’s mind and unlikely to ever exist in the real world

detailed_translations.chinese: 空想家；梦想者；有眼力的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who has clear ideas and strong feelings about the way something should be in the future

sentences.english: He sounded in a jocular mood.
sentences.chinese: 他听上去心情很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱开玩笑的；打趣的；滑稽的
detailed_translations.english: joking or humorous

name: blemish
trans: 缺点，污点：imperfection; 损害，玷污：reduce

sentences.english: Every piece is closely scrutinized, and if there is the slightest blemish on it, it is rejected.
sentences.chinese: 每一件都经过仔细检查，如果上面有哪怕最微小的瑕疵，都会被拒绝。

detailed_translations.english: a small mark, especially a mark on someone’s skin or on the surface of an object, that spoils its appearance
to spoil the beauty or appearance of something, so that it is not perfect

sentences.english: He and Mary journeyed to Bethlehem to be counted in the Roman census, and while they were there the child was born.
sentences.chinese: 他和玛利亚一起去到伯利恒，罗马的人口普查把他们统计在内。 他们在那里时，孩子降生了。

detailed_translations.english: an official process of counting a country’s population and finding out about the people

name: tasty
trans: 美味的；令人愉悦的：pleasure or contentment

sentences.english: a simple but tasty meal
sentences.chinese: 简单而可口的饭菜

detailed_translations.english: food that is tasty has a good taste, but is not sweet

detailed_translations.chinese: 可口的东西；引人入胜的东西

name: superimpose
trans: 添（声）加（色）（使形象、某因素或性质更加清楚）：add distinct

sentences.english: The image of a seemingly tiny dancer was superimposed on the image of the table.
sentences.chinese: 一个看似很小的舞蹈者的影像被叠加在了那张桌子的影像上。

detailed_translations.english: to put one picture, image, or photograph on top of another so that both can be partly seen

name: disarm
trans: 解除武装：reduce armed forces；使息怒，平息，抚慰：lessen；使无害：harmless

sentences.english: Getting the rebels to disarm will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 要让叛乱分子解除武装并非易事。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the size of your army, navy etc, and the number of your weapons

sentences.english: He heavily expurgated the work in its second edition.
sentences.chinese: 在第二版中，他大幅删减了该作品。

detailed_translations.english: If someone expurgates a piece of writing, they remove parts of it before it is published because they think those parts will offend or shock people

sentences.english: What Bracey is saying is tantamount to heresy.
sentences.chinese: 布里斯正在说的无异于异端邪说。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that one thing is tantamount to another, more serious thing, you are emphasizing how bad, unacceptable, or unfortunate the first thing is by comparing it to the second thing

sentences.english: They are proudly trumpeting the fact that they are creating more jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他们得意地宣扬他们是在创造更多的工作岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to tell everyone about something that you are proud of, especially in an annoying way

name: cleave
trans: 紧贴，坚持：adhere；分隔，割裂，劈开：divide

sentences.english: The wooden door had been cleft in two.
sentences.chinese: 木门被劈成了两半。

detailed_translations.chinese: 裂开；披荆斩棘地前进；粘住；坚持
detailed_translations.english: to cut something into separate parts using a heavy tool, or to be able to be cut in this way

name: haphazard
trans: 无秩序的，无目标的：lack of plan, order or direction

sentences.english: It was strings of words borrowed from the different languages around them and put together in sort of haphazard ways.
sentences.chinese: 它只不过是从身边的不同语言当中,借用了一些单词串,以随意的方式将它们放在一起

sentences.english: All the master had to do was shake the tree a little and the garden was full of leaves again, spread out in haphazard patterns.
sentences.chinese: 大师什么都没有做，只是摇了摇树。 花园又重新被凋落的树叶覆盖了，整个花园展现出随意的样式。

name: lament
trans: 悼词：composition grief；抱怨：resentment；为…哀悼，表达痛苦或遗憾：express sorrow

sentences.english: The nation lamented the death of its great war leader.
sentences.chinese: 举国上下都在哀悼他们伟大的战时领袖。

detailed_translations.english: to express feelings of great sadness about something
a song, piece of music, or something that you say, that expresses a feeling of sadness

sentences.english: The company’s debt has ballooned in the past year.
sentences.chinese: 在过去一年里，公司的债务激增。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become larger in amount
an object made of brightly coloured thin rubber, that is filled with air and used as a toy or decoration for parties

name: dogged
trans: 坚持的，坚决的：continuing, slackening, yielding]；固执的，任性的：sticking to

sentences.english: a dogged determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 不屈不挠的成功决心

detailed_translations.english: dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined to continue doing something

sentences.english: The report galvanized world opinion.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道一出，世界舆论一片哗然。

detailed_translations.english: to shock or surprise someone so that they do something to solve a problem, improve a situation etc

sentences.english: interminable delays
sentences.chinese: 无休止的拖延

detailed_translations.english: very long and boring

sentences.english: an environment conducive to learning
sentences.chinese: 有助于学习的环境

detailed_translations.english: if a situation is conducive to something such as work, rest etc, it provides conditions that make it easy for you to work etc

name: pious
trans: （信仰上）虔诚的：devotion to divine worship；忠诚的：firm in one's allegiance

sentences.english: He was a quiet, pious man.
sentences.chinese: 他是个文静、虔诚的人。

detailed_translations.english: having strong religious beliefs, and showing this in the way you behave

name: cardinal
trans: 主要的，非常重要的：foremost importance, paramount

sentences.english: Having clean hands is one of the cardinal rules when preparing food.
sentences.chinese: 双手洁净是准备食物时的一项最基本要求。

sentences.english: an issue of cardinal importance
sentences.chinese: 至关重要的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 红衣主教；枢机主教；鲜红色；【鸟类】(北美)主红雀
detailed_translations.english: a priest of high rank in the Roman Catholic Church

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的，基本的；深红色的
detailed_translations.english: very important or basic

sentences.english: British newspapers no longer feel they must treat the royal family with discretion.
sentences.chinese: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到
detailed_translations.english: the ability to deal with situations in a way that does not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell any of their secrets

name: imbibe
trans: 喝水，摄取水分：take in liquid

sentences.english: Both men imbibed considerable quantities of gin.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人都喝了大量的杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to drink something, especially alcohol – sometimes used humorously

name: consolidate
trans: 使联合，统一：join together；加固，使安全：make firm

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

sentences.english: The children learn through role-play, dance and mime.
sentences.chinese: 儿童通过角色表演、舞蹈和哑剧来学习。

sentences.english: They will perform a short mime later.
sentences.chinese: 稍后他们将表演一个哑剧小品。

sentences.english: a professional mime artist
sentences.chinese: 专业的哑剧表演艺术家

detailed_translations.english: the use of movements to express what you want to say without using words, or a play where the actors use only movements
to describe or express something, using movements not words

name: ingratiating
trans: 讨人喜欢的：winning favor；逢迎的，意在奉承的：gain favor

sentences.english: He said this with an ingratiating smile.
sentences.chinese: 他说这个的时候面带讨好的微笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 逢迎的，讨好的；迷人的，吸引人的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone or their behaviour as ingratiating, you mean that they try to make people like them

sentences.english: She learned to rue the day she had met Henri.
sentences.chinese: 她开始后悔认识了亨利。

detailed_translations.english: to wish that you had not done something
sorrow, pity, or regret

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

sentences.english: The country was plunged into economic chaos.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

sentences.english: urban riots
sentences.chinese: 城市骚乱

sentences.english: prison riots
sentences.chinese: 监狱暴乱

sentences.english: His murder triggered vicious race riots (= caused by a problem between different races ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的被杀引发了严重的种族骚乱。

sentences.english: police wearing riot gear
sentences.chinese: 配有防暴装备的警察

sentences.english: police in bullet-proof vests and carrying riot shields
sentences.chinese: 穿防弹背心、持防暴盾牌的警察

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something
if a crowd of people riot, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way, for example by fighting the police and damaging cars or buildings

sentences.english: He became surly and rude toward me.
sentences.chinese: 他变得对我粗暴无礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乖戾的；板面孔的，无礼的；阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is surly behaves in a rude bad-tempered way

name: charisma
trans: n.(大众爱戴的)领袖气质；魅力

sentences.english: He lacks charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏个人魅力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魅力；神授的能力；非凡的领导力
detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to attract and interest other people and make them admire you

name: ubiquitous
trans: 无所不在的，普通的：everywhere, often observed

sentences.english: Coffee shops are ubiquitous these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像到处都是咖啡馆。

sentences.english: a French film, starring the ubiquitous Gérard Depardieu
sentences.chinese: 一部法国电影，由家喻户晓的热拉尔·德帕迪约主演

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍存在的；无所不在的
detailed_translations.english: seeming to be everywhere – sometimes used humorously

name: preoccupation
trans: n.全神贯注；使人专注的东西
非常关系，全神贯注：extreme concern

sentences.english: Karouzos's poetry shows a profound preoccupation with the Orthodox Church.
sentences.chinese: 卡鲁佐斯的诗歌表现出对东正教的深切关注。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全神贯注，入神；当务之急；关注的事物；抢先占据；成见
detailed_translations.english: when someone thinks or worries about something a lot, with the result that they do not pay attention to other things

sentences.english: mobile air-conditioners
sentences.chinese: 移动式空调器

sentences.english: a mobile shop/library (= one inside a vehicle)
sentences.chinese: 流动商店 / 图书馆

detailed_translations.english: that is not fixed in one place and can be moved easily and quickly

name: baroque
trans: n./a.(艺术、建筑等)过分雕琢(的)
装饰华丽的，过分雕琢的，复杂的：extravagance, complexity, flamboyance; （程度上）过分的：beyond, limit

sentences.english: furnished in a baroque style
sentences.chinese: 以巴洛克风格陈设的

detailed_translations.chinese: 巴洛克式的；结构复杂的，形式怪样的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the very decorated style of art, music, buildings etc, that was common in Europe in the 17th and early 18th centuries

detailed_translations.chinese: 巴洛克风格；巴洛克艺术
detailed_translations.english: used to describe baroque art, music, buildings etc

sentences.english: It’s too windy for a picnic.
sentences.chinese: 风太大，不适合野餐。

sentences.english: a cold, windy day
sentences.chinese: 一个寒冷的大风天

sentences.english: a windy hillside
sentences.chinese: 当风的山坡

detailed_translations.chinese: 多风的，有风的；腹胀的；吹牛的
detailed_translations.english: if it is windy, there is a lot of wind

sentences.english: a particularly virulent form of influenza
sentences.chinese: 特别凶猛的一种流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 剧毒的；恶性的；有恶意的
detailed_translations.english: a poison, disease etc that is virulent is very dangerous and affects people very quickly

sentences.english: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.english: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

detailed_translations.english: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

name: supplement
trans: 增补，补充：complete for a deficiency

sentences.english: vitamins and other dietary supplements
sentences.chinese: 各种维生素和其他膳食补充剂

detailed_translations.chinese: 增补， 补充； 增刊， 副刊
detailed_translations.english: something that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level

name: vague
trans: 表达不清的：not clearly expressed；轮廓不清晰的：lacking definite shape

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

sentences.english: Because you let me have that kind of not to think a disjunctive felling.
sentences.chinese: 因为你让我有了那种不想分离的感觉。

sentences.english: Drag onto the page, then connect external disjunctive mandatory constraint shape to constrained role(s).
sentences.chinese: 拖到绘图页上，然后将外部分离强制约束形状连接到被约束的角色。

detailed_translations.english: serving to disconnect or separate

name: epic
trans: n.叙事诗，史诗；a.英雄的；大规模的
宏大的，超凡脱俗的：surpassing the usual

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

sentences.english: a look of complete disdain
sentences.chinese: 极为鄙视的样子

detailed_translations.english: a complete lack of respect that you show for someone or something because you think they are not important or good enough
to have no respect for someone or something, because you think they are not important or good enough

sentences.english: We’re looking for someone with an outgoing personality.
sentences.chinese: 我们在找一个性格外向的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外出的， 离开的； 即将离职的； 友好的， 好交际的； 外向的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is outgoing likes to meet and talk to new people

name: scrap
trans: 废料，废物：discarded or useless；抛弃：get rid of；终止，放弃原计划：put an end to

sentences.english: He’s always getting into scraps with other dogs.
sentences.chinese: 它老是和别的狗打起来。

sentences.english: There's always tons of scrap paper in Dad's office.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的办公室里总有大量的废纸。

detailed_translations.english: a short fight or argument
Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use

name: aggregate
trans: 集合体：units or parts, associated; 集合，聚焦：collect or gather

sentences.english: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: congenial
trans: 和善的，友好的：agreement；令人愉悦的：giving pleasure

sentences.english: Compost provides congenial conditions for roots to develop.
sentences.chinese: 堆肥为根部的生长提供了适宜的条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意气相投的；性格相似的；适意的；一致的
detailed_translations.english: suitable for something

name: pilot
trans: 领航员，飞行员：steer a ship；初步性的，试验性的：tentative model；带领通过：lead

sentences.english: an airline pilot
sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

detailed_translations.english: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft
A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: abstain
trans: 自我克制，主动戒绝：refrain, by one’s own choice

sentences.english: Three countries abstained in the vote.
sentences.chinese: 三个国家在投票中弃权了。

detailed_translations.english: If you abstain during a vote, you do not use your vote

name: mundane
trans: 尘世的，世俗化的：relating to world；平凡的：commonplaces

sentences.english: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始，这工作非常乏味。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

name: falter
trans: 蹒跚：walk unsteadily；犹豫踌躇：unsteady in purpose or action

sentences.english: Laurie’s voice faltered as she tried to thank him.
sentences.chinese: 劳丽想谢谢他，却说得结结巴巴的。

sentences.english: ‘I can’t,’ she faltered.
sentences.chinese: “我做不到。”她支支吾吾地说道。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in a voice that sounds weak and uncertain, and keeps stopping

sentences.english: The prologue to the novel is written in the form of a newspaper account.
sentences.chinese: 该小说的前言是以新闻报道的形式写的。

detailed_translations.english: the introduction to a play, a long poem etc

name: glacial
trans: a.冰期的，冰河期的；寒冷的
极冷的：extremely cold；冷漠的，无感情的：devoid of warmth

sentences.english: a glacial valley
sentences.chinese: 冰川谷

sentences.english: glacial deposits
sentences.chinese: 冰川沉积

detailed_translations.chinese: 冰的；冰冷的；冰河时代的
detailed_translations.english: relating to ice and glaciers, or formed by glaciers

name: harbor
trans: 提供住处，隐匿：provide habitat；心怀，牢记：keep in one’s mind

sentences.english: All the battleships can refresh in this harbor.
sentences.chinese: 所有战舰都能在这个港口装上补充供应品。

sentences.english: It is the harbor of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 它是雅典的港口城。

sentences.english: She stands on a small island in New York harbor, near the great city.
sentences.chinese: 她竖立在纽约海港的一座小岛，并紧挨着纽约这座大城市。

sentences.english: She was sent home and put in quarantine.
sentences.chinese: 她被送回家实施隔离。

detailed_translations.english: to keep a person or animal apart from others for a period of time in case they are carrying a disease
a period of time when a person or animal is kept apart from others in case they are carrying a disease

sentences.english: I couldn’t read his scribble.
sentences.chinese: 我看不懂他潦草的字。

detailed_translations.chinese: 潦草写成的东西；潦草的写法；杂文
detailed_translations.english: untidy writing that is difficult to read
to write something quickly and untidily

sentences.english: Police managed to subdue the angry crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察设法控制住了愤怒的人群。

sentences.english: Napoleon subdued much of Europe.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑控制了大半个欧洲。

detailed_translations.english: to defeat or control a person or group, especially using force

name: compliment
trans: 称赞，恭维：praise; 敬意，免费赠送的礼物：respectful

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

sentences.english: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
sentences.chinese: 管道最薄弱的地方会破裂的。

sentences.english: His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
sentences.chinese: 一堵砖墙坍塌压住了他，导致他的肝脏破裂。

detailed_translations.english: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts

sentences.english: a puzzle with 500 interlocking pieces
sentences.chinese: 由500个紧密相扣的块组成的拼图

detailed_translations.english: if two or more things interlock, or if they are interlocked, they fit firmly together

sentences.english: Laws stipulate the maximum interest rate that banks can charge.
sentences.chinese: 法律对银行可以收取的最高利率作了规定。

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement, law, or rule stipulates something, it must be done

sentences.english: You’d better go and see the quack with that burn.
sentences.chinese: 你最好去找医生看看那处烧伤。

sentences.english: There were ducks quacking on the lawn.
sentences.chinese: 有鸭子在草坪上发出嘎嘎的叫着。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor
When a duck quacks, it makes the noise that ducks typically make
relating to the activities or medicines of someone who pretends to be a doctor

sentences.english: a dingy room
sentences.chinese: 阴暗邋遢的房间

sentences.english: a dingy side-street
sentences.chinese: 昏暗肮脏的小街

detailed_translations.english: dark, dirty, and in bad condition

name: toy
trans: 草率或不认真地对待：handle thoughtlessly

sentences.english: some toys for the baby
sentences.chinese: 宝宝玩的一些玩具

sentences.english: Annie was playing happily with her toys .
sentences.chinese: 安妮正高兴地玩着玩具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩具；小装饰品；不值钱的东西
detailed_translations.english: an object for children to play with

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩弄；调情；随随便便地对待

name: steadfast
trans: 坚定的，忠诚的：firm in belief

sentences.english: her father’s steadfast love for her
sentences.chinese: 她父亲对她永不改变的爱

detailed_translations.english: being certain that you are right about something and refusing to change your opinion in any way

sentences.english: The peasants leaned down to reap wheat.
sentences.chinese: 农民们俯身收割小麦。

detailed_translations.english: to cut and collect a crop of grain

sentences.english: a gilded frame
sentences.chinese: 镀金框

detailed_translations.english: to cover something with a thin layer of gold or with something that looks like gold

name: flock
trans: 人群，兽群：creatures massed together；聚集，集体行动：travel in a flock

sentences.english: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

detailed_translations.english: to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers

name: bland
trans: a.(人)情绪平稳的；(食物)无味的
味道平淡的，不刺激的：soothing; 无趣的：dull; 温和的，和蔼的：not harsh

sentences.english: a few bland comments
sentences.chinese: 不痛不痒的几句评语

detailed_translations.english: without any excitement, strong opinions, or special character

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…变得淡而无味；除掉…的特性
变得平淡无奇；丧失特性

name: soothe
trans: 带来慰藉，安慰：bring comfort；使镇静，使安心：free from distress；弱化，缓解：less severe

sentences.english: Lucy soothed the baby by rocking it in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 露西把宝宝抱在怀里摇晃着，让他安静下来。

sentences.english: She made a cup of tea to soothe her nerves.
sentences.chinese: 她泡了杯茶让自己平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: blast
trans: 爆炸：explosion; 一阵猛烈的强风：gust; 巨响：loud, sound; 炸裂，爆破：cause to break open;斥责，抨击：criticize harshly

sentences.english: I had the gas fire going full blast .
sentences.chinese: 我把煤气取暖器开到最大。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind or air
to criticize someone or something very strongly – used especially in news reports

name: reprove
trans: 温和地责备，警告：scold gently；不欣赏，不喜欢：unfavorable opinion

sentences.english: "There's no call for talk like that," Mrs. Evans reproved him.
sentences.chinese: “没有必要说那种话，”埃文斯太太责备他道。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize someone for something that they have done

name: exploit
trans: v.剥削；开发利用；n.英勇行为
英雄行为：notable act；最大程度地利用：employ

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

sentences.english: The child’s incessant talking started to irritate her.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子喋喋不休，她开始烦躁起来。

sentences.english: incessant rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing without stopping

sentences.english: a ballpoint pen
sentences.chinese: 圆珠笔

sentences.english: a felt-tip pen
sentences.chinese: 毡头笔

sentences.english: a pen and ink drawing
sentences.chinese: 钢笔画

detailed_translations.english: an instrument for writing or drawing with ink

name: ration
trans: 定额供应量，配给量：amount allotted；按比例分配：share or portion

sentences.english: Fuel was rationed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争期间，燃油定量供应。

detailed_translations.english: to control the supply of something because there is not enough
a fixed amount of something that people are allowed to have when there is not enough, for example during a war

name: alienate
trans: 使...疏远：unfriendly, hostile,indifferent；转让，让渡：convey or transfer

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

name: eccentric
trans: a.古怪的，反常的；n.古怪的人
行为出格的，不循规蹈矩的：deviating conventional

sentences.english: His eccentric behaviour lost him his job.
sentences.chinese: 他古怪的行为使他丢了工作。

sentences.english: Aunt Nessy was always a bit eccentric.
sentences.chinese: 内西姑妈总是有点古怪。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is unusual and different from most people
someone who behaves in a way that is different from what is usual or socially accepted

sentences.english: It vexed me to think of others gossiping behind my back.
sentences.chinese: 想到别人在我背后说闲话让我很恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or worried

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: knit
trans: 编织（纱线）：interlacing yarn with needles；连接，联系：join closely

sentences.english: My grandmother taught me how to knit.
sentences.chinese: 我祖母教过我编织。

sentences.english: She’s knitting a sweater.
sentences.chinese: 她在织毛衣。

detailed_translations.english: to make clothing out of wool, using two knitting needles

name: indigenous
trans: 土产的，本地的：originating；与生俱来的，先天的：innermost nature

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: shoal
trans: n.浅滩，浅水处；一群(鱼等)；a.水浅的

sentences.english: Among them swam shoals of fish.
sentences.chinese: 在他们之中游动着一群群鱼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浅滩，沙洲；鱼群；潜在危险
detailed_translations.english: a large group of fish swimming together

sentences.english: a ribald remark
sentences.chinese: 粗俗的言论

sentences.english: ribald humour
sentences.chinese: 猥亵的幽默

detailed_translations.english: ribald remarks or jokes are humorous, rude, and about sex

detailed_translations.chinese: 言谈粗俗的人；说下流话的人

sentences.english: Researchers greeted the proposal with scorn.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们对这个提议报以轻蔑的态度。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that someone or something is stupid or does not deserve respect

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻蔑， 鄙视； 拒绝， 不屑
detailed_translations.english: to show that you think that something is stupid, unreasonable, or not worth accepting

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

name: dampen
trans: （特指稍稍地）弄湿：wet；抑制，压抑（感情、精力等），泼冷水：diminish the feeling, activity or vigor

sentences.english: The light rain dampened the crowd’s enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 小雨使观众的热情减退了。

sentences.english: Raising interest rates might dampen the economy.
sentences.chinese: 提高利率可能会抑制经济发展。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as a feeling or activity less strong

name: meticulous
trans: 极为谨慎的：extreme or excessive care

sentences.english: He kept meticulous accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他的账记得一丝不苟。

sentences.english: Their planning and preparation were meticulous.
sentences.chinese: 他们的计划和准备工作都很周密。

sentences.english: He cleaned the tools with meticulous care.
sentences.chinese: 他十分认真地清洁了工具。

sentences.english: The book describes his journey in meticulous detail.
sentences.chinese: 这本书很详细地描述了他的旅程。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一丝不苟的；小心翼翼的；拘泥小节的
detailed_translations.english: very careful about small details, and always making sure that everything is done correctly

name: dawdle
trans: 闲荡，虚度光阴：spend time idly；拖拖拉拉：slowly

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

sentences.english: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查绳索，因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

detailed_translations.english: when one surface rubs against another

name: fortify
trans: 加固，鼓励：give physical strength；做好心理准备：prepare mentally

sentences.english: Her position was fortified by election successes and economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 她的地位因为选举获胜及经济复苏而得到巩固。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger
to build towers, walls etc around an area or city in order to defend it

name: teeter
trans: 蹒跚，不稳定地行走：unsteadily；犹豫不决：uncertainty

sentences.english: She teetered along in her high-heeled shoes.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着高跟鞋踉踉跄跄地走着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 摇晃；玩跷跷板；步履蹒跚；摇摇欲坠；岌岌可危
detailed_translations.english: to stand or walk moving from side to side, as if you are going to fall

name: peripheral
trans: 外围的：boundary or periphery；辅助性的：supply

sentences.english: a diplomat who had a peripheral role in the negotiations
sentences.chinese: 在谈判中发挥辅助作用的外交官

sentences.english: Her involvement in the case was peripheral.
sentences.chinese: 她在这宗案件中是从犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外围的；次要的；（神经）末梢区域的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as other things or people in a particular activity, idea, or situation
a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer and used with it, for example a  printer

sentences.english: a meeting covering many disparate subjects
sentences.chinese: 涉及许多不同议题的会议

sentences.english: the difficulties of dealing with disparate groups of people
sentences.chinese: 和不同的人群打交道的难处

detailed_translations.chinese: 不同的；不相干的；全异的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of things or people that are very different and not related to each other

sentences.english: Whenever he was angry, he would begin to stammer slightly.
sentences.chinese: 他一生气说话就开始有点结巴。

sentences.english: Jeff spoke with a slight stammer.
sentences.chinese: 杰夫说话有点结巴。

detailed_translations.english: to speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds, either because you have a speech problem, or because you are nervous, excited etc
a speech problem which makes someone speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: metaphysical
trans: 哲学上的，理论上的：idea；非尘世的：beyond universe

sentences.english: A lot of scientists don’t like discussing metaphysical matters.
sentences.chinese: 很多科学家不喜欢讨论形而上学的东西。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形而上学的；超自然的；玄学派诗歌的
detailed_translations.english: concerned with the study of metaphysics

name: defile
trans: （山间）小道：a narrow passage；亵渎：treat with great disrespect；使腐坏，污损：make unfit for use

sentences.english: Hallam’s tomb had been defiled and looted.
sentences.chinese: 哈勒姆的坟墓遭到了亵渎和洗劫。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less pure and good, especially by showing no respect

sentences.english: There’s no appreciable change in the patient’s condition.
sentences.chinese: 病人的状况没有明显改变。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可感知的；可评估的；相当可观的
detailed_translations.english: An appreciable amount or effect is large enough to be important or clearly noticed

sentences.english: Not everybody is a sage. Who can be entirely free from error?
sentences.chinese: 人非圣贤，孰能无过?

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially an old man, who is very wise
very wise, especially as a result of a lot of experience

name: stereotype
trans: 成见，老套的理念：conventional, formulaic, and oversimplified opinion

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

sentences.english: an imposing building
sentences.chinese: 宏伟的建筑

sentences.english: He’s a tall, quietly spoken, but imposing figure.
sentences.chinese: 他高高的个子，说话轻声细语，但气宇轩昂。

detailed_translations.english: large, impressive, and appearing important

sentences.english: I was treated with decorum and respect throughout the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 整个调查当中我受到了礼遇和尊重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼仪；礼貌；端正；恪守礼仪
detailed_translations.english: Decorum is behaviour that people consider to be correct, polite, and respectable

name: random
trans: a.没有明确目的、计划或者目标的；偶然的，随便的

sentences.english: The gang picked their victims at random.
sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。

detailed_translations.english: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

sentences.english: an abundant supply of fresh water
sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.english: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的
detailed_translations.english: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough

name: intimate
trans: 有紧密联系的，亲密无间的：close association；不为人知的：not known；密友：person who has a strong liking；迂回地交流，间接地沟通：communicate indirectly

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

sentences.english: We found him lying at the bottom of the stairs in a drunken stupor .
sentences.chinese: 我们发现他躺在楼梯口，醉得不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: a state in which you cannot think, speak, see, or hear clearly, usually because you have drunk too much alcohol or taken drugs

name: categorical
trans: a.无条件的，绝对的；分类的
没有例外的，无条件限制的，绝对的：without, qualification, absolute

detailed_translations.chinese: 绝对的（名词categoricalness，副词categorically，异体字categoric）；直截了当的；无条件的；属于某一范畴的
detailed_translations.english: a categorical statement is a clear statement that something is definitely true or false

name: exquisite
trans: 程度强烈的：extreme；精致精巧的：refined taste

sentences.english: the most exquisite craftsmanship
sentences.chinese: 最精美的工艺

detailed_translations.chinese: 精致的；细腻的；优美的，高雅的；异常的；剧烈的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful and very delicately made

name: sordid
trans: 肮脏的，不干净的：not clean；卑鄙的：baseness

sentences.english: a sordid little room
sentences.chinese: 肮脏的小房间

detailed_translations.chinese: 肮脏的；卑鄙的；利欲熏心的；色彩暗淡的
detailed_translations.english: involving immoral or dishonest behaviour

name: verse
trans: 使精通，使熟悉：familiarize；诗歌：rhythm lyrical effect

sentences.english: Let’s sing the last verse again.
sentences.chinese: 我们把最后一节再唱一遍吧。

sentences.english: Learn the first two verses of the poem by heart.
sentences.chinese: 把这首诗的头两节背下来。

sentences.english: Genesis chapter 3, verse 13
sentences.chinese: 《创世记》第3章第13节

detailed_translations.english: a set of lines that forms one part of a song, poem, or a book such as the Bible or the Koran

sentences.english: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
sentences.chinese: 一种潜藏在阴影里的无形危险

detailed_translations.english: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong

name: emboss
trans: 以浮雕效果妆点，装饰：ornament with raised work

detailed_translations.chinese: 使凸出；在……上作浮雕图案；装饰
detailed_translations.english: to mould or carve (a decoration or design) on (a surface) so that it is raised above the surface in low relief

name: loll
trans: 懒洋洋地行动：lazy；偷懒，打发时间：doing nothing

sentences.english: He was lolling on the sofa in the shadows near the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他懒洋洋地躺在炉火边一个背光的沙发上。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or lie in a very lazy and relaxed way

sentences.english: Before long, the dispute degenerated into fierce polemics.
sentences.chinese: 不久争论就演变为激烈的论战。

detailed_translations.english: a written or spoken statement that strongly criticizes or defends a particular idea, opinion, or person

sentences.english: His novel has a didactic tone.
sentences.chinese: 他的小说有一种道德说教的口吻。

detailed_translations.english: speech or writing that is didactic is intended to teach people a moral lesson

name: rend
trans: 撕裂，猛拉：tear or split apart

sentences.english: ...pain that rends the heart.
sentences.chinese: ...撕心裂肺的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to tear or break something violently into pieces

name: throng
trans: 大量聚集：crowd in great numbers

sentences.english: She got lost in the throng.
sentences.chinese: 她在人群中迷路了。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people in one place
if people throng a place, they go there in large numbers

name: palpable
trans: 摸得到的：capable touched；明显的，易觉察的：obvious

sentences.english: There was a palpable sense of relief among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 众人显然都感到如释重负。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明显的；可感知的；易觉察的
detailed_translations.english: a feeling that is palpable is so strong that other people notice it and can feel it around them

name: deify
trans: 把…当作神来崇拜：offer honor or respect to；过分喜爱：love or admire；尊敬，尊崇：high status or value to

sentences.english: Valentino was virtually deified by legions of female fans.
sentences.chinese: 华伦天奴实际上被女性粉丝团神化了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…奉若神明；把…神化；崇拜
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone or something with extreme respect and admiration

name: acumen
trans: 不同寻常的洞察力和鉴别力：exceptional discernment and judgment

sentences.english: His business acumen helped him to succeed where others had failed.
sentences.chinese: 他在商业上的敏锐帮他在其他人失败的地方获得成功。

sentences.english: Science considers to make clear, the baby is to comparative to outside information of acumen, acceptance rate is quite rapid also.
sentences.chinese: 科学研究表明，婴儿对外界信息是相当敏锐的，接受的速度也相当快。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to think quickly and make good judgments

sentences.english: ...tawdry jewellery.
sentences.chinese: ... 廉价而俗丽的珠宝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非常华丽的；廉价而俗丽的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something such as clothes or decorations as tawdry, you mean that they are cheap and show a lack of taste

detailed_translations.chinese: 俗丽的东西；廉价而俗丽之物

sentences.english: His reply was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.english: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: methodical
trans: 井然有序的，有条理的：systematic order

sentences.english: She’s a very methodical person.
sentences.chinese: 她是个办事很有条理的人。

sentences.english: He had a neat, methodical mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的思路清晰有条理。

detailed_translations.english: a methodical person always does things carefully, using an ordered system

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: perfunctory
trans: 例行公事的，敷衍的：superficially；不感兴趣的：lacking in interest

sentences.english: She gave him a perfunctory smile.
sentences.chinese: 她对他漫不经心地笑了笑。

sentences.english: The applause was perfunctory.
sentences.chinese: 掌声听上去是在敷衍了事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 敷衍的；马虎的；得过且过的
detailed_translations.english: a perfunctory action is done quickly, and is only done because people expect it

sentences.english: The official report basically exonerated everyone.
sentences.chinese: 该官方报告基本洗脱了所有人的干系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 证明…无罪；  免受指控
detailed_translations.english: to state officially that someone who has been blamed for something is not guilty

name: rein
trans: 抑制，限制：keeping within certain boundaries；抑制，控制：keep from exceeding

sentences.english: Cord held the reins while the stallion tugged and snorted.
sentences.chinese: 当那匹牡马使劲挣扎，打着响鼻的时候，科德勒紧了缰绳。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow band of leather that is fastened around a horse’s head in order to control it

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒缰使停步； 控制， 约束

name: harass
trans: 烦扰：irritate persistently；耗尽…的体力：use up

sentences.english: A number of black youths have complained of being harassed by the police.
sentences.chinese: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困扰；使烦恼；反复袭击
detailed_translations.english: to make someone’s life unpleasant, for example by frequently saying offensive things to them or threatening them

name: acute
trans: 敏锐的：keen discernment; 严重的，急性的：immediate attention; （程度、影响）极强的：extreme

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

sentences.english: He attempted to mollify her.
sentences.chinese: 他想安抚她。

sentences.english: Nature reserves were set up around new power stations to mollify local conservationists.
sentences.chinese: 新的发电站附近建立了自然保护区，以安抚当地的自然环境保护主义者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平息，缓和；使…平静；使…变软
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less angry and upset about something

sentences.english: the characteristic use of satire in Jonson’s work
sentences.chinese: 琼森作品中讽刺手法的独到运用

detailed_translations.chinese: 讽刺；讽刺文学，讽刺作品
detailed_translations.english: a way of criticizing something such as a group of people or a system, in which you deliberately make them seem funny so that people will see their faults

name: referee
trans: 仲裁者；裁判员：impartially resolves a dispute；（就纠纷或争论）给出意见：give an opinion

sentences.english: His headmaster agreed to act as his referee.
sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,  basketball  , or  boxing  , are followed
to be the referee of a game

sentences.english: the pernicious effects of poverty
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的危害性

sentences.english: the media’s pernicious influence
sentences.chinese: 媒体的有害影响

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的；恶性的；致命的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: very harmful or evil, often in a way that you do not notice easily

name: demanding
trans: 难以取悦的，难满足的：satisfied；费时间花心思的：requiring careful attention

sentences.english: a demanding job
sentences.chinese: 高要求的工作

detailed_translations.chinese: 苛求的；要求高的；吃力的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of ability, effort, or skill

sentences.english: Kepler published his discovery of the elliptical orbits of planets in 1609. 1609
sentences.chinese: 年开普勒公布他的发现，认为行星轨道为椭圆形。

detailed_translations.english: having the shape of an ellipse

name: cast
trans: 演员，演员阵容：a set of characters; 选派（演员）：assign, actor; 提出：give off; 抛弃：get rid of

sentences.english: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
sentences.chinese: 低垂的树枝投下的阴影

detailed_translations.english: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

detailed_translations.chinese: 演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸型， 铸件； 投， 抛
detailed_translations.english: all the people who perform in a play, film etc

sentences.english: a fraudulent insurance claim
sentences.chinese: 欺诈性保险索赔

sentences.english: a fraudulent statement
sentences.chinese: 骗人的声明

detailed_translations.english: intended to deceive people in an illegal way, in order to gain money, power etc

name: ethereal
trans: 轻巧精致的：lightness, highly refined, delicate；天国的：heaven；非物质的，精神（上）的：spiritual, not composed of matter

sentences.english: ethereal beauty
sentences.chinese: 超凡的美丽

sentences.english: His music is ethereal.
sentences.chinese: 他的音乐超凡脱俗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 优雅的；轻飘的；缥缈的；超凡的
detailed_translations.english: very delicate and light, in a way that does not seem real

name: hypocritical
trans: 虚伪的：not being what one appears to be

sentences.english: It would be hypocritical to say I travel at 70 mph simply because that is the law.
sentences.chinese: 如果仅仅因为法律规定的时速是70英里我就说自己的行驶时速是70英里，那就太虚伪了。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is different from what you claim to believe – used to show disapproval

name: sophisticated
trans: a.老于世故的；(仪器)精密的
精明的，老于世故的：worldly knowledge or refinement；复杂的：complex

sentences.english: sophisticated software
sentences.chinese: 很先进的软件

sentences.english: a highly sophisticated weapons system
sentences.chinese: 非常精密的武器系统

detailed_translations.english: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

name: mediocre
trans: 平庸的，质量中等偏下的：moderate

sentences.english: I thought the book was pretty mediocre.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这本书非常一般。

sentences.english: a mediocre student
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

detailed_translations.english: not very good

sentences.english: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

detailed_translations.english: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

name: clandestine
trans: 隐藏的，秘密的：secret, illicit, improper

sentences.english: a clandestine affair
sentences.chinese: 秘密关系

sentences.english: clandestine meetings
sentences.chinese: 秘密会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的
detailed_translations.english: done or kept secret

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: humor
