trans: 幽默，令人发笑的事物：comical or amusing；迎合，迁就：comply with

sentences.english: I like your sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你的 幽默感。

sentences.english: His remarks participated of the sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 他的话里带有几分幽默感。

sentences.english: She loved everything about him -- his personality, his humor, the way he dressed.
sentences.chinese: 她爱他的一切——他的性格，他的幽默，还有他的衣着打扮。

name: limp
trans: 柔软的，松散的：lacking firm；软弱的，没有精神的：lacking strength；跛行，艰难地行走：haltingly or unsteadily

sentences.english: a limp handshake
sentences.chinese: 无力的握手

sentences.english: His body suddenly went limp.
sentences.chinese: 他突然身子一软。

detailed_translations.english: not firm or strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛行，一拐一拐地走；缓慢费力地前进
detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
the way someone walks when they are limping

name: languid
trans: 没精打采的，虚弱的：lacking energy

sentences.english: He greeted Charles with a languid wave of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他无精打采地挥挥手，算是和查尔斯打招呼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倦怠的；呆滞的；软弱无力的

name: partial
trans: 偏袒的，偏爱的：biased；部分的，不完整的：lacking

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: ramble
trans: 漫步，漫游：move aimlessly；漫谈，长篇大论（并经常离题）地说或写：without a topic

sentences.english: I quite like the idea of going for a ramble one weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得找个周末去乡下走走这个主意不错。

detailed_translations.english: a walk in the countryside for pleasure
to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure

name: tame
trans: 被驯化的：reduced from a state of native wildness；无聊的，乏味的：lacking spirit；控制，抑制：keep from exceeding

sentences.english: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
sentences.chinese: 评论的大部分内容很乏味。

sentences.english: I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
sentences.chinese: 我最终认为教书对我来说太枯燥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 驯服的，顺从的；沉闷的，乏味的
detailed_translations.english: dull and disappointing

detailed_translations.chinese: 制服， 控制并利用； 驯化， 驯服
detailed_translations.english: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble

sentences.english: ...the irreducible complexity of human life.
sentences.chinese: ...人类生活的复杂无法简化。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 不可约的；不能削减的；不能复归的
detailed_translations.english: an irreducible sum, level etc cannot be made smaller or simpler

sentences.english: the temporal character of human existence
sentences.chinese: 人生的短促

detailed_translations.english: related to or limited by time

name: nomad
trans: 游牧的；居无定所的人：no fixed residence

sentences.english: ...a country of nomads who raise cattle and camels.
sentences.chinese: ...一个饲养牛和骆驼的游牧国家。

detailed_translations.english: a member of a tribe that travels from place to place instead of living in one place all the time, usually in order to find grass for their animals

sentences.english: Knead the dough for three minutes.
sentences.chinese: 将面团揉三分钟。

detailed_translations.english: to press a mixture of flour and water many times with your hands

name: nourish
trans: 养育，培养：provide with food；培养，促进：help with growth

sentences.english: The cream contains vitamin A to nourish the skin.
sentences.chinese: 这种护肤霜含有滋养肌肤的维生素A。

sentences.english: a well nourished baby
sentences.chinese: 营养良好的婴儿

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or other living thing the food and other substances they need in order to live, grow, and stay healthy

name: fringe
trans: 边缘：border；与…接壤，位于…的边缘：be adjacent

sentences.english: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
sentences.chinese: 一头棕色直发、留着刘海的高个子女孩

sentences.english: The monarchists are a small fringe group who quarrel fiercely among themselves.
sentences.chinese: 君主制拥护者们是个边缘性小团体，内部争吵激烈。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
Fringe groups or events are less important or popular than other related groups or events

name: slight
trans: 不重要的：deficient in weight；轻微的：small in degree；轻蔑，看不起：treat with disdain；忽略，疏忽：fail to give proper attention

sentences.english: a slight improvement
sentences.chinese: 些许的改进

sentences.english: a slight increase
sentences.chinese: 少许的增加

sentences.english: a slight change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的略微变动

sentences.english: a slight pause
sentences.chinese: 稍稍的停顿

sentences.english: a slight problem
sentences.chinese: 小问题

detailed_translations.english: small in degree
to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect

sentences.english: The nurse was soon discovered to be an impostor.
sentences.chinese: 那个护士很快被发现是个冒牌货。

name: stray
trans: v.偏离，迷路；a.迷了路的；零落的
漫无目的：lacking purpose；离群，迷途，偏离：move away, deviate

sentences.english: This will limit the number of stray dogs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这将会减少流浪狗在这一区域的数量。

sentences.english: As for her personal safety, she said she isn't overly worried but does think about what a stray lunatic could do.
sentences.chinese: 至于她个人的安全，她说她并没有过度担心，但是她的确在考虑一个流浪疯子可以做些什么。

sentences.english: Then let's say you get into horrible, disastrous debt and have to go begging to the government, like a sad little stray.
sentences.chinese: 另外，比如说，你陷入了讨厌的、损失惨重的债务，而且必须像一个可怜的小流浪儿一样向政府祈求。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that is lost or has no home

name: marginal
trans: a.书页空白处的；不重要的
边缘的：near a border；不重要的：not of central importance

sentences.english: marginal groups in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的非主流群体

sentences.english: marginal notes
sentences.chinese: 边注（旁注）

detailed_translations.english: not part of a main or important group or situation

name: tether
trans: v.用绳或链拴住(牲畜)；n.(拴牲畜的)绳或链；限度，范围
（用绳、铁链）拴系、束缚：fasten, restrain；能力或忍耐力的极限：limit

sentences.english: ...a dog that choked to death on its tether.
sentences.chinese: …一条被拴绳勒死的狗。

detailed_translations.english: a rope or chain that an animal is tied to so that it can only move around within a limited area
to tie an animal to a post so that it can only move around within a limited area

name: decipher
trans: 破译：interpret；对…有清晰的想法，理解，解读：clear idea

sentences.english: She studied the envelope, trying to decipher the handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解
detailed_translations.english: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand

sentences.english: Under his leadership, the U.N.'s repute has risen immeasurably.
sentences.chinese: 在他的领导下，联合国的名望得到了极大提升。

detailed_translations.english: reputation

name: discreet
trans: （言行）谨慎的：good judgment and restraint；不易察觉的：not readily seen or noticed

sentences.english: He assured her that he would be discreet.
sentences.chinese: 他向她保证会谨慎行事。

sentences.english: I stood back at a discreet distance.
sentences.chinese: 我谨慎地保持一段距离站在后面。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you say or do, so that you do not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell secrets

name: obstruct
trans: 妨碍，给…制造困难：impede, create difficulty；阻挡：prevent passage

sentences.english: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
sentences.chinese: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。

sentences.english: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
sentences.chinese: 柱子挡着，我们看不见舞台。

detailed_translations.english: to block a road, passage etc

name: pinpoint
trans: v.精确地找出或描述；a.非常精确的
非常精确的：extreme precision；精确定位或确认：identify with precision

sentences.english: New satellites will allow cars to pinpoint their position within an inch .
sentences.chinese: 新的卫星系统将让汽车精确他们的位置到每一英寸。

sentences.english: The feature could, for example, pinpoint areas being threatened by a quickly approaching tornado and alert residents of impending danger via their computers or cell phones.
sentences.chinese: 例如，精确地定位正遭受龙卷风攻击的区域并通过计算机和手机警告危险地区的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to find or show the exact position of something
a very small area or  dot  of something

name: exemplary
trans: 榜样的，值得效仿的：being a pattern, imitated；作为警告的：warning

sentences.english: a company with an exemplary record on environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 在处理环境问题方面可作为楷模的公司

detailed_translations.chinese: 可作楷模的， 典范的
detailed_translations.english: excellent and providing a good example for people to follow

name: spur
trans: 刺激物：arouses action；支撑物：holds up；刺激，激励：incite

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

sentences.english: Doreen had worked herself into a frenzy .
sentences.chinese: 多琳一阵狂怒。

detailed_translations.english: a state of great anxiety or excitement, in which you cannot control your behaviour

name: rampant
trans: （植物）生长茂盛的：growing thickly；猖獗的，不受限制的：occurring without restraint

sentences.english: Pickpocketing is rampant in the downtown area.
sentences.chinese: 闹市区扒窃活动猖獗。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["rampant inflation"]}
sentences.chinese: 失控的通货膨胀

detailed_translations.chinese: 猖獗的；蔓延的；狂暴的；奔放的
detailed_translations.english: if something bad, such as crime or disease, is rampant, there is a lot of it and it is very difficult to control

sentences.english: The change happens in a series of discrete steps.
sentences.chinese: 这个变化在一系列分离的步骤中发生。

detailed_translations.english: clearly separate

name: counterpart
trans: n.相对应或具有相同功能的人或物
（地位、功能）对等的人或物：same function or characteristics

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: repine
trans: 抱怨、表达不满：express discontent；渴望：long for

sentences.english: This is the common fate of mortal men, useless it is to repine .
sentences.chinese: 这是凡人的共同命运，抱怨也没有用。

detailed_translations.english: to be fretful or low-spirited through discontent

sentences.english: ...Lake Baringo, a freshwater haven for a mixed variety of birds.
sentences.chinese: …百瑞高湖，一个适合各种鸟类的淡水栖息地。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people or animals can live peacefully or go to in order to be safe

detailed_translations.chinese: 为……提供避难处；安置……于港中

name: coarse
trans: 粗糙的，表面不平整的：not smooth；（声音）刺耳的，粗声粗气的：rough in tone；粗俗的：lacking refinement；（质量）低劣的：inferior quality

sentences.english: a jacket of coarse wool
sentences.chinese: 粗羊毛夹克衫

detailed_translations.english: having a rough surface that feels slightly hard

name: psychology
trans: 心理学：science mental process and behavior；心理战术：subtle tactical action influence

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

name: dissolve
trans: 溶解融化：solution；解散：break into parts, disintegrate；驱散；（使）消失：cease visible；废除，撤销：end

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: intermittent
trans: 间歇的，断断续续的：not continuous；不定期的：lacking regularity

sentences.english: The weather forecast is for sun, with intermittent showers.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报为晴，有阵雨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 间歇的；断断续续的；间歇性
detailed_translations.english: stopping and starting often and for short periods

name: resourceful
trans: 有创造力的，机智的：act imaginatively

sentences.english: a woman who is energetic and resourceful
sentences.chinese: 精力充沛且足智多谋的女人

detailed_translations.english: good at finding ways of dealing with practical problems

name: timely
trans: 及时的，无拖延的：without delay；恰到好处的，合乎时宜的：appropriate

sentences.english: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏警察及时赶到，打斗总算停止。

detailed_translations.english: done or happening at exactly the right time

sentences.english: a perilous journey across the mountains
sentences.chinese: 穿越群山的危险旅程

detailed_translations.english: very dangerous

name: obsolete
trans: 过时的，被淘汰的：no longer useful

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

sentences.english: He was later indicted on corruption charges.
sentences.chinese: 他后来被控贪污。

detailed_translations.english: to officially charge someone with a criminal offence

sentences.english: Clark's mother is nonchalant about her role in her son's latest work.
sentences.chinese: 克拉克的母亲对她在儿子最新作品中的角色反应平淡。

sentences.english: Denis tried to look nonchalant and uninterested.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯尽力作出冷淡、不感兴趣的样子。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as nonchalant, you mean that they appear not to worry or care about things and that they seem very calm

name: vestige
trans: 微小的痕迹；小痕迹：smallest trace

sentences.english: We represent the last vestige of what made this nation great – hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我们代表了曾经使这个国家伟大的仅存的品质–勤奋。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that remains when most of it no longer exists

sentences.english: a large arms cache
sentences.chinese: 隐藏的大批武器

detailed_translations.chinese: 电脑高速缓冲存储器；贮存物；隐藏处
detailed_translations.english: a number of things that have been hidden, especially weapons, or the place where they have been hidden
to hide something in a secret place, especially weapons

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

sentences.english: a colossal statue of the King
sentences.chinese: 国王的巨大雕像

sentences.english: This whole holiday was a colossal waste of money.
sentences.chinese: 这次度假浪费了大量的钱财。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is extremely large

sentences.english: His regime was tarnished by human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 他的政权因践踏人权而形象受损。

detailed_translations.english: dullness of colour, or loss of brightness

detailed_translations.chinese: 玷污；使……失去光泽；使……变灰暗
detailed_translations.english: if an event or fact tarnishes someone’s  reputation  , record, image etc, it makes it worse

name: conjecture
trans: 揣测的结果：conclusion by surmise；猜测，估计（大小、数量等）：decide without actual measurement；（没有依据地）认为：form an opinion

sentences.english: What she said was pure conjecture .
sentences.chinese: 她所说的纯属猜测。

sentences.english: There has been some conjecture about a possible merger.
sentences.chinese: 有人猜测公司可能会合并。

detailed_translations.english: when you form ideas or opinions without having very much information to base them on
to form an idea or opinion without having much information to base it on

name: auspicious
trans: 好兆头的：toward a happy outcome

sentences.english: The new boy had an auspicious first day in the elementary school.
sentences.chinese: 这个新来的男孩在小学校里有幸运的第一天。

sentences.english: On the reverse the same inscription is repeated, besides a row of five Swastikas as auspicious symbols signifying security and good luck.
sentences.chinese: 倒转的同样碑刻是重复的，此外一排五个纳粹党所用的十字记号如幸运的符号表示安全和好运。

detailed_translations.english: showing that something is likely to be successful

name: assess
trans: 评估（重要性、尺寸、价值等）：determine; 征收费用（如罚款）：charge, penalty

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: intrigue
trans: 阴谋：a secret plan；激起…的兴趣：arouse curiosity

sentences.english: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
sentences.chinese: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

detailed_translations.english: to make secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power
if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋， 诡计， 密谋
detailed_translations.english: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind

name: reciprocate
trans: 往复运动：forward and backward；报答，回报：return

sentences.english: When he spoke I was expected to reciprocate with some remark of my own.
sentences.chinese: 他在说话时，我也应该说点什么回应他。

detailed_translations.english: to do or give something, because something similar has been done or given to you

sentences.english: an obedient child
sentences.chinese: 听话的孩子

sentences.english: citizens who are obedient to the law
sentences.chinese: 遵纪守法的公民

detailed_translations.english: always doing what you are told to do, or what the law, a rule etc says you must do

name: affix
trans: v.粘上，贴上；在合同上添写某事物；n.词缀

sentences.english: Will discuss concepts such as phoneme, morpheme , affix, rules and constraints.
sentences.chinese: 将被提及的概念包括音位、 语素、 词缀、 规则和限制。

sentences.english: After surveying all the structures with "de", we hold that there are three different "de" in modern Chinese, they are auxiliary verb, auxiliary word and affix.
sentences.chinese: 最后，综观现代汉语中与“得”有关的各种结构，本文认为现代汉语中有助动词、助词、词缀三个不同性质的轻声“得”。

detailed_translations.chinese: 黏上， 贴上； 添上
detailed_translations.english: to fasten or stick something to something else
a group of letters added to the beginning or end of a word to change its meaning or use, such as ‘un-’, ‘mis-’, ‘-ness’, or ‘-ly’

name: boon
trans: 恩惠，福利：benefit; 喜欢集体活动的：enjoy the company of others

sentences.english: It is for this reason that television proves such a boon to so many people.
sentences.chinese: 正是这个原因电视机成为这么多人的一大福音。

detailed_translations.english: You can describe something as a boon when it makes life better or easier for someone

name: content
trans: a.知足的，满意的；n.内容；满意
使满足：appease；主题：major subject of interest；内容，内涵：idea that is conveyed

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: green
trans: a.新鲜的，未成熟的，无经验的

sentences.english: beautiful green eyes
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的碧眼

sentences.english: Raw coffee beans are green in colour.
sentences.chinese: 生咖啡豆是绿色的。

sentences.english: a room decorated in pale blues and greens
sentences.chinese: 用浅蓝色和浅绿色装修的房间

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of grass or leaves
the colour of grass and leaves

name: waddle
trans: 摇摇摆摆地走:tilt the body from side to side

detailed_translations.chinese: 摇摇摆摆地走；蹒跚而行
detailed_translations.english: to walk with short steps, with your body moving from one side to another – used especially about people or birds with fat bodies and short legs

sentences.english: It is no surprise that she could saddle the horses.
sentences.chinese: 她能给马备鞍并没有什么值得惊讶的。

sentences.english: Thee bike's frame, wheels, handlebars and saddle are all made of cardboard in this way, and then fitted together.
sentences.chinese: 自行车的车架、车轮、车把和车座都用以此方式制造的纸板制成，然后组装在一起。

detailed_translations.english: a leather seat that you sit on when you ride a horse
to put a saddle on a horse

sentences.english: Cold weather retards the growth of many plants.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的天气使许多植物生长滞缓。

detailed_translations.english: to delay the development of something, or to make something happen more slowly than expected

name: smart
trans: 反应敏捷的，聪颖的：sharp quick thought；整洁的：strikingly neat；感到疼痛，感到痛苦：suffer acutely

sentences.english: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛被烟熏得发痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel a sharp stinging pain in a part of your body

name: bristle
trans: n.短而硬的毛发；v.(毛)竖起；发怒
怒不可遏，咆哮：anger; 供应充足，充满：copiously

sentences.english: His chin was covered with bristles.
sentences.chinese: 他满下巴都是胡茬。

detailed_translations.english: a short stiff hair, wire etc that forms part of a brush
to behave in a way that shows you are very angry or annoyed

sentences.english: He bumped into someone and mumbled an apology.
sentences.chinese: 他撞到一个人，咕哝着道了歉。

sentences.english: Stop mumbling!
sentences.chinese: 别嘟嘟囔囔的！

sentences.english: He could hear the low mumble of Navarro's voice.
sentences.chinese: 他能听到纳瓦罗的低声咕哝。

detailed_translations.english: to say something too quietly or not clearly enough, so that other people cannot understand you
Mumble is also a noun

name: gloomy
trans: a.阴暗的；没有希望的；阴郁的
黯淡无光的：without light；忧郁的：low spirits

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

sentences.english: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.english: fishing tackle
sentences.chinese: 渔具

detailed_translations.english: to try to deal with a difficult problem
the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

name: bait
trans: 逗弄，激怒：persecute, exasperate; 引诱：lead away; 诱饵：something, luring

sentences.english: We used worms as bait.
sentences.chinese: 我们用小虫子作诱饵。

sentences.english: The fish wouldn’t take the bait .
sentences.chinese: 鱼儿不上钩。

sentences.english: He baited his hook with pie.
sentences.chinese: 他把馅饼放在钓钩上作饵。

sentences.english: The boys dug pits and baited them so that they could spear their prey.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子们挖了陷阱，在里面放上诱饵，以便用矛刺杀猎物。

detailed_translations.english: food used to attract fish, animals, or birds so that you can catch them
If you bait a hook or trap, you put bait on it or in it

name: embroider
trans: （时常伴有夸张和想象内容地）详细说明：give elaborate account

sentences.english: a richly embroidered jacket
sentences.chinese: 刺绣华美的夹克衫

detailed_translations.english: to decorate cloth by sewing a pattern, picture, or words on it with coloured threads

sentences.english: a sly and treacherous woman
sentences.chinese: 一个阴险狡诈的女人

sentences.english: a treacherous plot to overthrow the leader
sentences.chinese: 一个推翻领导人的阴谋

detailed_translations.chinese: 奸诈的，叛逆的，背叛的；危险的；不牢靠的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is treacherous cannot be trusted because they are not loyal and secretly intend to harm you

sentences.english: She said it is important to remember that in villages, there will always be an increasing number of sentinel birds between vaccination campaigns as chicks are constantly hatching.
sentences.chinese: 她说，在农村，在接种疫苗的战役之间总是存在数量不断增长的"哨兵"禽类，因为小鸡会不断地孵化出来。 意识到这一点是很重要的。

sentences.english: Moreover, at the gateway of every reading lesson stood sentinel an array of words, with separated syllables, and forbidding accent marks like fixed bayonets, barring the way to the infant mind.
sentences.chinese: 在每一课文的入口，都排列着一队音节分开的生字的哨兵，禁止通行的重音符号就像一把把瞄准的刺刀，阻挡了小孩的心的进入通道。

detailed_translations.english: a sentry

name: abhor
trans: vt.深恶痛绝，极度厌恶：extreme repugnance

sentences.english: I abhor discrimination of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 我厌恶任何一种歧视。

detailed_translations.english: to hate a kind of behaviour or way of thinking, especially because you think it is morally wrong

sentences.english: Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.
sentences.chinese: 按揭借款违约在近一年里呈上升趋势。

sentences.english: to default on a loan/debt
sentences.chinese: 拖欠借款 / 债务

detailed_translations.english: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do

name: barren
trans: a.不育的；贫瘠的；不结果实的
不育的：incapable, producing; 不产生结果的，无效的：no results; 贫瘠的：deficient; 极度匮乏的：lacking

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.english: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

sentences.english: ‘Be prepared’ is the motto of the Boy Scouts.
sentences.chinese: “时刻准备着”是童子军的格言。

detailed_translations.english: a short sentence or phrase giving a rule on how to behave, which expresses the aims or beliefs of a person, school, or institution

name: conform
trans: 使协调：bring into harmony；调整（以适应）：change to make it suitable；遵照，遵从：obedient, compliant

sentences.english: The building does not conform with safety regulations.
sentences.chinese: 例句：这座建筑物不符合安全条例。

sentences.english: It did not conform to the usual stereotype of an industrial city.
sentences.chinese: 这和一座常规的工业城市那种千篇一律的格局不一样。

detailed_translations.english: to obey a law, rule etc

name: abject
trans: adj.无精打采的：spiritless；adj.（地位、身份）悲惨、凄凉的：low state;adj.卑微的，讨好的：humble

sentences.english: an abject apology
sentences.chinese: 低声下气的道歉

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑鄙的；可怜的；不幸的；（境况）凄惨的，绝望的

sentences.english: A wild game bird, such as a duck, goose, or quail .
sentences.chinese: 野禽，猎鸟一种野生的猎鸟，如野鸭、野鹅或鹌鹑。

sentences.english: The next horizon: GM pigs, ducks, turkeys and quail.
sentences.chinese: 下个目标：转基因猪、鸭子、火鸡和鹌鹑。

sentences.english: Objective: To establish hyperuricemia model of female quail, and to study its pathological feature.
sentences.chinese: 目的：建立雌性鹌鹑高尿酸血症模型并探讨其病理特征。

detailed_translations.english: a small fat bird with a short tail that is hunted for food or sport, or the meat from this bird

sentences.english: The power behind much of this automation is the regular expression, a veritable set of hieroglyphics to find, match, and decompose strings.
sentences.chinese: 实现这种自动化主要依靠正则表达式，它是用来查找、匹配和分解字符串的一组真正的象形文字。

sentences.english: Following drawn-out patent wars, Baekeland negotiated a merger with his rivals that put him at the helm of a veritable Bakelite empire.
sentences.chinese: 经过持久的专利战，贝克兰和他的对手签约合作，使他获得了一个真正的酚醛塑料大企业的领导权。

sentences.english: They expressed the hope that he would pursue a neutral and balanced policy for the sake of national concord.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望他能为国家的和谐而追求一种中立而平衡的政策。

detailed_translations.english: the state of having a friendly relationship, so that you agree on things and live in peace

sentences.english: To influence or lead by means of wiles; entice.
sentences.chinese: 引诱，诱骗通过使用诡计来影响或怂恿；诱使。

sentences.english: To entice all the people looking for a loo-break to stay a bit longer, locals bought the antebellum houses and turned them into restaurants and inns.
sentences.chinese: 为了诱使那些原本只想小憩一会的过客待的更久一些，当地人买下内战前的房子，改装成餐馆和旅店。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere, usually by offering them something that they want

name: grisly
trans: 令人反感的，令人恐惧的：repugnance

sentences.english: a series of grisly murders
sentences.chinese: 一连串恐怖的凶杀案

name: clumsy
trans: 笨拙的：lacking, nimbleness, lack, skill; 不文雅的：lacking, grace, inability, graceful; 不精致的：roughly

sentences.english: A clumsy waiter spilled wine all over her new skirt.
sentences.chinese: 一名笨手笨脚的服务员把葡萄酒洒得她新裙子上到处都是。

sentences.english: a clumsy attempt to catch the ball
sentences.chinese: 笨拙的接球动作

detailed_translations.english: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

sentences.english: Arms control should not be made into a surrogate for peace.
sentences.chinese: 军备控制不应变成和平的替代物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 代理；代用品；遗嘱检验法官
detailed_translations.english: a person or thing that takes the place of someone or something else

detailed_translations.chinese: 代理；指定某人为自己的代理人

detailed_translations.english: a surrogate person or thing is one that takes the place of someone or something else

name: covert
trans: 隐蔽的，秘密的：not shown；隐秘庇护所：avoid others

sentences.english: covert operations
sentences.chinese: 秘密行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛
detailed_translations.english: a group of thick bushes where animals can hide

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的
detailed_translations.english: secret or hidden

sentences.english: They followed the sinuous trail deep into the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着弯弯曲曲的小径进入深山。

detailed_translations.english: with many smooth twists and turns

sentences.english: The former investment banker has not been indolent: his department has been a factory for acronyms since the crisis began.
sentences.chinese: 这位前投资银行家并非懒惰，自危机开始以来，他的部门已成为加工厂的代称。

sentences.english: In a 1942 presentation at the New York Academy of Medicine, the scientists reported that after lobotomy, patients did sometimes become “indolent” or “outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 在1942年纽约医学专科学院的一个介绍会中，一些科学家提出，额叶切除术后，病人的确有时变得“懒惰”或“直言”。

detailed_translations.english: lazy

sentences.english: His voice sounded feeble and far away.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听上去既无力又遥远。

sentences.english: She was too feeble to leave her room.
sentences.chinese: 她身体虚弱，无法走出自己的房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚弱的， 衰弱的， 无力的； 无效的， 无益的
detailed_translations.english: extremely weak

name: slouch
trans: n.没精打采的样子；v.没精打采地坐(站、走)
懒人：lazy person；缓慢行走：move slowly

sentences.english: Try not to slouch when you are sitting down.
sentences.chinese: 你坐下时尽量不要无精打采。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下垂；笨拙的人，懒散的人；懒散的样子

detailed_translations.english: to stand, sit, or walk with a slouch

sentences.english: a rather earnest young man
sentences.chinese: 相当认真的一个年轻人

sentences.english: Matthews was in earnest conversation with a young girl.
sentences.chinese: 马修斯在和一个年轻姑娘认真地谈话。

sentences.english: an earnest desire to offer something useful to society
sentences.chinese: 为社会做贡献的真诚愿望

detailed_translations.english: very serious and sincere
if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

sentences.english: heartrending stories of children being taken from their parents
sentences.chinese: 关于孩子被人从父母身边夺走的悲伤故事

detailed_translations.english: making you feel great pity

sentences.english: unremitting poverty
sentences.chinese: 长期的贫困

detailed_translations.chinese: 不懈的；不间断的；坚忍的
detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time and not likely to stop

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

sentences.english: ‘Jerry?’ she called, trying to quell the panic inside her.
sentences.chinese: “杰里？”她叫道，试图减轻内心的惊慌。

detailed_translations.english: to end a situation in which people are behaving violently or protesting, especially by using force

name: understate
trans: v.掩饰地说，轻描淡写地说

sentences.english: The press have tended to understate the extent of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 媒体想淡化问题的严重程度。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少说，少报；保守地说；有意轻描淡写
detailed_translations.english: to describe something in a way that makes it seem less important or serious than it really is

sentences.english: Bessie, resplendent in royal blue velvet, was hovering beside the table.
sentences.chinese: 身穿华丽的深蓝色天鹅绒衣服的贝茜正在桌旁徘徊。

detailed_translations.english: very beautiful, bright, and impressive in appearance

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: venom
trans: 毒液：poisonous matter；恶意，恶毒的用心：desire to cause pain

sentences.english: There was real venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

sentences.english: a look of pure venom
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的表情

detailed_translations.english: great anger or hatred

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: pragmatic
trans: 实用主义的，务实的：practical approach

sentences.english: Williams took a more pragmatic approach to management problems.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实际的；实用主义的；国事的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of strictly following a set of ideas

name: collude
trans: 串通，共谋（做坏事）：together secretly, fraudulent, deceitful, conspire

sentences.english: Several local officials are in jail on charges of colluding with the Mafia.
sentences.chinese: 几位地方官员因涉嫌串通黑手党而锒铛入狱。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone secretly, especially in order to do something dishonest or illegal

name: domicile
trans: 住所，住宅：residence；为…提供住处：provide domicile

sentences.english: Military service entails frequent changes of domicile.
sentences.chinese: 服兵役需要频繁更换住所。

detailed_translations.chinese: 住宅；永久居住地；期票支付场所
detailed_translations.english: the place where someone lives

sentences.english: The recession has exacerbated this problem.
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退使这个问题更加严重。

sentences.english: I don’t want to exacerbate the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不想使情况变得更糟。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation worse

name: legion
trans: 大量的人，（尤指）军团：large body of men；大量的：numerous

sentences.english: ...the Sudan-based troops of the Libyan Islamic Legion.
sentences.chinese: …在苏丹驻扎的利比里亚伊斯兰教军团部队。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of soldiers, especially in ancient Rome
very many

name: hack
trans: 雇佣文人：writer commercial；乱砍；开辟：irregular blows；成功完成：skillfully or efficiently；忍受：put up with

sentences.english: One more hack and the branch was off.
sentences.chinese: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

detailed_translations.english: a taxi, or a taxi driver
to cut something roughly or violently

sentences.english: The flowers in Isabel's room had withered.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝尔房间里的花朵已经枯萎了。

detailed_translations.english: if plants wither, they become drier and smaller and start to die

name: transparent
trans: 透明的：capable of transmitting light；没有歧义的，清晰易懂的：not subject to misinterpretation

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

name: equity
trans: 不偏不倚，公平：lack of favoritism

sentences.english: a society run on the principles of equity and justice
sentences.chinese: 以公平、正义为原则的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平，公正；衡平法；普通股；抵押资产的净值
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage

sentences.english: the perpetual snows of the mountaintops
sentences.chinese: 山顶的终年积雪

detailed_translations.english: permanent

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: canon
trans: 准则，标准：standard, criterion; 真经，正典：authentic

sentences.english: the Shakespearean canon
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚真作集

detailed_translations.english: a list of books or pieces of music that are officially recognized as being the work of a certain writer

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: wry
trans: 扭曲的：twisted, bent；坚持错误的：stubborn to wrong

sentences.english: ‘Was it as bad as you expected?’ Travis gave a wry smile.
sentences.chinese: “那事和你想的一样糟吗？”特拉维斯苦笑着问道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歪斜的，扭歪的；歪曲的；用反语表达幽默的；揶揄的

name: daredevil
trans: 大胆鲁莽的（人）：foolishly；不考虑后果的：a lack of concern for the consequence

sentences.english: A new circus is in town, with Siberian white tigers and daredevil bikers.
sentences.chinese: 镇里来了一个新的马戏团，有西伯利亚白老虎和不怕死的自行车表演客。

detailed_translations.english: Daredevil people enjoy doing physically dangerous things

detailed_translations.chinese: 胆大的人， 冒失的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who likes doing dangerous things

name: royalty
trans: 皇家身份：regal character；版税；专利权税：payment

sentences.english: At school the other children treated them like royalty .
sentences.chinese: 在学校里，其他孩子将他们奉若王族。

detailed_translations.english: members of a royal family

name: august
trans: 威严的，严重的：formal and serious or reserved manner；盛大的，令人印象深刻的：large and impressive

sentences.english: an august institution
sentences.chinese: 庄严的机构

detailed_translations.english: impressive and respected

name: hardy
trans: 顽强的：able to withstand；愿意冒风险的：willing to take risks

sentences.english: hardy mountain goats
sentences.chinese: 能适应恶劣环境的石山羊

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；勇敢的；能吃苦耐劳的；鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮的人；耐寒植物；方柄凿
detailed_translations.english: any blacksmith's tool made with a square shank so that it can be lodged in a square hole in an anvil

name: mire
trans: 困境：difficult situation；使陷入困境，拖后腿：hold back

sentences.english: The wheels got stuck in the mire.
sentences.chinese: 轮子陷入泥潭里了。

detailed_translations.english: deep mud

name: buck
trans: 阻止，反对：refuse assent; 转移，交接：shift possession

sentences.english: He was a rebel who bucked the system (=  opposed rules or authority  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他是一个反抗体制的叛逆者。

sentences.english: He owes me ten bucks.
sentences.chinese: 他欠我十美元。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose something in a direct way
a US, Canadian, or Australian dollar

name: drab
trans: 单调的，无聊的：dullness and monotony

sentences.english: people forced to live grey, drab existences in ugly towns
sentences.chinese: 被迫在丑陋的城市里过着平淡乏味生活的人

detailed_translations.english: boring

detailed_translations.chinese: 浅褐色；无生气；邋遢；小额
detailed_translations.english: a light olive-brown colour

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

sentences.english: I couldn’t believe the arrogance of the man!
sentences.chinese: 我真不敢相信那个男人那么傲慢！

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves in a rude way because they think they are very important

name: conserve
trans: 保存，避免浪费：keep avoid wasteful

sentences.english: We must conserve our woodlands for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须为子孙后代保护林地。

sentences.english: efforts to conserve fish stocks
sentences.chinese: 保护鱼类资源的努力

detailed_translations.english: to protect something and prevent it from changing or being damaged

sentences.english: a tacit agreement between the three big companies
sentences.chinese: 三家大公司之间的默契

detailed_translations.chinese: 缄默的；不言而喻的；心照不宣的；默许的
detailed_translations.english: tacit agreement, approval, support etc is given without anything actually being said

name: ruffle
trans: v.弄皱；激怒；n.皱边(装饰衣服)
皱褶，褶裥花边：strip edge；使粗糙：destroy smoothness；扰乱，打扰：disturb

sentences.english: He ruffled her hair affectionately.
sentences.chinese: 他亲昵地拨弄她的头发。

sentences.english: A light wind ruffled the water.
sentences.chinese: 一阵轻风吹皱了水面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄皱；触怒；扰乱；迅速翻动
detailed_translations.english: to make a smooth surface uneven

detailed_translations.chinese: 皱褶；生气；混乱；连续轻敲声

name: circumvent
trans: v.回避；用计谋战胜或规避

sentences.english: The company opened an account abroad, in order to circumvent the tax laws.
sentences.chinese: 为规避税法，这家公司在国外开设了账户。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid a problem or rule that restricts you, especially in a clever or dishonest way – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Light silk is best for parachutes, as it compresses well and then expands rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.english: Isobel nodded, her lips compressed.
sentences.chinese: 伊索贝尔紧闭着双唇点了点头。

sentences.english: The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
sentences.chinese: 矿工使用钻岩机和压缩空气来凿穿坚硬的岩石。

detailed_translations.english: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someone’s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful

name: blatant
trans: a.厚颜无耻的；显眼的；炫耀的
大声喧哗的：noisy; （让人生厌地）惹人注目的：noticeable

sentences.english: blatant discrimination
sentences.chinese: 公然的歧视

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧嚣的；公然的；炫耀的；俗丽的
detailed_translations.english: something bad that is blatant is very clear and easy to see, but the person responsible for it does not seem embarrassed or ashamed

sentences.english: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

detailed_translations.english: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information

name: distraught
trans: 精神狂乱的，极疯狂的：agitated, insane

sentences.english: Relatives are tonight comforting the distraught parents.
sentences.chinese: 亲戚们今晚都在安慰这对忧心如焚的父母。

detailed_translations.english: so upset and worried that you cannot think clearly

name: hidebound
trans: 死板的，极度保守的：tending to favor

sentences.english: hidebound reactionaries
sentences.chinese: 古板的反动分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 死板的；保守的；顽固的；墨守成规的
detailed_translations.english: having old-fashioned attitudes and ideas – used to show disapproval

name: sabotage
trans: 妨害，破坏：hinder a cause；从事破坏活动，阻止：practice sabotage

sentences.english: Every single plane had been sabotaged.
sentences.chinese: 每架飞机都遭到了破坏。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly damage or destroy equipment, vehicles etc that belong to an enemy or opponent, so that they cannot be used
deliberate damage that is done to equipment, vehicles etc in order to prevent an enemy or opponent from using them

name: squalid
trans: 污秽的，肮脏的：dirty；道德败坏的：repulsive

sentences.english: How can anyone live in such squalid conditions?
sentences.chinese: 一个人怎么能住在这样肮脏的环境中？

sentences.english: a tiny squalid apartment
sentences.chinese: 一套又小又脏的公寓

detailed_translations.english: very dirty and unpleasant because of a lack of care or money

sentences.english: A spirit of hopelessness pervaded the country.
sentences.chinese: 一种无望的情绪笼罩着该国。

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, idea, or smell pervades a place, it is present in every part of it

sentences.english: Opponents of nuclear energy have deep misgivings about its safety.
sentences.chinese: 反核能人士非常担心核能的安全性。

sentences.english: She eyed the distant shoreline with misgiving.
sentences.chinese: 她担忧地望着远方的海岸线。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of doubt or fear about what might happen or about whether something is right

detailed_translations.chinese: 担忧；使…疑虑；害怕（misgive的ing形式）

sentences.english: After a few weeks in Marseille, I grew restless and decided to move on.
sentences.chinese: 在马赛住了几星期后，我开始待不住了，决定换个地方。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to keep still or stay where you are, especially because you are nervous or bored

sentences.english: a modern building with no superfluous decoration
sentences.chinese: 一栋没有多余装饰的现代建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 多余的；不必要的；奢侈的
detailed_translations.english: more than is needed or wanted

sentences.english: The firm has amalgamated with another company.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司已经与另一家公司合并了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合并；汞齐化；调制汞合金
detailed_translations.english: if two organizations amalgamate, or if one amalgamates with another, they join and make one big organization

name: conscientious
trans: 仔细的，一丝不苟的：involving great care；有良心的，正直的：governed by conscience

sentences.english: A conscientious teacher may feel inclined to take work home.
sentences.chinese: 一个认真负责的教师可能会想着把工作带回家去做。

sentences.english: a conscientious and hard-working student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉刻苦的学生

detailed_translations.english: careful to do everything that it is your job or duty to do

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: fastidious
trans: 挑剔的，极仔细的，追求完美的：meticulous attention to detail

sentences.english: people who are fastidious about personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 十分讲究个人卫生的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑剔的；苛求的，难取悦的；（微生物等）需要复杂营养地
detailed_translations.english: very careful about small details in your appearance, work etc

name: frail
trans: 虚弱的：weak；（意志）薄弱的：weak；（希望）渺茫的：slight

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["frail elderly people"]}
sentences.chinese: 年老体衰者

sentences.english: her frail health
sentences.chinese: 她虚弱的身体

detailed_translations.english: someone who is frail is weak and thin because they are old or ill

name: cameo
trans: n.浮雕宝石；生动刻画；(演员)出演
栩栩如生的描绘，简洁生动的描述或刻画：brief, vivid portrayal; 客串：brief but dramatic appearance

sentences.english: a cameo brooch
sentences.chinese: 浮雕宝石胸针

detailed_translations.chinese: （影视剧中的）配角；刻有浮雕的宝石或贝壳；小品文
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of jewellery with a raised shape, usually a person’s face, on a flat background of a different colour

name: sap
trans: 削弱：weaken energy vitality；健康，活力：active strength

sentences.english: The leaves, bark and sap are also common ingredients of local herbal remedies.
sentences.chinese: 树叶、树皮和树液也是当地草药疗法的常用药材。

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 树液；精力，元气；活力；坑道
detailed_translations.english: the watery substance that carries food through a plant

detailed_translations.chinese: 使衰竭，使伤元气；挖掘以破坏基础

name: discord
trans: 意见不一致，不和谐：lack agreement, harmony

sentences.english: marital discord
sentences.chinese: 婚姻不和

sentences.english: discord within NATO
sentences.chinese: 北约内部的纷争

detailed_translations.english: disagreement or arguing between people

name: repudiate
trans: 否认：declare not to be true；拒绝接受：unwillingness to accept

sentences.english: He repudiated all offers of friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝任何人给他的友谊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept or continue with something

name: wag
trans: v.(狗尾巴等)摆动；n.诙谐幽默者
诙谐幽默的人：humorous；摆动：move to and fro or up and down

sentences.english: ‘You naughty girl!’ Mom said, wagging her finger at me.
sentences.chinese: “你这个调皮的丫头！”妈妈对我摇了摇手指说道。

detailed_translations.english: if a dog wags its tail, or if its tail wags, the dog moves its tail many times from one side to the other
someone who says or does something clever and amusing

sentences.english: The rumours will do untold damage to his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这些谣言会给他的名声造成无法估计的损害。

name: taut
trans: 紧绷的：not loose；整洁的：proper order, trim shape

sentences.english: The rope was stretched taut.
sentences.chinese: 绳子绷紧了。

detailed_translations.english: stretched tight

sentences.english: My enthusiasm for the project was waning.
sentences.chinese: 我对这个项目的热情逐渐减退了。

sentences.english: The group’s influence had begun to wane by this time.
sentences.chinese: 此时，这个团体的影响力已经开始减弱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰落；变小；亏缺；退潮；消逝
detailed_translations.english: if something such as power, influence, or a feeling wanes, it becomes gradually less strong or less important

sentences.english: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架，警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

name: formidable
trans: 令人害怕的：causing fear；艰难的：requiring effort

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

name: spleen
trans: 怒气，怨恨：anger or ill will

sentences.english: Obviously you’re annoyed, but that doesn’t give you the right to vent your spleen on me (= get angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 很显然你心里不痛快，但你也不该把怒气发泄在我身上呀。

detailed_translations.english: an organ near your stomach that controls the quality of your blood

sentences.english: a sumptuous feast
sentences.chinese: 盛宴

sentences.english: a sumptuous palace
sentences.chinese: 一座富丽堂皇的宫殿

detailed_translations.english: very impressive and expensive

name: manipulate
trans: 巧妙操作：skillful；巧妙处理，暗中操控：deviously

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: plush
trans: （味道等）浓郁的：abundance quality；奢华的，豪华的：notably luxurious

sentences.english: a plush hotel
sentences.chinese: 一家豪华酒店

sentences.english: Their casino is the plushest in town.
sentences.chinese: 他们的赌场是城里最豪华的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 豪华的；长毛绒做的；舒服的
detailed_translations.english: very comfortable, expensive, and of good quality
a silk or cotton material with a thick soft surface

name: caricature
trans: 用讽刺歪曲等手法的夸张，漫画，讽刺画：exaggeration; 嘲笑性模仿或夸张：copy, exaggerate

sentences.english: The poster showed a caricature of Hitler with a devil's horns and tail.
sentences.chinese: 这张招贴漫画里的希特勒长着魔鬼一样的犄角和尾巴。

detailed_translations.english: a funny drawing of someone that makes them look silly
to draw or describe someone or something in a way that makes them seem silly

name: incarnate
trans: 化身的，人性化的：bodily nature and form；使（思想、理论）具体，体现：constitute an embodiment

sentences.english: Jesus, the incarnate Son of God
sentences.chinese: 耶稣，上帝之子的化身

sentences.english: The media cast him as the devil incarnate (= someone very evil ).
sentences.chinese: 媒体把他描述成魔鬼的化身。

sentences.english: The iniquities of the regime are incarnated in one man.
sentences.chinese: 该体制的种种劣迹集中体现于一人。

sentences.english: ...a writer who incarnates the changing consciousness of the Americas.
sentences.chinese: ...典型地体现出美洲观念变化的一位作家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 化身的；人体化的；肉色的
detailed_translations.english: having taken human form

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现；使…具体化；使实体化
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a quality is incarnated in a person, you mean that they represent that quality or are typical of it in an extreme form

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

sentences.english: Keep a wary eye on the weather before you set sail.
sentences.chinese: 出航前要密切注意天气。

sentences.english: She had a wary expression on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上带着小心谨慎的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谨慎的；机警的；惟恐的；考虑周到的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is wary is careful because they think something might be dangerous or harmful

name: smother
trans: 使窒息：killed by lack of air；抑制（表达，说出），压制：refrain

sentences.english: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
sentences.chinese: 一个少女妈妈被指控闷死自己三个月大的女儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使窒息；抑制；（用灰等）闷熄；忍住
detailed_translations.english: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing

detailed_translations.chinese: 窒息状态；令人窒息的浓烟

name: quixotic
trans: 不切实际的，空想的：more by ideals than by reality

sentences.english: This is a vast, exciting, and perhaps quixotic project.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个庞大、令人兴奋的项目，但可能有点不切实际。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唐吉诃德式的；狂想家的；愚侠的
detailed_translations.english: quixotic ideas or plans are not practical and are based on unreasonable hopes of improving the world

sentences.english: It may be tempting for some to decry incentives as nothing but a poisonous fruit of Con-Lib responsibility thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对一些人谴责激励机制只是作为“新政治”责任思考的毒果这样的结论本身是很冒险的。

sentences.english: I know ‘tis the season to decry all things materialistic, but just as we’re inspired by people we are also inspired by things.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是谴责所有事情物质化的时候了，然而正如我们被人所激励一样，我们也受事物的激励。

sentences.english: All of that is grist for the mill for the Russian media, which is popular in the east of the country and uses every opportunity to decry "fascism" in Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都像谷物被放进研磨机中一样，被俄国媒体粉碎，后者在这个国家的东部地区广受欢迎，并利用一切机会谴责乌克兰国内的“法西斯主义”。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that you do not approve of something

name: lance
trans: 长矛，标枪：long straight handle and sharp head or blade；刺穿，刺破：penetrate

sentences.english: ...the clang of lances striking armour.
sentences.chinese: …长矛撞击盔甲的铿锵声。

sentences.english: It is a painful experience having the boil lanced.
sentences.chinese: 将疖子切开是个痛苦的经历。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin pointed weapon that was used in the past by soldiers riding on horses

detailed_translations.chinese: 以长矛攻击；用柳叶刀割开；冲进
detailed_translations.english: If a boil on someone's body is lanced, a small cut is made in it so that the liquid inside comes out

name: overshadow
trans: 使变黯淡：make dark, dim；（在重要性上）超越，超过：exceed in importance

sentences.english: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.chinese: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩
detailed_translations.english: If you are overshadowed by a person or thing, you are less successful, important, or impressive than they are

name: harsh
trans: 粗糙的，不具有美感的：coarse rough disagreeable sense；严厉的：exacting

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

sentences.english: He is removing weeds with a harrow in the rice field.
sentences.chinese: 他正在用耥耙给稻田除去杂草。

sentences.english: Spray-fusing of parts resistance to strong grain-wear and free machining, such as harrow teeth of dredger.
sentences.chinese: 抗强烈磨粒磨损，无需加工场合的喷焊，如挖泥船耙齿。

sentences.english: Combining the working principle of plough and harrow in agriculture that can realize to mix and comminute all kinds of material.
sentences.chinese: 将农业用的犁耙工作原理结合到一起，可同时实现对多种物料的搅拌和粉碎。草耙，灰耙，钉齿耙。

detailed_translations.english: to draw a harrow over (land)
a farming machine with sharp metal blades, used to break up the earth before planting crops

sentences.english: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto (= not accept his refusal ).
sentences.chinese: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

name: inkling
trans: n.暗示，迹象；略知，模糊概念
轻微暗示，小提示：slight indication；略知：vague notion

sentences.english: I had an inkling that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我隐约知道她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: a slight idea about something

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗示 （inkle的ing形式）；略知；低声说出

sentences.english: The rain was hammering against the window.
sentences.chinese: 雨点不停地敲打着窗户。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something many times, especially making a loud noise
a tool with a heavy metal part on a long handle, used for hitting nails into wood
to hit something with a hammer in order to force it into a particular position or shape

name: dreary
trans: 单调乏味的：nothing cheer；令人不悦的：causing unhappiness

sentences.english: the same dreary routine
sentences.chinese: 一成不变的、乏味的日常事务

sentences.english: a dreary winter’s day
sentences.chinese: 沉闷的冬日

detailed_translations.english: dull and making you feel sad or bored

name: substantive
trans: 本质的，关键的：relating to the essence

sentences.english: They plan to meet again in Rome very soon to begin substantive negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 他们计划很快在罗马再次会面以开始实质性的谈判。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有实质的；大量的；真实的；独立存在的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with things that are important or real

detailed_translations.chinese: 名词性实词；独立存在的实体
detailed_translations.english: a noun

sentences.english: Beneath that aloof exterior, Gayle is a warm, sympathetic person.
sentences.chinese: 在冷漠的外表下，盖尔是个有同情心的热心人。

detailed_translations.english: unfriendly and deliberately not talking to other people

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

sentences.english: Diplomatic efforts to end the fighting began on October 25.
sentences.chinese: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the work of diplomats

name: doldrums
trans: 低迷，中断：inactivity；情绪不佳：low spirits

sentences.english: Fay is in the doldrums today.
sentences.chinese: 今天费伊情绪低落。

detailed_translations.english: if you are in the doldrums, you are feeling sad

name: solvent
trans: 有偿付能力的：able to pay debts；溶剂：another substance is dissolved

sentences.english: They're going to have to show that the company is now solvent.
sentences.chinese: 他们将不得不证明公司现在是具备偿债能力的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有偿付能力的；有溶解力的
detailed_translations.english: having enough money to pay your debts
a chemical that is used to  dissolve  another substance

name: pedestrian
trans: a.徒步的；缺乏想像的；n.行人
行人：traveling on foot；平庸无奇的，令人厌倦的：causing weariness

sentences.english: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

name: jargon
trans: 行业术语：specialized or technical language

sentences.english: Keep it simple and avoid the use of jargon.
sentences.chinese: 简单点，避免使用术语。

detailed_translations.english: words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval

sentences.english: an irascible old man
sentences.chinese: 一位脾气暴躁的老人

detailed_translations.english: easily becoming angry

name: vulgar
trans: 粗俗的，无教养的：crude；口头的，非正式的：suitable for speech

sentences.english: vulgar behaviour
sentences.chinese: 粗俗的行为

detailed_translations.english: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way

name: diverge
trans: 改变方向：change；（使）分叉，散开：different directions central；分歧：different, differ；离题：depart from

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

name: glaze
trans: 给…上釉，妆点：coat glaze；使平滑：glossy surface

sentences.english: Sometimes his eyes would glaze over for a second or two.
sentences.chinese: 有时候他会两眼发直地愣一两秒钟。

detailed_translations.english: if your eyes glaze over, they show no expression, usually because you are very bored or tired
to cover plates, cups etc made of clay with a thin liquid that gives them a shiny surface
a liquid that is used to cover plates, cups etc made of clay to give them a shiny surface

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
sentences.chinese: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

sentences.english: At the time, Arnold had disapproved of such levity.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，阿诺德不赞成如此的轻浮行为。

detailed_translations.english: lack of respect or seriousness when you are dealing with something serious

name: usurp
trans: 篡夺，篡位：seize power without legal authority

sentences.english: There were a couple of attempts to usurp the young king.
sentences.chinese: 屡次有人企图篡夺那位年轻国王的王位。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone else’s power, position, job etc when you do not have the right to

name: wit
trans: 机智，智慧：ability to understand；智者，有智慧的人：intelligence

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

sentences.english: He led them away from a marsh.
sentences.chinese: 他把他们带离沼泽。

sentences.english: My urine and excrement are recycled by a system of ducts, pipes, wires, plants, and marsh-microbes, and redeemed into water and food which I can eat.
sentences.chinese: 由众多的导管、管线、植物和沼泽微生物构成的系统回收了我的尿液和粪便，并将其还原成水和食物供我食用。

detailed_translations.english: an area of low flat ground that is always wet and soft

detailed_translations.chinese: 沼泽的；生长在沼泽地的

sentences.english: Tarr threw himself in front of a train in a valiant effort to save the child.
sentences.chinese: 塔尔勇敢地冲到火车前去救那个小孩。

detailed_translations.english: very brave, especially in a difficult situation

name: snarl
trans: 纠缠，纠结：twist；咆哮，怒吼：to anger

sentences.english: ‘Shut up,’ he snarled.
sentences.chinese: “住口。”他怒吼道。

detailed_translations.english: a vicious growl, utterance, or facial expression
if an animal snarls, it makes a low angry sound and shows its teeth

name: grin
trans: 咧嘴笑，咧嘴笑着表示：express an emotion

sentences.english: He grins, delighted at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 想起往事，他咧嘴笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to smile widely
a wide smile

name: frivolous
trans: 轻浮的：unbecoming levity；不重要的：little importance

sentences.english: I just decided I was a bit too frivolous to be a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我只是认定自己有点儿太轻率，不适合当医生。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as frivolous, you mean they behave in a silly or light-hearted way, rather than being serious and sensible

sentences.english: He took up the cause with evangelical fervor .
sentences.chinese: 他以传道者般的热情投身于这一事业。

sentences.english: The cathedral at Chartres is an expression of the religious fervor of the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在查特雷斯的大教堂是中世纪时期宗教热情的表现之一。

sentences.english: As social conflicts continue tosharpen, the party needs to divert attention, and of course a parade is a goodway to do that by whipping up nationalist fervor.
sentences.chinese: 随着社会冲突继续深化，中共需要转移人们的注意力，而阅兵就是实现这一点的好办法，可以激起人们的民族主义热情。

name: credit
trans: n.赊购；信任；(电影)片头字幕
信任，信赖：mental conviction of the truth；表扬，赞扬：acknowledgment or admiration

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

sentences.english: the black fetid water of the lake
sentences.chinese: 又黑又臭的湖水

sentences.english: the dog’s fetid breath
sentences.chinese: 那条狗呼出的臭气

detailed_translations.english: having a strong bad smell

sentences.english: nautical equipment
sentences.chinese: 航海装备

detailed_translations.english: relating to ships, boats, or sailing

sentences.english: The animal seizes its prey by the throat and suffocates it to death.
sentences.chinese: 这种动物会抓住猎物的喉咙，使其窒息而死。

sentences.english: One of the puppies suffocated inside the plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 其中一只小狗在塑料袋里闷死了。

detailed_translations.english: to die or make someone die by preventing them from breathing

sentences.english: the solitude of her house on the lake
sentences.chinese: 她湖边那所房子的清静

detailed_translations.english: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

sentences.english: She had seen herself repeatedly maligned in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 她看到自己在报纸上一再受到诽谤。

sentences.english: a much maligned politician
sentences.chinese: 一个备受中伤的政治家

detailed_translations.english: to say unpleasant things about someone that are untrue
harmful

sentences.english: As he stood on the winner's rostrum, he sang the words of the national anthem.
sentences.chinese: 当他站在领奖台上，他唱起了国歌中的词句。

detailed_translations.english: a small  platform  that you stand on when you are making a speech or  conduct ing  musicians

sentences.english: Meanwhile the conductor lifted his violin bow and the orchestra attacked the overture .
sentences.chinese: 这时，乐队指挥把小提琴的弓子一举，乐队就奏起序曲来。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of music written as an introduction to a long piece of music, especially an opera

sentences.english: A gust of wind drove down the valley.
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风掠过山谷。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind, air, rain etc
if the wind gusts, it blows strongly with sudden short movements

sentences.english: affluent families
sentences.chinese: 富裕的家庭

sentences.english: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 富人的饮食数十年来没怎么变。

detailed_translations.english: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
The affluent are people who are affluent

name: heresy
trans: 异教，和普遍观点相悖的说话：controversial or unorthodox opinion

sentences.english: He was executed for heresy.
sentences.chinese: 他因信奉异教而被处死。

detailed_translations.english: a belief that disagrees with the official principles of a particular religion

name: exuberant
trans: a.(人)充满活力的(植物)茂盛的
非常高兴的，热情洋溢的：joyously, unrestrained；大量的，充分的：abundance

sentences.english: exube-rant carvings
sentences.chinese: 充满生气的雕刻品

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁茂的；生气勃勃的，充溢的
detailed_translations.english: exuberant decorations, patterns etc are exciting and complicated or colourful

sentences.english: The issues have proved to be less tractable than expected.
sentences.chinese: 结果这些问题比预想的要难以处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易于管教的；易驾驭的；易处理的；驯良的
detailed_translations.english: easy to control or deal with

sentences.english: There was no respite from the suffocating heat.
sentences.chinese: 闷热的天气根本没有缓解。

sentences.english: SHADE, from the upper cantilevering storey, brings respite and is welcoming in this tropical region.
sentences.chinese: 阴影来自于上层的悬挑部分，在热带地区为小屋带来暂时的休息和欢迎。

sentences.english: It was quite different from the verdant surroundings that we were used to in Slovenia, and respite only came from stopping at the small towns and villages that we came across along the Adriatic coast.
sentences.chinese: 这和我们走过的斯洛文尼亚郁郁葱葱的环境很不一样，只有在走过亚得里亚海长长的海岸线上那些小镇和村庄时，我们才能得到暂时的休息。

name: faction
trans: 派系：a party that is often contentious

sentences.english: struggles between the different factions within the party
sentences.chinese: 党内的派系斗争

sentences.english: the leaders of the warring factions
sentences.chinese: 交战各派的领导人

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people within a larger group, who have different ideas from the other members, and who try to get their own ideas accepted

sentences.english: ‘Is that your best outfit?’ he sneered.
sentences.chinese: “那就是你最好的衣服了？”他讥笑道。

sentences.english: ‘You probably wouldn’t understand,’ he said with a sneer.
sentences.chinese: “你可能明白不了。”他冷笑了一声说道。

detailed_translations.english: to smile or speak in a very unkind way that shows you have no respect for someone or something
an unkind smile or remark that shows you have no respect for something or someone

sentences.english: aberrant behaviour
sentences.chinese: 异常行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 异常的；畸变的；脱离常轨的；迷乱的
detailed_translations.english: not usual or normal

sentences.english: Today you may rejoice because of contacts, news or visits from friends who live in another city or country.
sentences.chinese: 今天您可能因为得到来自另一个城市或国家的朋友的联系、消息或拜访而感到高兴。

sentences.english: Why is it that we rejoice at a birth and grieve at a funeral? Is it because we are not the person concerned?
sentences.chinese: 我们为何在（人家）出生之时高兴而在殡殓之时又悲伤呢？是否因为我们不属于关人士才这样的？

sentences.english: Derek’s terse reply ended the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 德里克的简短回答结束了谈话。

name: coy
trans: 故作羞涩的：flirtatiously shy or modest；不愿与人交往的，内向的：tending to avoid people

sentences.english: She gave him a coy smile.
sentences.chinese: 她对他含羞一笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 腼腆的；忸怩作态的；怕羞的
detailed_translations.english: shy or pretending to be shy in order to attract people’s interest

name: carp
trans: 对小事吹毛求疵，挑剔，表现不满：peevish criticism, objections, express dissatisfaction, tiresomely

sentences.english: He cannot understand why she's constantly carping at him.
sentences.chinese: 他不理解为什么她对他总是百般的挑剔。

detailed_translations.english: to keep complaining about something in a way that is annoying
a large fish that lives in lakes and rivers and can be eaten

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

name: lull
trans: 相对平静时期，间隙：momentary halt；使镇静，使安心：free from distress

sentences.english: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.chinese: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement

sentences.english: ...a major intellectual figure with disciples throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: …一位信徒遍布欧洲的重要知识分子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in the ideas of a great teacher or leader, especially a religious one

name: wretched
trans: 极差的：poor in quality；沮丧的：dejected

sentences.english: the poor, wretched girl
sentences.chinese: 极其不幸的可怜姑娘

detailed_translations.english: someone who is wretched is very unhappy or ill, and you feel sorry for them

name: offhand
trans: adv./a.事先无准备地(的)；随便地(的)
即兴的，没有准备的：without preparation

sentences.english: She said you were a bit offhand with her this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 她说你今天下午对她有点敷衍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 随便的；即时的；无准备的；即席的

sentences.english: The apples were ripening on the trees.
sentences.chinese: 树上的苹果都熟了。

detailed_translations.english: to become ripe or to make something ripe

name: mischievous
trans: 调皮的，淘气的：naughty teasing；有害的：causing harm

sentences.english: Their sons are noisy and mischievous.
sentences.chinese: 他们的几个儿子又吵又淘气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 淘气的；（人、行为等）恶作剧的；有害的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is mischievous likes to have fun, especially by playing tricks on people or doing things to annoy or embarrass them

sentences.english: The only reason of the attack - he’s a mongrel.
sentences.chinese: 那次攻击的唯一原因是——他是个混血儿。

sentences.english: Instead, a rusty trawler lies on its side on the forecourt, which the workmen eye as though a mongrel dog.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是一条锈迹斑斑的拖网渔船，活像只一条腿歪在地上的杂种狗。

detailed_translations.english: a dog that is a mix of several different breeds

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

sentences.english: We all like the tranquility of the country life.
sentences.chinese: 我们都喜欢乡村生活的宁静。

sentences.english: For this brings not only the tranquility which comes from doing well, but also that which comes from doing few things.
sentences.chinese: 因为这不仅带来由于做事适当而产生的宁静，而且带来由于做很少的事而产生的宁静。

sentences.english: And while I love my family to death, this time of tranquility is one of absolute bliss for me.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我对我的家庭爱得要死，但这片刻的宁静绝对是我的幸福之一。

name: repeal
trans: 撤销，废除（法律等）：rescind or annul；宣布与…决裂：refuse to recognize

sentences.english: The government has just repealed the law segregating public facilities.
sentences.chinese: 政府刚刚废除了隔离公共设施的法令。

sentences.english: Next year will be the 60th anniversary of the repeal of Prohibition.
sentences.chinese: 明年将是禁酒令废止的60周年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 废除；撤销；废止；放弃；否定
detailed_translations.english: if a government repeals a law, it officially ends that law
Repeal is also a noun

name: dubious
trans: 充满不定性的，值得怀疑的：uncertainty, questionable；（对事实等）持怀疑态度的：not feeling sure；迟疑不决的，不愿行动的：slow to begin because of doubts

sentences.english: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.chinese: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.english: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.chinese: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.english: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.chinese: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的， 犹豫不决的， 无把握的； 有问题的； 靠不住的
detailed_translations.english: probably not honest, true, right etc

sentences.english: I was under the delusion that he intended to marry me.
sentences.chinese: 我有一种错觉，他要娶我。

detailed_translations.english: a false belief about yourself or the situation you are in

sentences.english: People were indoctrinated not to question their leaders.
sentences.chinese: 人们被灌输对领导人不得置疑的观念。

detailed_translations.english: to train someone to accept a particular set of beliefs, especially political or religious ones, and not consider any others

sentences.english: Todd flew over the city in a hot-air balloon as a publicity stunt .
sentences.chinese: 作为一种宣传噱头，托德乘坐热气球飞越城市上空。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to attract people’s attention, especially in advertising or politics

detailed_translations.chinese: 阻碍…的正常生长或发展
detailed_translations.english: to stop something or someone from growing to their full size or developing properly

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: consummate
trans: 专业的，有造诣的：extremely skilled；无纰漏的，完美的：perfect；最高档次的，最大规模的：highest degree

sentences.english: Factory with consummate skill, good reputation, good service, won the praise and trust of our customers, business across the country.
sentences.chinese: 本厂以精湛的技艺、良好的信誉、周到的服务，深得广大客户的好评和信赖，业务遍布全国各地。 %。

sentences.english: Combining with its practice, this article draws lessons from the experiences of Japanese examinational committee, and brings out some suggestions to consummate the system.
sentences.chinese: 本文结合人民监督员制度运行的实践，借鉴日本检察审查会制度的经验，就完善人民监督员制度提出构想。

detailed_translations.english: to make something complete, especially an agreement

name: absolve
trans: 使无罪，解除责任：free from, guilt, exculpate

sentences.english: A police investigation yesterday absolved the police of all blame in the incident.
sentences.chinese: 警方昨天的调查为其开脱了在这件事故中所有的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to say publicly that someone is not guilty or responsible for something

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

sentences.english: Cardinal Murphy will deliver the sermon on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 墨菲红衣主教将在周日布道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 布道；训诫；启示；冗长的讲话
detailed_translations.english: a talk given as part of a Christian church service, usually on a religious or moral subject

name: fallow
trans: 休耕的：untilled；闲置的：not being in a state of use

sentences.english: They let the land lie fallow for a year.
sentences.chinese: 他们让土地休耕一年。

detailed_translations.english: fallow land is dug or  ploughed  but is not used for growing crops
land treated in this way
to leave (land) unseeded after ploughing and harrowing it

name: facile
trans: 表面的，浅尝辄止的：lack of depth；容易的，唾手可得的：easily accomplished

sentences.english: facile generalizations
sentences.chinese: 肤浅的概括

detailed_translations.english: a facile remark, argument etc is too simple and shows a lack of careful thought or understanding

sentences.english: I had eschewed politics in favour of a life practising law.
sentences.chinese: 我选择从事律师职业，有意避开了政治。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing or using something

name: static
trans: 静态的；停滞的：lack of movement；无改变的：little change

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is static does not move or change
noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

name: applicable
