trans: 可用的，可行的：put to use；相关的，有光的：having to do with；合适的，恰当的：meeting the requirements

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: surpass
trans: 超越，强于：become better；突破（界限、纪录等）：beyond the limit

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

name: hymn
trans: 赞歌，赞美诗：song of praise；赞美：proclaim the glory

sentences.english: He liked to sing hymns as he worked.
sentences.chinese: 他工作时喜欢唱赞美诗。

detailed_translations.english: a song of praise to God

name: lavish
trans: 奢侈的，大量的，无节制的：extravagance and profusion；挥霍，浪费：give readily carelessly

sentences.english: a royal palace on a lavish scale
sentences.chinese: 庞大的皇宫

detailed_translations.english: very generous
to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

name: verve
trans: n.(艺术作品的)神韵；(人)生机

sentences.english: He looked for the dramatic, like the sunset in this painting, and painted it with great verve.
sentences.chinese: 他追求画面的表现力—就像这幅画里的落日—而且创作时充满激情。

detailed_translations.english: energy, excitement, or great pleasure

sentences.english: Their political dogma has blinded them to the real needs of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们的政治教条使他们对国家的真正需求视而不见。

detailed_translations.english: a set of firm beliefs held by a group of people who expect other people to accept these beliefs without thinking about them

name: vault
trans: 跳起，跳跃：propel oneself upward；一跃而至：leaping suddenly

sentences.english: The robber vaulted over the counter and took $200 in cash.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫犯跃过柜台，抢走了200美元现金。

detailed_translations.english: a roof or ceiling that consists of several arches that are joined together, especially in a church
to jump over something in one movement, using your hands or a pole to help you

sentences.english: The magnificent beau is dancing to the light of chandeliers.
sentences.chinese: 这个衣着华丽的花花公子在枝形吊灯灯光下翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: These magnificent ancient buildings demonstrate the great intelligence of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这些壮丽的古代建筑显示了劳动人民的高度智慧。

name: engender
trans: 引起，使发展：cause；产生，出现：come into existence

sentences.english: In such circumstances, governments must do all they can to create and engender trust among its nation’s constituents and institutions.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，政府必须尽其所能在它的国家选民和公共机构之间创造和产生信任。

sentences.english: Retrospectives on the process and working practices regularly capture the lessons learned by the project and engender a culture of continuous process improvement within the project.
sentences.chinese: 对过程和工作实践的回顾有规律地捕捉从项目中得到的经验，并在项目中造成一个持续的过程改进的文化。

sentences.english: a measure intended to forestall further attacks
sentences.chinese: 意在预先阻止进一步攻击的措施

detailed_translations.chinese: 先发制人，预先阻止；垄断，屯积；领先；占先一步
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from happening or prevent someone from doing something by doing something first

name: alienate
trans: 使...疏远：unfriendly, hostile,indifferent；转让，让渡：convey or transfer

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

sentences.english: The first lecture I ever gave was a complete fiasco .
sentences.chinese: 我第一次讲课糟得一塌糊涂。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is completely unsuccessful, in a way that is very embarrassing or disappointing

name: scoff
trans: v.嘲笑；狼吞虎咽；n.嘲笑，笑柄
嘲笑：derision, mock；狼吞虎咽：eat greedily

sentences.english: ‘You, a scientist!’ he scoffed.
sentences.chinese: “就你，还科学家！”他讥笑道。

detailed_translations.english: an expression of derision
to laugh at a person or idea, and talk about them in a way that shows you think they are stupid

name: sober
trans: 严肃的：serious-looking；节制的：restraint；有理有据的：sound reasoning

sentences.english: He’s a nice guy when he’s sober.
sentences.chinese: 他没喝醉时是个不错的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: not drunk

name: lopsided
trans: 歪的，倾斜的：leaning；不平衡的，不协调的：lacking in balance

sentences.english: a lopsided 8-0 victory
sentences.chinese: 8比0一边倒的胜利

detailed_translations.english: unequal or uneven, especially in an unfair way

name: humiliate
trans: 羞辱，使丧失尊严：to a lower position

sentences.english: Her boss humiliated her in front of all her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她的老板在所有同事面前羞辱了她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed or stupid, especially when other people are present

name: hearten
trans: 给予鼓励，鼓舞：give strength courage, encourage

sentences.english: The news heartened everybody.
sentences.chinese: 这个消息鼓舞了每个人。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel happier and more hopeful

sentences.english: This caused issues in a DB2 V7 environment in that to go to another server, you had to "masquerade" as the original node and know their respective passwords.
sentences.chinese: 这在 DB2 V7 环境中会导致一些问题，为了恢复到另一台服务器，您必须“伪装”成原先的节点，并且要知道它们各自的密码。

sentences.english: What could a criminal do with a speech synthesis system that could masquerade as a human being?
sentences.chinese: 想想看如果罪犯利用完美的语音合成系统伪装成别人会怎么样？

detailed_translations.english: to pretend to be something or someone different
a formal dance or party where people wear  mask s  and unusual clothes

detailed_translations.chinese: 长篇大论；高谈阔论；热烈的演说
向…滔滔不绝地演讲；大声训斥

name: converge
trans: 汇集，交汇于一点：move toward one

sentences.english: The two rivers converge into one near Pittsburgh.
sentences.chinese: 这两条河在匹兹堡附近汇合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会合， 互相靠拢； 聚集， 集中； 趋近
detailed_translations.english: to come from different directions and meet at the same point to become one thing

sentences.english: She was always a very amenable child.
sentences.chinese: 她一向是个很听话的孩子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有责任的：顺从的，服从的；有义务的；经得起检验的
detailed_translations.english: willing to accept what someone says or does without arguing

name: ungainly
trans: 笨拙的，不雅的：inability in a graceful manner

sentences.english: a tall ungainly teenager
sentences.chinese: 一个动作笨拙的高个子少年

detailed_translations.english: moving in a way that does not look graceful

name: aggressive
trans: 好斗的：attack; 强有力的，强烈的：forcefulness

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: purity
trans: 纯净；纯洁，纯在：clean, morally pure

sentences.english: the purity of tap water
sentences.chinese: 自来水的纯净度

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["spiritual purity"]}
sentences.chinese: 心灵的纯洁

detailed_translations.english: the quality or state of being pure

sentences.english: For each title there is a brief synopsis of the book.
sentences.chinese: 每本书都附有一个该书的简短提要。

detailed_translations.english: a short description of the main events or ideas in a book, film etc

name: monotonous
trans: （声音）单调的：unvarying tone；清一色的，无聊的：tediously unvarying

sentences.english: a monotonous diet
sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

detailed_translations.english: boring because of always being the same

sentences.english: Slaves were emancipated in 1834.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶于1834年获得了解放。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the political or legal rights that they did not have before

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

sentences.english: He ran across the courtyard, dodging a storm of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 他跑过院子，躲避雨点般的子弹。

detailed_translations.english: to move quickly to avoid someone or something
to deliberately avoid discussing something or doing something

detailed_translations.chinese: 托辞， 伎俩； 躲闪， 躲避
detailed_translations.english: something dishonest that is done to avoid a rule or law

name: elaborate
trans: a.精致的，复杂的；v.详尽地说明，阐明
详细的，复杂的：complexity；详细阐述：in detail

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

sentences.english: the symmetry of the design
sentences.chinese: 图案的对称性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being symmetrical

sentences.english: It exasperates me to hear comments like that.
sentences.chinese: 听到那样的评论令我恼怒。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very annoyed by continuing to do something that upsets them

name: entangle
trans: 使卷入，使纠缠：twist confused mass；使变复杂或困难：complex or difficult

sentences.english: Bureaucracy can entangle applications for months.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义会使申请耽搁数月之久。

detailed_translations.english: to involve someone in an argument, a relationship, or a situation that is difficult to escape from

name: inventory
trans: 存货清单：list all goods；（包含要点的）简介：short statement

sentences.english: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
sentences.chinese: …为每艘游艇配备12张帆的存货。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细目录， 存货清单
detailed_translations.english: a list of all the things in a place

sentences.english: She smoothed the creases from her skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她捋平裙子上的皱褶。

sentences.english: I’ll have to iron out the creases.
sentences.chinese: 我得把皱褶熨平。

detailed_translations.english: a line on a piece of cloth, paper etc where it has been folded, crushed, or pressed
to become marked with a line or lines, or to make a line appear on cloth, paper etc by folding or crushing it

sentences.english: The Chinese revered corn as a gift from heaven.
sentences.chinese: 中国人将谷物奉为天赐礼物。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something very much

sentences.english: a big tax swindle
sentences.chinese: 巨额税款诈骗

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone gets money by deceiving someone else
to get money from someone by deceiving them

name: ingenuous
trans: 天真纯朴的：lacking cunning；坦白的：straightforward

sentences.english: He seemed too ingenuous for a reporter.
sentences.chinese: 他好像太天真诚实，不适合做记者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 天真的；坦白的；正直的；朴实的
detailed_translations.english: an ingenuous person is simple, trusting, and honest, especially because they have not had much experience of life

name: banish
trans: 驱逐出境：leave, country; 赶出：force out

sentences.english: John was banished from England.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被逐出英国。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow someone or something to stay in a particular place

name: flamboyant
trans: 艳丽夺目的，炫耀的，充满装饰的：strikingly elaborate

sentences.english: He lifted his arms in a flamboyant gesture .
sentences.chinese: 他抬起胳膊，做了个炫耀的手势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 艳丽的；火焰似的；炫耀的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a confident or exciting way that makes people notice you

name: retort
trans: （尤指机智的）回应，回答：quick, witty reply

sentences.english: He was about to make a sharp retort .
sentences.chinese: 他正要尖刻地反驳。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry or humorous reply
to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

sentences.english: the strident calls of seagulls
sentences.chinese: 海鸥尖厉的叫声

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺耳的；尖锐的；吱吱尖叫的；轧轧作响的
detailed_translations.english: a strident sound or voice is loud and unpleasant

name: startle
trans: 使吓一跳，使大吃一惊：frighten or surprise

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

name: sterile
trans: a.贫瘠且无植被的；不孕的；无细菌的
贫瘠的：not productive；无菌的：free from bacteria

sentences.english: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 这些教室毫无生气，墙上一张画都没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

sentences.english: He received a humiliating rebuff from his manager.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到经理的断然拒绝，十分丢脸。

sentences.english: His proposals have already been rebuffed by the governor.
sentences.chinese: 他的建议已被州长拒绝了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断然拒绝；回绝；漠不关心
detailed_translations.english: an unkind or unfriendly answer to a friendly suggestion or offer of help
If you rebuff someone or rebuff a suggestion that they make, you refuse to do what they suggest

name: orthodox
trans: 传统的：established form, custom, or rules

sentences.english: orthodox medical treatments
sentences.chinese: 传统疗法

sentences.english: He challenged the orthodox views on education.
sentences.chinese: 他对传统的教育观念提出了质疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正统的；传统的；惯常的；东正教的
detailed_translations.english: orthodox ideas, methods, or behaviour are accepted by most people to be correct and right

name: suspend
trans: 暂停，中止：bring to a formal close；悬挂：hang

sentences.english: Sales of the drug will be suspended until more tests are completed.
sentences.chinese: 这种药品在完成进一步检验之前将暂停销售。

sentences.english: Talks between the two countries have now been suspended.
sentences.chinese: 两国间的对话现已中止。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

name: denounce
trans: 公开指责：public or formal disapproval；宣称…道德上错误、可耻：morally wrong

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

sentences.english: Her face was transfigured with joy.
sentences.chinese: 她高兴得容光焕发。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使变形；使改观；美化；理想化
detailed_translations.english: to change the way someone or something looks, especially so that they become more beautiful

name: tentative
trans: 暂时性的，尝试的：not fully developed

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

name: encumber
trans: 阻碍，妨碍：impede；给…增添负担：place burden

sentences.english: He died in 1874, heavily encumbered by debt.
sentences.chinese: 他于1874年去世，负债累累。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for you to do something or for something to happen

sentences.english: Not that hoary old chestnut (= old idea, joke, remark etc ) again.
sentences.chinese: 别再说那老掉牙的话了。

detailed_translations.english: grey or white in colour, especially through age

sentences.english: the solemnity of a great religious occasion
sentences.chinese: 重大宗教场合的庄严肃穆

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being serious in behaviour or manner

sentences.english: When they first saw each other in royal clothing, the fine robes and shining crowns for their coronation, that was when they fell in love.
sentences.chinese: 当他们第一次看到对方穿着王室的衣服——为他们的加冕礼而穿戴的精美的袍子和华丽的王冠——时，那就是他们坠入爱河的时候。

sentences.english: What they regarded as the end of life was the very preparation for coronation; for Christ was silent that He might live again in tenfold power.
sentences.chinese: 她们所认为的生命末日，殊不知正是加冕大典的筹备过程；基督之所以静默安息，是为了在再醒时能增加十倍的力量。

sentences.english: But the world began to warm in 1650; when Charles II was crowned king of England in 1660, the coronation sparked the Enlightenment era in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 但是从1650年开始，全球开始转暖，当查理二世于1660年在英国即位时，他的加冕礼成为启动欧洲启蒙时代的转机。

detailed_translations.english: the ceremony at which someone is officially made king or queen

name: husk
trans: （果类或谷物的）外壳：outer covering；剥去：remove

sentences.english: There you are, in the coffin, or in an urn, your body reduced to a husk of meant-to-be's.
sentences.chinese: 你现在是这副样子，躺在棺材里，或者骨灰盒里。 你的身体沦为一张毫无意思的臭皮囊。

sentences.english: All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.
sentences.chinese: 在一切离俗的日子，凡葡萄树上结的，自核至皮所作的物，都不可吃。

sentences.english: How can we remove the husk of the grains?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样去掉谷物的外皮？

detailed_translations.english: to remove the husks from grains, seeds etc
the dry outer part of corn, some grains, seeds, nuts etc

sentences.english: She got a round of applause (=  a short period of applause  ) when she finished.
sentences.chinese: 她结束的时候获得一阵掌声。

detailed_translations.english: the sound of many people hitting their hands together and shouting, to show that they have enjoyed something

name: cursory
trans: 匆忙的，不注意细节的：excessive or careless speed

sentences.english: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.
sentences.chinese: 伯克粗略瞥了眼菜单，然后啪地合上了。

detailed_translations.english: done very quickly without much attention to details

name: ethos
trans: n.(个人、团体或民族)道德风貌，思潮，信仰
道德准则：code of good conduct

sentences.english: a community in which people lived according to an ethos of sharing and caring
sentences.chinese: 人们本着分享与关爱精神来生活的社区

detailed_translations.chinese: 民族精神；气质；社会思潮

sentences.english: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

sentences.english: ...the dreams of democracy that have so tantalized them.
sentences.chinese: …让他们可望而不可及的民主梦想。

detailed_translations.english: to show or promise something that someone really wants, but then not allow them to have it

name: committed
trans: a.(对事业，本职工作等)尽忠的

sentences.english: The party has a core of committed supporters.
sentences.chinese: 该党派有一批坚定的支持者。

sentences.english: I would advise people to think very carefully about committing themselves to working Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 我会建议人们认真考虑答应周日工作。

sentences.english: I'd like a friendship that might lead to something deeper, but I wouldn't want to commit myself too soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想要可能发展到更深层关系的友谊，但我不想太快做出承诺。

sentences.english: He won't commit.
sentences.chinese: 他不会承诺。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚定的；效忠的；承担义务的
detailed_translations.english: willing to work very hard at something

detailed_translations.chinese: 承诺；委托；干坏事；付诸（commit的过去分词）
detailed_translations.english: If you commit yourself to something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you commit yourself to someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them.

name: mute
trans: a.沉默的；v.减弱声音；n.弱音器
不说话的，缄默的：refraining from speech；使颜色，音调等柔和：soften；减弱声音：muffle the sound

sentences.english: Billy continued to stand there, mute and defiant.
sentences.chinese: 比利还是站在那儿一声不吭，一副不服气的样子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mute does not speak, or refuses to speak
to make the sound of something quieter, or make it disappear completely
a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer

sentences.english: the wicked stepmother in ‘Hansel and Gretel’
sentences.chinese: 《糖果屋》中那个恶毒的继母

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

sentences.english: An official protest could carry considerable clout .
sentences.chinese: 正式的抗议可能具有相当大的影响力。

detailed_translations.english: power or the authority to influence other people’s decisions
to hit someone or something hard

name: sham
trans: 欺瞒：deceitfulness；掩饰，假装：present a false appearance；虚假的：fake

sentences.english: The elections were a complete sham.
sentences.chinese: 这次大选完全是一场骗局。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is not what they are claimed to be – used to show disapproval
to pretend to be upset, ill etc to gain sympathy or an advantage
made to appear real in order to deceive people

name: agreeable
trans: a.令人喜悦的；欣然同意的
令人愉悦的：pleasing to the mind or senses；随和的：easygoing and pleasing manner；相一致：in harmony

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

sentences.english: his sparse brown hair
sentences.chinese: 他那稀疏的棕色头发

sentences.english: rural areas with sparse populations
sentences.chinese: 人口稀少的农村地区

detailed_translations.english: existing only in small amounts

name: rustic
trans: 乡下人，头脑简单的人：awkward or simple person；乡村的：open areas with few buildings；粗俗的：lacking polish

sentences.english: The village had a certain rustic charm .
sentences.chinese: 这个村庄有一种迷人的田园风情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的
detailed_translations.english: simple, old-fashioned, and not spoiled by modern developments, in a way that is typical of the countryside
someone from the country, especially a farm worker

name: versatile
trans: 多才多艺的，全能的：different things；易改变的：fluctuating readily

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: precarious
trans: 危险的，不稳定的：lacking security, stability；可疑的，不明确的：uncertain

sentences.english: Her health remained precarious, despite the treatment.
sentences.chinese: 她尽管接受了治疗，但健康状况还是不稳定。

sentences.english: the company’s precarious financial position
sentences.chinese: 公司岌岌可危的财务状况

detailed_translations.english: a precarious situation or state is one which may very easily or quickly become worse

name: finale
trans: n.最后，最终；乐曲的最后部分

sentences.english: the finale of a Broadway show
sentences.chinese: 一出百老汇表演的终场

sentences.english: a game with a dramatic finale
sentences.chinese: 结局颇具戏剧性的一场比赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 结局；终曲；最后一场；最后乐章；尾声
detailed_translations.english: the last part of a piece of music or of a show, event etc

name: doodle
trans: （无目的）地乱涂乱画：aimlessly；漫无目的地打发时光：aimless activity

sentences.english: He looked across at Jackson, doodling on his notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他一边看着对面的杰克逊，一边在笔记本上信手涂鸦。

sentences.english: Dillworthy was staring into space, with a scrawl of doodles on the pad in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 迪尔沃西凝望着天空，面前的纸上满是涂鸦。

detailed_translations.english: When someone doodles, they draw doodles
A doodle is a pattern or picture that you draw when you are bored or thinking about something else

name: interim
trans: n.中间时期，过渡时期；a.暂时的
中间过渡时期，间隔：time between event；暂时的：for the time being

sentences.english: an interim report
sentences.chinese: 中期报告

sentences.english: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
sentences.chinese: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。

sentences.english: An interim government was established.
sentences.chinese: 一个临时政府成立了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

detailed_translations.chinese: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two events

name: refute
trans: 否认：declare not to be true；证明为假，证伪：prove wrong

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: incumbent
trans: n.在职者，现任者；a.义不容辞的
义不容辞的，必须的：obligation duty

sentences.english: In the June elections, Morris easily defeated the incumbent, Tom Smith.
sentences.chinese: 在6月的大选中，莫里斯轻松击败了在任的汤姆·史密斯。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected to an official position, especially in politics, and who is doing that job at the present time

name: impeccable
trans: 无罪的：free from sin；无暇的，无可挑剔的：free from fault

sentences.english: She has taught her children impeccable manners.
sentences.chinese: 她把她的孩子教育得举止十分得体。

sentences.english: a bar with impeccable service
sentences.chinese: 服务无可挑剔的酒吧

detailed_translations.english: without any faults and impossible to criticize

name: consequence
trans: 结果：produced by cause；重要性，价值：importance

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

sentences.english: We must instill a sense of duty in our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在我们的孩子当中灌输一种责任感。

sentences.english: I aim to instill in them the pleasure of giving.
sentences.chinese: 我的目的在于灌输给他们给予的乐趣。

sentences.english: an oath of allegiance
sentences.chinese: 效忠宣誓

sentences.english: The people here have strong political allegiances .
sentences.chinese: 这里的民众政治忠诚度很高。

detailed_translations.english: loyalty to a leader, country, belief etc

sentences.english: He pleaded guilty to six felonies.
sentences.chinese: 他承认犯了6项重罪。

detailed_translations.english: a serious crime such as murder

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.english: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

name: vindictive
trans: 复仇的，有寻仇倾向的：seek revenge

sentences.english: a bitter and vindictive old man
sentences.chinese: 充满仇恨和报复心的老人

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀恨的；有报仇心的；惩罚的
detailed_translations.english: unreasonably cruel and unfair towards someone who has harmed you

name: inexorable
trans: a.不为所动的；坚决不变的
无法劝阻的，不为所动的：not persuaded

sentences.english: the inexorable decline of Britain’s manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 英国制造业无可挽回的衰落

sentences.english: the seemingly inexorable rise in crime
sentences.chinese: 似乎无法遏止的犯罪率上升势头

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；不屈不挠的；不可阻挡的；无法改变的
detailed_translations.english: an inexorable process cannot be stopped

name: absolute
trans: a.绝对的，完全的; 无(条件)限制的
专制的：unconstrained; 无限的unqualified; 完美的，纯净不惨杂的：free from imperfection, mixture; 不容置疑的，确凿的：unquestionable

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: tender
trans: v.(希望对方接受的意见等)
正式提出：offer；考虑周到的，关心同情的：sympathy consideration

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

name: paradox
trans: n.矛盾；似矛盾而正确的说法
表面矛盾实际可能正确的话，悖论：opposed to commonsense

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: desiccate
trans: 使（食物）脱水以保存，使干燥：drying；使缺乏活力：deprive vitality

sentences.english: The device was able to desiccate the salty water and to condense the moisture into drinkable water.
sentences.chinese: 这个装置能先把盐水蒸干，再让水蒸气冷凝成可饮用的水。

sentences.english: Although many bdelloids live in desiccation-prone habitats, such as ephemeral ponds, there are substantial numbers found in permanently aquatic habitats that are unable to desiccate.
sentences.chinese: 尽管许多轮虫生活在干燥的栖息地，如短时间的小水塘，但是有许多轮虫却生活在不会干涸的多水环境里。

sentences.english: Tympanic center leaves the alveolus of one desiccate.
sentences.chinese: 鼓膜中心则留下一变干的小孔。

sentences.english: Corrupt government officials were extorting money from him.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的政府官员那时正向他勒索钱财。

detailed_translations.english: to illegally force someone to give you something, especially money, by threatening them

name: phenomenal
trans: 不寻常的，非凡的：out of the ordinary

sentences.english: the phenomenal success of computer games in recent years
sentences.chinese: 近年来电脑游戏的惊人成功

sentences.english: He has learned a phenomenal amount in the last two years.
sentences.chinese: 过去的两年中他学到了许多东西。

sentences.english: The results have been phenomenal.
sentences.chinese: 成果是非凡的。

detailed_translations.english: very great or impressive

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: relapse
trans: n.旧病复发；再恶化；v.旧病复发，再恶化

sentences.english: "I wish I did," said Phil Jordan, relapsing into his usual gloom.
sentences.chinese: “我要是做了就好了，”菲尔•乔丹说着，回到平时的忧郁中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故态复萌；旧病复发；再度堕落；再陷邪道
detailed_translations.english: to become ill again after you have seemed to improve

detailed_translations.chinese: 复发，再发；故态复萌；回复原状
detailed_translations.english: when someone becomes ill again after having seemed to improve

sentences.english: Could you just jot his name on there?
sentences.chinese: 你能就把他的名字简单记在那儿吗？

detailed_translations.english: If you jot something short such as an address somewhere, you write it down so that you will remember it

sentences.english: glistening black hair
sentences.chinese: 乌黑发亮的头发

detailed_translations.english: to shine and look wet or oily

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

name: commensurate
trans: 同样大小的：equal; 相称的，相当的：proportionate

sentences.english: Employees are paid salaries commensurate with those of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 发给雇员的薪水与发给教师的薪水相当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相称的；同量的；同样大小的
detailed_translations.english: matching something in size, quality, or length of time

sentences.english: The gobble sound, from the male turkeys, on the other hand, sounds exactly like you’d expect from the name and they do this all the time.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面来说，雄火鸡发出的咯咯声听上去绝对就是你从它们的名字就能预料到的那样，而火鸡一直如此。

detailed_translations.english: to make a sound like a  turkey
the loud rapid gurgling sound made by male turkeys

sentences.english: a needy family
sentences.chinese: 贫困家庭

sentences.english: There will be efforts to get larger amounts of food to the needy.
sentences.chinese: 将努力把更多的食品送给穷人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 贫困的；贫穷的；生活艰苦的
detailed_translations.english: having very little food or money
The needy are people who are needy

name: panacea
trans: 万能药，万灵药：remedy for all ills

sentences.english: Trade is not a panacea for the world's economic or social ills.
sentences.chinese: 贸易不是世界经济或社会弊端的万灵丹。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is a panacea for a set of problems, you mean that it will solve all those problems

sentences.english: an inanimate object
sentences.chinese: 无生命的物体

detailed_translations.english: not living

sentences.english: Crowds often feel sympathy for the underdog.
sentences.chinese: 观众经常会同情弱者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛中不被看好者；失败者；受压迫者；斗败了的狗

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

name: constrain
trans: 限制：restriction；使人屈服于（压力、感情）等：give in to pressure

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

sentences.english: It’s limited only by your ingenuity!
sentences.chinese: 被束缚的仅仅是你的独创性！

sentences.english: Sitting with my IV drip, I like to think about all the human labour and ingenuity that come together in this medical moment.
sentences.chinese: 坐在那里进行着静脉点滴，我想到了所有的人类劳动和独创性在这一时刻汇聚到了一起。

sentences.english: And as the president said last week, no one should bet against the American worker, American business and American ingenuity.
sentences.chinese: 此外，正如总统上周所言，任何人都不应该小看美国的工人、美国的企业和美国的独创性。

name: integral
trans: a.构成整体所必需的；完整的
构成整体所必需的：essential；完整的：not lacking any part

sentences.english: Rituals, celebrations, and festivals form an integral part of every human society.
sentences.chinese: 仪式、庆典和节日是每个人类社会不可缺少的组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

name: ambivalent
trans: a.(对人或物)有矛盾看法的

sentences.english: As a group, they are ambivalent about whether the quality of online content would suffer if companies could not charge for it—34% think so while 30% do not; and the remaining 36% have no firm opinion.
sentences.chinese: 对于如果网站对内容不收费这些内容的质量是否会变差的调查有矛盾：34%的人认为会变差，同时30%的认为不会，而36%的人没有固定的意见。

sentences.english: Looking back on it, I can see how the statement looked ambivalent and a touch arrogant, but it was an honest expression of how I felt, as I began the first campaign since 1982 that I could have lost.
sentences.chinese: 现在回头想想，我能够看出，在这个声明中，我所流露出的矛盾心理和些许的傲慢，但它确实是我内心感受的真实表达，因为这是自1982年以来，我第一次开始进行可能会失利的竞选活动。

detailed_translations.english: not sure whether you want or like something or not

sentences.english: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
sentences.chinese: 关闭学校是大家一致通过的决定。

sentences.english: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
sentences.chinese: 任命马特的决定几乎是一致通过的。

detailed_translations.english: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree

sentences.english: The company’s property may even be forfeit.
sentences.chinese: 公司财产甚至可能被没收。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罚金；没收物；丧失的东西
detailed_translations.english: something that is taken away from you or something that you have to pay, because you have broken a rule or made a mistake

detailed_translations.chinese: 因受罚而丧失的；被没收的
detailed_translations.english: to be legally or officially taken away from you as a punishment

detailed_translations.chinese: （因犯罪、失职、违约等）丧失（权利、名誉、生命等）

name: grate
trans: v.发出“吱嘎”声；磨碎；使人烦躁
刮擦（以发出刺耳的声音）：rasping；骚扰，惹恼：irritate

sentences.english: grated cheese
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的干酪

sentences.english: Peel and grate the potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 把马铃薯削皮磨碎。

detailed_translations.english: to rub cheese, vegetables etc against a rough or sharp surface in order to break them into small pieces
the metal bars and frame that hold the wood, coal etc in a  fireplace

name: boggle
trans: （因为怀疑、恐惧）犹豫：hesitate; 笨拙地做：unskillful way

sentences.english: We shouldn't boggle at this opportunity to make a profit.
sentences.chinese: 对这个赚钱的机会我们不应犹豫。

sentences.english: There is no reason why we should boggle at a capital gains tax.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有理由要对资本收益税犹豫不决。

name: gush
trans: （使）大量涌出：great volume；（使）情感强烈外溢：exaggerated display

sentences.english: All that pent-up frustration gushed out in a torrent of abuse.
sentences.chinese: 所有压抑着的失望与不快通过一阵痛骂全都发泄了出来。

detailed_translations.english: if words or emotions gush out, you suddenly express them very strongly
a large quantity of something, usually a liquid, that suddenly pours out of something

name: steep
trans: 浸泡：make wet；陡峭的：approaching perpendicular；过分的，过高的：beyond limit

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

name: addict
trans: 沉溺，上瘾：surrender, obsessively; 对某事上瘾的人：habitual liking

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Walt's meth-business partner, the addict Jesse, is still recovering from the drug-related death of his girlfriend Jane at the end of last season.
sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

name: etch
trans: 蚀刻；留下深刻印象，铭记：produce a vivid impression

sentences.english: A laser is used to etch a pattern in the smooth surface of the disc.
sentences.chinese: 激光器用于在光盘的光滑表面刻录图案。

detailed_translations.english: to cut lines on a metal plate, piece of glass, stone etc to form a picture or words

name: combustible
trans: 可燃的：igniting; 容易激动的：easily excited

sentences.english: The ability of coal to release a combustible gas has long been known.
sentences.chinese: 煤能够释放易燃气体这一点早已为人所知。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易燃的；易激动的；燃烧性的
detailed_translations.english: able to burn easily

sentences.english: I’d have asked more questions, but I didn’t want to seem inquisitive.
sentences.chinese: 我本想问更多的问题，但我不想看上去那么爱打听。

detailed_translations.chinese: 好奇的；好问的，爱打听的
detailed_translations.english: asking too many questions and trying to find out too many details about something or someone

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

name: hilarious
trans: a.充满欢乐的；引起大笑的

sentences.english: The focus is solely on the shirts and the hilarious design.
sentences.chinese: 这些注意力完全放在衣服和欢闹的设计上了。

sentences.english: But I love my awful life so much right now, that I find it hilarious when I am unable to convince anyone else of it.
sentences.chinese: 即时它摧毁了我的家，但现在十分我喜欢我糟糕的生活，当我不能使其他人确信是我发现它是欢闹的。

name: pitfall
trans: n.陷阱，未料到的危险或困难
陷阱：capture and hold animals；（不易察觉的）危害：hidden danger

sentences.english: the pitfalls associated with the purchase of a used car
sentences.chinese: 购买旧车时可能遇到的圈套

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that is likely to happen in a particular job, course of action, or activity

sentences.english: a play satirizing the fashion industry
sentences.chinese: 一部讽刺时装业的戏剧

detailed_translations.english: to use satire to make people see someone’s or something’s faults

name: flexible
trans: 灵活的，可变的：readily changed；易受影响的：susceptible to influence

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation
